2gIrOGeUQiIyH3OxYQnDiA.review_text: Alright, not going to lie... this review is a little bias. Not because I know the owner or anyone that works here, but because service got a little personal.   It was a bachelorette party with a group of 10 girls. Our host sat us upstairs in the back couches and right next to the bar. Our waitress brought us our 2 bottles, we made a couple of drinks, and headed to the dance floor. They started with 90s hip hop and R&B, which was perfect because that's what we grew up listening to. Once the music changed, we went back to our seats. But that's when the party really started. Want to know? This lady is keeping hush hush.   All the bartenders were REALLY attentive. Probably also because it was a bachelorette party, there were 10 of us, and we were all wearing extremely short skirts with really high heels. Special shout out to Julian for the love and making this group of ladies feel special. Also, special thanks to David for helping us organize the event, treating us with such great hospitality, and especially for the special treat.

F32lAShjmFRIz7RzP7tLoA.review_text: I had a great night at Raven's Bar! Really cool place. Things that sold me about this place:          -Easy street parking          -Free cover before 11p          -Hip-hop Friday nights          -DANCING          -3 Bars for drinking          -2 Floors for dancing          -Not your everyday, EDM, obnoxiously over crowded club  Went here on a Friday night. Online you can sign up on their guest list and there's no cover if you get in before 11pm.   The night started out when I touched down at SFO around 10pm. Clay picked me up from the airport and we took the 15min drive over to Raven's Bar. The area isn't filled with a bunch of clubs and is very low key, which was nice - it made parking extremely easy and we only had to walk 2 short blocks to the bar. The outside isn't much, small and quaint. Inside is small and tight at first but it opens up as you walk further in. I believe I counted a total of 3 bars. One when you first walk in, one in the back and one upstairs. This place is like a dive-lounge, it's an interesting feel. There looked like there was a small dance space downstairs, but we wanted to check out upstairs more. There's a long bar and then a small dance floor to the side covered by large tv's. They were playing music video's that matched up with the rad Hip-Hop that was bumpin' all night (totally fun & cool). The DJ was great! Good mix of old school and new school Hip-Hop, great dancin' music!  Bartenders were great! I was always able to grab a drink. All cocktails were about $10-11 a piece. All my drinks were strong and doing everything they were supposed to. The dance floor became really crowded, but it was an awesome crowd. I danced the whole night away with my man! And loved every minute of it! They had great music, lights and smoke at our feet. Which if you're going to fog the room, I like it at your feet vs.up in your air.   This may be my new favorite dancing spot in the city. It's fun, but low key at the same time. It makes it easy to disappear and go out dancing for the night without it becoming too big a deal. I would definitely recommend the Raven to anyone looking for a fun night out.

BpTLoouVfoON_fEpWbqIiQ.review_text: Table Reservation:  Tip) You don't need to get bottle service to get a table here which is awesome. Just gotta make a reservation in advance.   I wanted to get a table here for my boyfriend's birthday and got in contact with David. He promptly responded to my email within hours which I really appreciated and explained to me the process. However, it got kind of confusing when we were going back and forth about when my party was supposed to arrive. My boyfriend and I were scheduled to watch a show until 10:30pm at AT&T park so it was impossible for us to arrive by 10pm so I suggested that someone from our party will be there to hold our reservation then I was told everyone has to arrive by that time.  Ok, that'd be impossible.. then David said he can hold an "area" for us. I was utterly confused whether that was a table or not and turns out it wasn't an actual table. Um, I'm not going to pay for bottle service if we can't get a table just because not everyone will arrive there by 10pm. After several emails and a phone call, I decided not to get a table. I appreciate David's patience though.   It was WAAAAYYY crowded for me to handle. Everyone was shoulder to shoulder and the bar downstairs by the front door is so narrow that everyone walking by bumps into you and I almost dropped my drink. There is ONE bathroom stall in the bathroom downstairs... ONE! While waiting in line for the bathroom, a girl told me that that was a slow night. WHAT? I can't even go upstairs to check in my coat! There was literally a line just to go upstairs. We (7 of us) all just hung out downstairs by the smoking area since everywhere else was so damn crowded. The music was OK, mostly 90s hiphop.   We finally got to go upstairs towards the end of the night only to find out that they just have another bar and another ONE stall bathroom and they play the SAME music. Bleh.   I guess the place is popular due to their music selection, location, and the fact that you can reserve a table without bottle service but wow was it crowded. I wanted to go here because it was close to our hotel and we love dancing and they have a dance floor but what's the point if we can barely move around?

HKIskLgx4fM3XnoGkvJvRA.review_text: Josh, Dave, Jeff are the best  bartenders in the world -- a wonderful hangout spot.  Vince and Jonathan are excellent hotst -- a great place to hang out with friends.

t7M5Apw8zQt5zi5zyRERbQ.review_text: Love, love, love this place! Upstairs is fun on Friday nights, and 'Beat Repeat' on Thursdays is super chill!   Side note: 90's Diva Tribute Night was a HUGE let down. Why call it "90's Night" if you're only going to play a small handful of songs from that decade. Kinda of a joke when you've got divas (i.e. Mariah, Janet) on the flier and you don't even play songs from those divas.

nwKsR5_epCypSzGPsMn0HA.review_text: An low-key lounge but full of fun.  Super nice bartenders.  Great and strong cocktails.  Reasonable prices.  Good music.  They even have the dance floor at the second floor!    Definitely a great place to chill with friends and your date :-)

LsfNeGnvI0oopb5tAnWq9g.review_text: Yes, go here, drink lots, you won't regret the bill. I five-star-love this place. The atmosphere is wonderfully loungy with a cigar-bar kinda feel, there is a dance club upstairs for you to get your boogie on, they've got a smoking alley, wi-fi, happy hour and clean bathrooms.   But it's the drinks that make this place so utterly amazing. I'm convinced Dave the bartender can make any liquor (rum, whiskey, etc) taste great with his secret recipes and mad mixing skills.  just ask him - he'll whip you up a 'uh, well, i kinda want something with whiskey that's not too sweet that's kinda like this other drink' and a few shakes later *bam* - best drink of your life.

4iBBVojENJ8u_FBVnisfrg.review_text: I've been here at least a dozen times now and, crowded or not, I've always had a great time.  The first day I walked in, by myself, I was greeted amicably by the bartender (all of whom, I have come to realize, are very friendly).  Customer service here is obviously a priority and that is very important to me.  I don't care how great your cocktails are, if I walk into an establishment or up to a bar, I expect to be greeted by someone with basic social skills, not by some elitist @sshole.  It's imperative no matter how busy the joint is.  They're very consistent in this regard.  I think I've had every drink on the menu at this point.  Of course, some I like better than others, but they're all fantastic.  My favorite is the Castaway.  If you're not sure what to order, the bartender will gladly guide you to something delicious.  The second time I went in, I brought a friend (a habit I've developed) for happy hour.  We got through a few cocktails and were offered a free round.  What a nice gesture!  This is how it usually works at legit places: you are polite, you tip appropriately (AT LEAST $2 for every single drink - don't order three drinks and tip $2), and sometimes you get a free drink or two.  Don't get me wrong, I absolutely do not tip with the expectation of getting one on the house, but I've noticed it happens.  Again, a very nice gesture, and a smart one, because you tell your friends you found a kick ass spot, bring them in and benefit the business.  Regardless, the staff is amazing and they deserve to be tipped very well (no, I don't work here - I swear).  I don't know what else to say.  I love '90s night on Thursdays.  You can get some great eats from Triptych.  It's a popular, yet personable establishment, which is what makes Raven rare.  I know the names of most bartenders.  I've patronized every night of the week and the crowd (if there even is one) has always been completely chill.  This is not Holy Cow.  Cheers!

d8Ud_92PhBY9MPwHHs1MJQ.review_text: Great new cocktail lounge in SoMa.  The lighting is beautiful, the bartenders are friendly, and the cocktails inventive and delicious.  The new Raven has a number of new takes on classic cocktails and a couple of totally original inventions.  They've put heavy emphasis on fresh ingredients in the cocktails and the beer pours are very generous.  Can't recommend this place enough for a chill weeknight or a rockin' weekend.

9qO7rFkXRJ-xyjOwwT545Q.review_text: If you haven't already heard of or danced at Raven Bar (though I always call it Raven Lounge because it just has that great sort of atmosphere), then you should hop to it!   I absolutely love the service, drinks, and music here! I first discovered Raven for my birthday back in February, and getting a response to reserve a table was fast and helpful. David was really flexible and helpful in suggesting the type of space to reserve (booths versus tables) based on the range in guests I was expecting. Jeff and Cherine were the awesome bartenders that night, and mixed up some great cocktails.  Fast forward a couple of months to May, and I was able to call in a few hours beforehand and reserve a table for my graduation celebration (they were able to fit us in earlier in the night before another reservation kicked in).   I've taken mixed groups of all personalities (pretty reserved to party animals) and ages (college peers to folks in their 30s), and everyone has found something for them. I think it helped that we went on friday nights, when they have their 90s - present music video hits playing, which provides a variety that anyone can shake their groove thang to.

kszDZaD5pmfVRcIK0BhJFA.review_text: Went here on a former co-worker's farewell / bday party.  I enjoyed the music selection that night where they played throwback 90's - early 2000's Hip / Hop, R&B jams.  Seeing the music videos added the nostalgic feeling.  I don't know it was me but the Friday was there was an all Asian night.  Interesting though. Besides that it was great getting to the club after 10pm where they didn't have a cover charge.  Big plus where you don't feel herded into the club and waiting in line for overprice drinks.  Drinks were definitely stiff as you get bang for the buck.     It's nice having 3 different bar and a separate enclosed smoking lounge.  It's a little bit everything no matter what you taste is.  Will definitely return again.  Plenty of street parking.  Always good driving your low keyed car as parking can always be tough in the city.

vrCw-dkDfxgpcRPEwW0fQg.review_text: "Let's go to Raven!" is one of those statements that carries equal amounts of excitement and anxiety  :)  This is a fun place, and one I love going to - but be sure that the following day is going to be rough!  It's a lounge/bar with dancing upstairs.  The staff is awesomely friendly, there's a front bar, a back bar (that can be reserved for special occasions), an upstairs bar with dancing (hella fun), and even a little smoking patio tucked away in the alley, where you can bring your drinks.  They make great cocktails (try the switch blade), serve food from nearby Triptych (bacon wrapped dates!),  and have a decent beer selection.  Ultimately a great place that gets a fair amount of attention from those of us that work in the area in particular.

JAFgOs6sMkZEE_nmwHXejw.review_text: I'm gonna Wreck It!   Arrive early because this place fills up fast. If you put your name on the guest list, which is super easy via their website, you get in free before 11:00. The front bar area is very narrow. We were piled up 3 deep waiting for them to get our bottle service area set up. There is a larger area in the back and an upstairs with a DJ, bar and area for bottle service. Once our Wreck It Ralph party of 20 area was ready upstairs, we had a blast. Clean, comfy couches and plenty of servers. The music and lighting that the DJ was kicking out was perfect. There was even a large screen on the wall displaying music videos.   As for the drinks, $9 seems a little steep for a rum & Coke. But hey, you are in San Francisco. At least it was strong & easily obtained. I would definitely come back, theme party or not.   Remember when I said to get there early? We left at 11:30 and there was a healthy line to get upstairs and an even more impressive line around the block to get in the front door.

KKt2eXmP8fGarmAP5GqDig.review_text: There is no surprise no one buys bottle service from Raven.  1) Security guards - unhelpful, rude and disrespectful. (Andy Caniezo)  2) David Lu - when given a problem with a guest, especially when it reoccurs often since coat check is upstairs. There should be a set resolution to help assist guests. Instead he turned to the rude security guards that gave us a hard time and no way to retrieve our coat.   3) maintenance - upstairs bathroom is for both women & men. Pushed by security to move forward, but when unable to move situation turned into arguments and unneeded roughness.

2P3HE3f-RmIQX842L9COgg.review_text: Stiff drinks (that's JAMESON right thurrr, right thurrr) and continuous play of today's top 40, 90s best, and various dance and hip hop classics.  Everyone is relatively friendly, sans a few passive-aggressive single men trying to party with any lady they find standing alone.  All that make for a pretty good, random night in the city.  I'm not much for the dance scene often, but coming here with my best gal pals turned this place into a very inviting and fun venue.  Raven Bar is a two story dance lounge with THREE BARS (one upstairs) and a narrow outdoor patio.  This is NOT A CLUB, so come here easily dressed.  No fuss, no questions.  Bouncer at the door checks IDs real quick and easy, and off you go with NO COVER into the musical hustle and bustle.  There are MUSIC VIDEOS err'where, occasional fog machine blasts upstairs, and constant beats and movement.  Each floor sports two small yet spacious dance floors.  Most seats though are reserved booths, but there are a fair amount of bar stools around for your convenience and comfort.    Upstairs barmen will reward you if you seem to be having a good time.  My friend was dancing in place while patiently waiting for her umpteenth round of drinks, and they all like "Heeey, yea girl!  You's real cool."  Staff overall is really nice and good looking too if you're searching for some eye candy.  Feel free to give 'em a quick kiss on the cheek for funzies and in gratitude.  Tip well too.  Coat check upstairs will cost $7, just so you know.  And oh yea, you can party like it's 1999 on Thursdays.  That promotional poster made me laugh.  Dance like you ain't worried of Y2K!

wPNMdeGobIsd-crZLERiLA.review_text: This place is so freaken tiny. I've been here 3 times and the music, crowd, drinks.. have always been the same. I know this place is supposed to be a "bar", but apparently on saturdays it becomes raven CLUB.   I had fun the few times I've been here, but that's probably because I had a good amount to drink. I really don't like the dj's that have been playing here though. They DON'T take song requests and they play the WHOLE damn 3 minutes of a song. It's really annoying, even for someone who isn't sober.   There are two floors; downstairs for you to chill, and upstairs for you to dance. Primarily Asian spot, but there are still others who aren't. $10 cover after 11. If you're not claustrophobic, I'd say you can give this place a try.

Valva2MGzBW8ux3641YINA.review_text: I am tempted to give them a 5! ok 4.5 for you! Thanks Yelp for introducing me to this place. I told my friend about the fun time I had and she decided to have her birthday there last night. The DJ again amazing with old 90s hits! Dance floor full of fog, not over crowded but not empty, enough windows and fans goings so wasn't dying of heat stroke...Today back ache and hangover= Damn good night from what I remember at least. I'm old.

bV4m22UFyuNYC8vvQUgFwA.review_text: I like the music; 90's hip-hop and old school top 40's pop mash ups (the dj rocks),  hate the cigarette smell that clouds the entire first floor,  and how packed it can get around 11-12pm.   I really despise the elbow-to-elbow environment.  Reminds me of Infusion Lounge. GAHHHHH!  Better crowd/capacity control is much needed.    Oh,  and what is the point of getting stamped on our wrists when there is a sign that says "There are no In's and Out's"?  It's really dumb bc I actually think having in's and out's will help create space a little bit.

fWq6bWCqDaGy7qCRvmv83g.review_text: I got here a little early for a friend's birthday celebration, so I hung out at the bar for a little bit chatting with the bartenders. If the bar's not too busy (and it will get busy!) they'll take the time to chat about the drink menu, what alcohol they have available, and what they recommend based on your drinking habits.   I had the vampire slayer, which is a whiskey cocktail - sweet and citrusy but with enough alcohol so that you feel the burn. The bartender definitely gave me a little extra alcohol for this one. And she complimented what I was wearing.. needless to say, she went home with a hefty tip!  Next I tried the switchblade. A spicy cocktail, with a hint of sweetness, and a Tequila base. Very interesting blend, and something that I would recommend.  Also tried tastes of what my friends were having, but don't really remember the drinks' names. Regardless of what you order, you can rest assured that they won't skimp on the alcohol!  The DJ was killing it, a good mix of 90s/00s Billboard hits, as well as some current Top-40 songs. There's a dance floor upstairs, but we never made it up because we had a booth with too many bags/coats/etc to watch over. The first floor was still popping though, I was having a blast.  Definitely going to be back here if I'm up in SF.

LikzZL2O64FzmMniu34LMQ.review_text: I went here for an event, so I guess it wasn't exactly a typical night?   It was a nice enough space, pretty dingy in the back room, and I didn't make it upstairs. Watching 90s music videos on the multiple TV screens was fun. Lots of drunk women dancing interestingly... Drinks were good and bartenders were all pleasant.   The good state of the restroom is probably the main reason I'm a fan. Too many bars are ruined by their nightmarish bathrooms; this, as far as I saw, isn't one of them.

WpCW366f95XBYzXxq0SmZQ.review_text: I had a blast here on a Friday night for a celebratory dance fest. My friend finished her master's, and Raven actually put up a Congrats banner and personalized congrats signs. Well done, Raven. Well done, indeed.  We made a reservation for the booth upstairs, which was a good move. The dance floor got a little packed, so it was nice to be able to sneak out and sit for a few.   My two complaints:  The music was intermittently good. Other times, it was downright bad.  The security guards: I liked that they were present, but I did not like how they would just appear behind me sometimes. Spooky.  The good: good energy, we had a great time. The bad: see above, yo.

QFJuSMHgnbDrNona7FQ9jQ.review_text: Went here for my bestfriend's birthday.  It's probably one of the better bars in SoMa. Drinks aren't too expensive, the music is great and cover is affordable.  If you are looking for a place that plays throwbacks and your fair share of ratchet music, then this is definitely the place for you.  The music had us dancing all night long.  We usually have the urge to leave to other bars but the music kept us here all night long.    Their specialty cocktails are also amazing!  I don't know the name in particular but there is a ginger and gin cocktail that is to die for!  The cherry popper is also pretty good!  The one thing I will say about their drinks, is that they do hold back on the alcohol.  Everything is measured with caution.   As for the crowd.  It's a pretty homogenous crowd.   A lot of Asians with bouts of others here and there. Definitely not a bad thing but if you're looking for a mixed crowd, then keep on looking. Monarch is just down the street.

5j3PKTlLSi01jT1WMLb3RA.review_text: This place is a gem!  Two stories, no cover till 11pm, 90's hip hop and old school blaring, cute bartenders, good crowd of people. I love it here! I'll be coming back here more often : )

13hZuW08EtmDzyqGcxIssg.review_text: Hours posted are lies. It says closes at 2am but they do not let anyone in after 1am. We dropped by here at 1:10am but security would not let anyone in at all, regardless of others leaving the bar already.

QCA39ADoeLbFBeV1kRHkfQ.review_text: This place is awesome. It gets packed quick.

Mjk19b2GiawaUKXrY7pcWQ.review_text: Recently had a birthday event here on a Saturday night that went smashingly. I made reservations two weeks in advance for two 10-person booths, and they held them with no charge and no minimum. For comparison, I shopped around at a few other comparable bars... Many had at least $1000 drink minimum / reserved charges for a group of 20, or charged a flat fee for the space.  On the day of the event, the other birthday boy and I showed up to find welcoming bartenders who had even decorated our booths with balloons and a happy birthday sign.  I tried at least a sip of most cocktails on the menu, and honestly think they have a fun / creative mix that still all makes sense with their overall theme. And each of the main bartenders has their own signature drink, all of which we loved.  Kudos to you guys and gals @ Raven for making a great cocktail hour at the beginning of our birthday festivities. You rock.

2xb2kHnC-mFhtGggWBhZFQ.review_text: I'm appreciative-- but a bit wary-- of all the security and signs mentioning the free coat check. Do they expect/experience a lot of problems with people's behavior or belongings?  We went for a friend's birthday party on Saturday and while it was quiet and easy to get a drink from about 9:30-10, by 10:15 the crowds came in droves. Forget getting a drink- it will either take forever or make you need the restroom (which will also take forever, since they don't seem to have nearly enough for the people they stuff in this club like sardines).   I am not one to frequent dance clubs, so maybe I'm just the wrong audience, but by 10:30 it was, like... Outside-Lands-trying-to-reach-your-friends-at-­Paul-McCartney crowded. Fire codes be damned!   Raven, perhaps rightly (judging by the lines) prioritized constructing ladies' rooms, but with only one men's-only restroom downstairs, at one point the guys in our group faced a 25-minute wait to get back upstairs.   We escaped out the fire exit by 11:15 to see a line down the block.   I do think it was nice that they offer the coat check and guest lists for birthday groups (and I'll give a higher rating than my own experience on the benefit of the doubt for those who did seem to enjoy themselves), but the crowd deterred me from drinking or staying.

wZPizeBxMAyOSl0M0zuCjg.review_text: I happened to be here on a night when some house DJs were playing in the DJ booth in the back of the bar. I liked their music!  The space is really nice. The red lighting gives it a lounge-y feel in the back, though the front of the bar has more of a sports bar vibe.   The two bartenders were friendly and attentive.

zQxDUhxKOHdZygnNRZ-4ng.review_text: Came here for a networking event, it was extremely crowded.

drI9J9xeWephVGlfMC487w.review_text: It may just be my timing, which is always early evening/pre-dinner, but this place is always kind of empty. Especially when you compare it to the always bustling Bloodhound next door. That's really a shame, because the bartenders are friendly, efficient, and they know how to mix a good cocktail. Everytime I've been I've enjoyed myself. If you are in SOMA looking for someplace to kick back with an adult beverage, give Raven Bar a try. It's a really gorgeous space, and again, they have some great things to imbibe.

WWaopCICEUV30DO6mQOjpg.review_text: Raven is a great lounge-y bar. Very warm and beautifully decorated--fantastic lighting. Comfortable and intimate seating. Yummy cocktails made with the freshest ingredients. The place is new so I will definitely be back to see how it develops.

bcQPd5KGXZ23tOCLKbvfwg.review_text: WTF did I pay a $10 cover for? The d-bags working the door should've been enough for me to walk away, but I couldn't because I had friends who, unfortunately for them, had already paid their cover earlier.   This "club" is straight up ratchet. The term "ratchet" has been loosely thrown around recently, but I can't think of a more suitable adjective to describe Raven.   Look, I didn't have a terrible time at this place (that's not to say it wasn't bad, because it was). I was there with my friends, I bought a few drinks at reasonable prices, and I even waited on line to get upstairs to challenge myself to make the most of their 30-something square foot "dance floor." Maybe "dance floor" is pushing it because that sounds like a large room, so let's say "small designated space for dancing" to be more accurate.  The music sucked and had no flow to it -- it was a horrible attempt at DJing/VJing/whatever-you-want-to-call-it, the floor was disgustingly sticky as if they were trying to glue your shoes down, and the entire staff just needs to be retrained or replaced. There is absolutely no reason for anyone to waste their time or money at Raven Bar.

w-ZWTYs195JrhaH9qBS4uw.review_text: This is my best friend's favorite bar in San Francisco.  We have the exact same taste in everything, so I said sure let's give it a go!  I can see that he comes here not only for the fun atmosphere (they were playing Cypress Hill and Garbage lol) but because the bartender David is amazing!  He seriously knows his stuff..I was just sitting in the corner, amused watching him pour his drinks..seriously an expert at his craft.  If you're here definitely ask about any new drinks he's been crafting lately..you won't be disappointed.  One of the most original bars I've been to in a while!

09b-r7QnPhadHSMinyQmeQ.review_text: Great new place in SOMA. Awesome drinks, attentive bartenders, friendly and hospitable doormen and an amazing vibe inside. The interior of this place is really nice and all brand new. Very comfortable seating, two floors with DJ's and dance floors and a nice patio area for smoking without having to go outside. Love this place.

WmzIcl-Wym9l_NYXQ0WFvg.review_text: Place is the opposite of your usual club:  A guestlist that let's you in free until 11  Delicious drink menu that's much cheaper than usual lounges and clubs/bars  Lots of cool air and ventilation  Bouncers who are friendly and not douchebags   90's and early 2000's hip hop instead of all EDM or Top 40  Was in contact with David Luu who manages the club got all of my questions answered for my birthday party. All of my guests said they had a great time and didn't have any issues that night. All of my guests said they would go back in a heartbeat due to the music and videos playing.

6QN6BdpcDKXNS9Xq_7pECQ.review_text: I miss christy turlington. Downstairs is chill, upstairs is elbo to elbo. Wink wink

1xqwVCfdpmjNjm4tDsEslg.review_text: Raven Bar  Last night I got tired of binge watching Netflix's Orange is the new black season 2, so I decided to come out to the city to meet up with some friends. I looked at the yelp reviews prior, so I wasn't really that thrilled to come here but I needed to get out.   My first thoughts upon walking towards Raven was, "Lines lines lines yeah!" (Read that with Thompson Twins in mind)  If you want to practice being patient you won't be disappointed coming here. There's a line for EVERYTHING.  A line to get in, a line to use the restroom, and line to go upstairs ('m not kidding) accompanied by a bouncer that guards the stairs. Prepare to stand in line and pointlessly scroll through your instagram or FB feed on your smart phone.  There is a $10 cover charge and that includes ladies as well, which I thought was kind of odd. Don't ladies usually always get in for free?   Also, the floors are STICKY as hell. It gets so crowded that people bump into each other and it becomes a wet and wild contest with all the spilled drinks sloshing in the air and splashing on the floor.   They play some old school nostalgic hip hop which was actually pretty nice. Everyone was reciting the lyrics to the songs they used to dance to in middle school. They played songs like "Ghetto superstar", "Dilemma", "Everybody in the club getting tipsy", etc. Basically everything I haven't heard in ages.  The crowd was friendly and the drinks were strong.  Overall I had a good night.    3/5 stars

l6Gu7GZAYhsbzyrgh40pUQ.review_text: Raven is a great lounge / bar / club in SOMA that I have just recently discovered. I was there on Friday for Vogue, which is a fun event (1st and 3rd Fridays) where they play the best hits from the 90's, as well as some contemporary. They play awesome dance music on both floors and my friends and I had a blast, dancing the night away! They also have yummy drink specials - I especially love the "Herbal Remedy". Highly recommended if you are looking for a fun night out on a Friday.

8c2n50ngClm2o_YhQjkbPw.review_text: Apparently this is the new hot spot.   There are two small dance floors upstairs and downstairs. One bigger bar upstairs and two medium size bars downstairs. Music is usually Top 40's, some EDM, but don't depend on it. I don't think it is a live DJ because I don't see him/her. Mostly music videos. Very casual, no cover on a friday night. I would come here in jeans and enjoy a couple drinks with some friends.   Crowd really depends, I came here for two birthdays. Since it was a fairly small bar, most of my friends occupied the whole bottom floor.   Bartenders here are extremely good looking :)

sLIn9oBM0aw9q2R9G1oCew.review_text: Very Chill place, we walked in grab some drinks such as the Vampire Slayer, Anchor Away, and the Lychee Bliss. My favorite thing about this bar is the fact that it's not crowded and the service is great. The main bartender seems to be the guy who makes up new drinks and names it based on who can give it a good name. Highly recommend this place.

Lgr3Ifs26IR729bl7iWnSQ.review_text: What a great discovery!  Raven is a beautiful cocktail bar that serves drinks made with fresh ingredients. Honestly, I was tempted to grab the fruit from their bar! The ambiance is chill and the crowd (at least last night) were full of FiDi/SoMa startup folks. Good music and the space is much larger than anticipated. I'll definitely come back!

0GfgmI7WXTCH-kTs5ArbrA.review_text: This place was alright. My main complaint is that this place is too crowded and the raven drinks (winter kiss and herbal remedy) are okay. Music is popping and all, but the dance floor is too small.

NbdKctpJhm8iktZrrLpULg.review_text: I live .4 miles from Raven. Which is pretty dangerously fun. It means it doesn't matter if I get smashed from the super delicious craft cocktails at any hours of the night and I will still make it home relatively in one piece (minus the time I ran into a baby tree..but I digress). From tequila shots to fency cocktails you should only be drinking with one pinky up, Raven has it all. My personal favorite is the herbal remedy because despite it's potency, drinking it makes me feel like I'm doing something really good for my body, almost like drinking green juice! It's super herby & deliciousss. Also, if it's not super crazy packed (thurs, fri, sat nights) ask the bartenders to make you something off the menu. The bartenders are really awesome at making dranks & are hot to boot, a couple of celeb look alike at this bar ;)  Yes, it gets pretty packed. It's a pretty small dance floor upstairs, but if you can booty bump your way around, it's really worth it. Thursday is always a little less crowded. It's free entry until 10 pm, but it's only $10 after. I've been the lines get pretty hairy so earlier is always better. A lot of people enjoy having their bday parties here. From what I hear, it's either free or super cheap (for reserving a table with no bottles, but don't quote me on that one). Definitely a fun spot to go for bday drinks, though.   Happy hour is M-F until 7 PM which includes 2 for 1 drink specials, $5 beer, $6 wine, and $3 off specialty cocktails. This means that you could come here to pregame and stay for the dancing until 2 AM. I've done this before and would highly recommend. Especially on the dance filled nights, you are bound to bump into at least two to three different groups of friends and random acquaintances. I most definitely saw Phil from Wongfu on at least 2 occasions, hehe. The music at Raven is the biggest pull of this bar for me personally. I'm not the biggest fan of EDM and this bar is the one bar that consistency has awesome 90's music. It's like the music that I danced to in high school, except you know, with alcohol. Plus there is a screen downstairs and downstairs that plays the music videos, it's an awesome blast to the past.

Ed8JmiYnZYMe86vyKpcEwQ.review_text: Came here for a friend's birthday back in February. Would not suggest coming here for a big party. Once this bar is packed, you gotta stay waiting outside until someone leaves before you can come in. We had bottle service and boy, it took FOREVER for us to get our bottle. On top of that, when I was trying to get a drink at the bar (in the back), the bartender never looked my way. I got fed up after standing there for 30 minutes and went to the bar in the front and was immediately served. (Whoever you were bartender in the back, pay attention to your RIGHT and LEFT 'cause you're losing tips for the night). Besides that, I say a good place to lounge around with a few drinks with good old school R&B and hip hop (A good change from that EDM/DUBSTEP/HOUSE music).

rtTpEZSTIDSurdw12xZK1Q.review_text: Raven Bar... what can I say... two words. AWESOME BARTENDERS!!! Ever so attentive, fun and friendly... I feel like they just take ONE look at you and know EXACTLY what you want...go look for JULIEN, the bartender extraordinaire!  He will make you laugh, bail you out of situations, but best of all, make you super happily buzzed with his amazing concoctions!  Ok lots more words than just two... my friend introduce me to this place and have been back a couple times.  One of which I remember, the other not so much... BUT what do remember every time is that I have a BLAST.  Very cute unique bar/lounge/club that's not ghetto and the crowd is just right.  Best of all, the drinks are unique and amazing (the ones I remember at least).  Very chill on the weekdays, and fun dancing on the weekends.  Even though I DO like the edm scene, its nice to bring it back to the hip hop days where everyone can actually sing along to some of the songs.  Upstairs is where most of the dancing is and if i remember correctly there are two big screens with videos!!   I'd definitely come back again! Oh and did I say.. AWESOME bartenders? run, don't walk, to this bar if you are looking for a fun night out!

dABbad9JonWj72fqEnc12w.review_text: I really like this place because of the music they spin.  The people here are in their early 20's and the place get packed on the weekend like crazy.  The drinks are yummy and strong.  Take the cab when you want to go here. Parking is almost impossible to find.

JnGtgOPpkjyWOvWM0SYEXg.review_text: cool soma digs...long and narrow, but spacious...bar running long aside left wall...no cover at entrance...filling up fast past ten pm, saturday...music and plenty of floor space...mostly standing, drinking and talking...bartenders efficient in servicing the drinks...working the crowds and orders....finding cocktails sweet for taste...no interest in creative names...switching to beers for the night...beer and talk...good music background...upstairs and bathrooms...another large bar...more casual fun vibes and dancing at top...contrast from downstairs area for more mingling, lounging and conversations....

Wl6LhV5OAazYc4CrN-IXhQ.review_text: I guess I have been spoiled by fresh ingredients and better drinks, but all I can say is that I have been here on more than one occasion and kept hoping one of these time I would like it.  First off, I dislike the layout of this place. It boxes you in no matter which room you are in. I wish it could be more of an open space. Then, the music is always lame here which shouldn't be overlooked considering they are competing with an awesome bar (Bloodhound) right next door.  My last complaint, which is the most important because it's a bar...the drinks were not worth the price you pay for them.  I ordered the spicy margarita because the bar down the street makes a mean one (Azucar Lounge) I thought I'd try it here. BAD idea, it was weak, not properly shaken to distribute flavors, and just not good overall.I couldn't finish it...oh well..now I know better.

e4db8XgxP3i-7eBNtmDYkA.review_text: Party up top, business on the bottom.  We crashed some futuristic dance party that was going on here last Tuesday at the upstairs bar.  The bar was packed, as was the dance floor, but the music was fun, like 90s jams. Although the dance floor is pretty small, there were still a lot of people getting down. I like the blue lasers, they looked pretty dope.   At the bar they make a good old fashioned, can take a while to get drink when its busy.  Nice little neighborhood bar.

QnoN3SNip50oBtgjXmfGYQ.review_text: As a lover of spicy tequila cocktails, I'm diggin the Switchblade at Raven Bar. A little bit sweet with a little bit of heat.. this drink is delicious!  Came here for HH on a Monday and there were a few people at the bar. There's an additional bar in the back and another floor upstairs for dancing on the weekends. A lot more spacious that it appears from the front.

PKUW9VOkdAs-FOFt0KlibA.review_text: Yelp brought me to this bar during an Elite event and Yelp gets all the credit!  Where else can you find a bar so big, with two floors, with different music playing in each one, with a smoking patio, with an awesome vibe, yet keeping it romantic and mysterious? Where?! This bar reminded me so much of "The Crow."   The beer selection was awesome. The cocktails were strong, good tasting, fantastic. At one point I got so buzzed I started walking around like it were the Winchester Mystery House. If you lose track, you might end up in some stairwell leading to a closet!  My other memory from this night was the music. They were playing Michael Jackson (Jackson 5 days), old old songs, dance stuff...everyone knew these songs. It was inevitable dancing.  I really love it here.

gZmEZvZwLJH7JiQfIdbkRQ.review_text: All I kno is that if we end up at Raven then it's a wild night because the shots are fat and the music is bumpin and we won't be turnin down for nothin!!

M0mONsg1ZJIKA30ad1qE1w.review_text: this is how we do it, it's friday night!  i LOVE 90's hip hop!  (music videos are projected on a large screen by the upstairs dance floor as well)  got in with no cover  and bouncers are extremely friendly  the room gets steamy as more people crowded onto the dance floor  this place truly caters to the 80's babies.  if you enjoy 90's music or looking to get away from the usual house and edm thats playing everywhere these days then this is the spot to be!

3KK7L2Q6NMfJA1Ky4Ntmdg.review_text: To be fair, this isn't really my type of scene or crowd.   COVER Free on guestlist before 11 pm, otherwise $10 pp. We came on a Saturday night after a failed attempt to get into Origin. At midnight, there was still a surprisingly long line to get in. Usually lines die out by then, so we thought this place must be good. We waited for about an hour in line.  VENUE // DRINKS Two stories, but we stayed on the first floor. Dance floor is small, with a few bottle-service tables lined against one wall. One long bar with DIY water tank, so you don't have to bug the bartenders. I got myself a Pineapple Malibu for $9, which is relatively cheap for a bar/club.  MUSIC // CROWD Hip hop, 90s, pop, pretty old school songs. I will admit when I go clubbing, I just want to dance by myself to EDM. This is not the place to do so. The crowd fits the music genres, and the attire is more casual than dressy.  Raven is a fun bar if you're into that kind of thing. I can't really dance to hip-hop and such, so the only songs I really rocked out to were Britney Spears' "Oops, I Did It Again" and TLC's "No Scrubs". With that said, I probably won't be back.

beGmSUJQY55Z_KBBpMOrMg.review_text: I called up Raven Bar on a whim, after I had read from other Yelpers that this was a good place to host a birthday party--indeed it was! I reserved a spot for 30 of my friends about two months ahead of time (as I do...), and David (the owner) was kind when I couldn't figure out how to get the online guest list working. He even came and introduced himself to me earlier in the night.  The bartenders were darling, and extremely attentive to me and my friends no matter how crowded it got. And the music was also on point: 80's and 90's hip hop and R&B played through most of the night, and it was only after midnight that music got kind of funky and too EDM-y (for the record, that is a made up genre and it is stupid). If you're in need of a venue with a private area for you and your friends--and a dance floor--Raven Bar is quite a place.

XTIaIL_r8Go30M3GOmZYYQ.review_text: Two floors of lounge chairs, bars, and dancefloor. Decent crowd. No in/out priviledges and cover on Fridays.

wbKe8rLYGllLPoUib_uCig.review_text: Had my dirty 30 here. David the promoter was awesome in helping me get a table for my large party. When I arrived they had birthday banners and my name on the VIP section. Our hostess I think her name was Leslie she was really sweet. I had a great time there. Older crowd and great music. I was happy to not see a tenny bopper twerking haha and bottle service is not too expensive. The only reason I didn't give a 5 is because the place is kinda small. I had a blast I will be going again

kK0QDyfeSwcZl4gGilnW7w.review_text: Yes, I can update my review after having a decent time on New Years Eve and I was able to actually experience Raven on a regular night....AND I LOVED IT!!!! I tried signing up for guestlist for free entrance before 11pm on Saturday but when I tried on a Tuesday or Wednesday, guest list was already closed. So my advice is that if you know you are gonna go to Raven, you should guestlist asap haha. That night I had to pay $10 regardless so we strolled on by at 11:15pm and there was a huge line out the door. After 11pm, they really do hold up the line and at first I thought it was to make the place look poppin but there is a capacity limit since the place is pretty small. It is a bar/lounge/dance club with a small dance floor on top so you cant fit as many people as the Grand. I guess that is what gives it its charm and why I like this place so much. I finally got in around midnight and was ready to dance the night away.  MUSIC There was actually a line to go upstairs to the dance floor and it was quite annoying to stand in two lines to get to dance but it was totallyyy worth it. The floor was packed but I made my way and omgosh the MUSIC!!! They had Nsync, Backstreet Boys, Britney Spears, Beyonce, Kesha and ALLL THE GOODIES. I WAS IN MUSIC DANCING HEAVEENN. They have the music video playing in the background as well. This is seriously the best music I have ever heard because it has the good late 90's and early '00s music, some of the older dancable music, and some modern hip stuff. I dont think I have ever given a dance club, especially one in SF, 5 stars but it totally deserves it. I will definitely be celebrating my birthday here! I went to request my two fave dance songs and numba one is Return of the Mack but I should have known that this DJ already played it. I was disappointed but I realized this guy is good. The DJ plays every weekend it seems like so I am feeling that. My second song is Too Close by Next and thank goodness he didnt play it yet. Usually you have to wait a bit for the DJ to play your requested song but he played it two songs later and I totally gave him a high five.I complimented a guy in a suit behind the bar and asked if he was the manager. He was and at first he thought I was complaining but I just wanted to show my appreciation. I complimented the place and he gave me 4 passes for free entrance and skip the line privileges. Score one for me! I hope you are reading this, but thank you!  ATTIRE The attire here is pretty chill and you def do not have to go all out with the Grand status clothes. I saw girls in jeans and guys looking casual but some people dressing up as well. I would feel inappropriate wearing like a tight dress and heels so if anything, I would wear a shirt and skirt with flats. The whole point is to feel comfortable and dance the night away :)  CROWD Yes, it is true that this place is mostly Asians in their mid late twenties and early thirties. It is a good looking crowd compared to other hip hop, top 40, pop dance clubs. I got there after midnight so I noticed all the guys had already prowled on the crowd so I guess if you are there to meet people, get in on guestlist and before 11pm so you can venture and not have to wait in that long line. I like that the guys here are not creeps as well and do not just stand at the dance floor staring at the girls dancing.   PARKING Parking is quite difficult so good luck finding! I cant really give you advice here.  I have never been so satisfied with a club ever. Music and people cant get better than this! If only this place was bigger but allll goood.  **TIPS** 1) Guestlist days before because most like the sign up will be filled, especially on Saturday and if you do the day of. Free before 11pm! Afterwards, they hold up the line and you wont get in until midnight. 2) If you love the older pop music and r&b but also the new hip top 40s, THIS IS TOTALLY YOUR PLACE. I am sold like no other. 3) You dont have to dress that much to impress but you can still look cute for the crowd. 4) Enjoy :))))))

MqJ7a_zXpO2ZA5PWM8NC7w.review_text: The doorman/bouncer was nice..  I really like how they use fresh citrus juices to make their cocktails, this results in very tasty margaritas. The "switchblade" is also an interesting margarita/tequila cocktail; fresh lemon and grapefruit juice with a cilantro jalapeno simple syrup.  I just really wish their "speciality" cocktails were included in the happy hour, they are not and are like 9 to $10. Only well drinks and beer/wine. What if I want to get a margarita with a decent tequila? Well tequila?...*dies*  I hadn't been here before they remodeled but nice, 3 bars and 2 dj booths with a small dancefloor upstairs. Has potential for future parties..  There was no DJ playing when I went, had music video mix going on that was mostly a mix of modern what i call "hipster rock" with once ina while a classic soul/funk tune thrown in, and once in a while a smashing pumpkins or depeche mode etc

3cnIyELXdZa9C9nFH5NXtg.review_text: Everybody wants a neighborhood bar the you can just go to on any night, know a couple of people, and be served solid drinks.  That's what Raven has become for me. Every time I go here (usually once, maybe twice a week on a worknight)  I always have a good time.  The staff is incredibly approachable, everyone from Bartenders to barbacks to the DJ! We have gotten to know them  pretty well, but they treat everyone what comes through their doors with the same respect and welcoming attitude.  There was a time when I first walked through those doors...   Anyways they'll make you what you want or something they recommend if you don't have anything in particular in mind.  Their drinks menu is solid and there drinks are deceptively strong, which to them is the perfect compliment.    On slow nights, they'll let the patrons play their own music via iPone, iPad, etc.  They also have DJ nights, that spin mostly Deep House.  However, you can ask them to play something more upbeat, or more popular and they will.  One night (on my bday) the DJ went nuts and we had an awesome time!  On weekends and during bigger parties, they open up the top floor and back bar.  Giving it more of an Ultra Lounge feel.    Its good to have a place where everybody knows your name.

Ady3w3K2Ie1PrJReAtTQiw.review_text: This place is fun, with great drinks (expensive, but it's a club, so, SHOCKER!), a fun dance floor, and friendly bartenders.  I'm pushing 30 so often the crowd is amusingly young to me, but when my fellow "old" friends and I want to just dance around like silly people to 90s music with delicious, caloric cocktails in hand, this place is our go-to.   I know there's no EDM (a term I just learned because I am an OLD), but I love that it's pop and that they have their 90s nights because it's just FUN.  If you're not looking to impress anyone and just want to have a good time, head to Raven.  Only drawback is that it is expensive and sometimes you have to pay cover which is sort of silly given the lack of real DJs, but whatever, for the occasional night out it's fun.

zLiMsSMhcr_lVXdmDy7_NA.review_text: $10 cover if you don't make 11 PM guestlist.  At 11:30 PM, they're not holding up the line because they're tryna make this place seem like it's poppin', it's cause it is actually poppin'!  Like the bouncers explain, it is just way over capacity for this tiny 2 floored establishment, so wait your turn in line.  My girlfriends and I had to wait about an hour before we got to go in, so expect a wait! x___x  They play a lot of 90s music and the crowd appears to be mid 20s to early 30s.  Everyone was pretty friendly and I was surprised at how willing the dudes here were with buying girls drinks.  Dranks on dranks on dranks doe.    I had a freaken good time here, but because of how crowded this place is, I had to dock it a star. It's like body on body on body.  No space to even bend your arms out.  I seriously got shoved back and forth between the crowd, so every shift in movement kinda had a domino effect on not just me, but everyone around me too.

a4r7b9qJI_1HwfVul-ns5A.review_text: I came here for a birthday celebration. She had the back section by the bar reserved for her party (to keep her reservation, she had to be there by 9PM). Here's the scoop:  Location: Typical area for SOMA bars/clubs. It wasn't too bad finding street parking and walking around the block to the bar.  Cost: Average for SOMA bars/clubs. Free cover before 11PM if you sign up for the guest list (WARNING: It does fill up!)  Drinks: They have a pretty good list of specialty cocktails. Their signature drink list at the very bottom of the menu has some solid choices. The bartenders seem to know what they're doing because they do it well!  Ambiance: Cool, not divey, but not too upscale, either. Girls wear everything from cocktail dresses and heels to jeans and converses (though the latter was definitely an outlier). There's lots of booths lining the dance floor, but all of them were blocked off for tons of birthday parties (at least 5) and a bachelorette party. The music was also interesting. It was old school 90's music, but not all of them were the hits you would immediately remember and want to dance to... Oh well, you make the most of it!  Would I return? Maybe.

rm-oUeqX0T3-SvaoGw2UJA.review_text: I totally knew I would like this place as I heard Britney Spears blasting on the speakers as I came in! Shout out to this place, for it has all your throw back 90s pop/hip hop music! There ware two floors to hang out and grab drinks and a tiny dance floor upstairs playing music videos! Drinks are pretty pricey, but I guess that's the city for you... $11 for my FLAT mint mojito. I'll pass on that next time... Overall, chill place to hang out, good dancey 90's music, and if you're wondering what TLC's definition of scrub is or what drives Britney crazy -  come to this place to find out :)

N8wsEh3_NTUwm4kNp1pLHA.review_text: I moved to SF to get out more, be able to drink a lot and be able to cab back home,  and have access to the most eligible men in the U.S. but then a couple things happened. 1. I got a bf, so no more eligible men for me  2.Uber and Lyft raised their surcharge prices to exorbitant levels, and 3. I found Raven. So now I don't go anywhere else, because all I need is Raven!  They play my hip hop music all night long (none of that EDM bs), they  intermix the  hip hop music of my youth ( late 1990's-2000) and I don't need to worry about paying for drinks because....I have a bf ;) #boysshouldbuythedrinks

KYoxOXp39LNbIBj0rKLZ6A.review_text: Haha my new favorite bar!   I love the energy, the drinks are strong, and you're not crowded to the point where you just feel uncomfortable. It was great! Go upstairs for a more dance-y area! The same music plays on both floors but the upstairs has a bigger bar and it's where everyone is dancing. Downstairs you'll find a lot of reserved parties.  the MUSIC though is the best part! (: It has hella old school music and it definitely brings you back to high school. Prom anyone? We even got an N'Sync song haha whaaaaat? We also had old Mariah Carey songs, Usher songs, JT, Nelly, etc. And the music changes pretty quickly too so it never gets boring! Plus, the music videos are playing on the walls via projectors so you got the song, the MV, everyone singing along to everything, great energy.  Tip: Put yourself on guest list to get in for free before 11pm!

h53MQqQ16regkL2aEl-3WQ.review_text: If I could, I'd give this place a big fat zero for ZERO SERVICE.  Why do I say this? It's all thanks to the pretentious prick who calls himself a "bartender." I came here last Friday (1/17) to grab some drinks and catch up with friends. We were in the back bar area on the first floor, when I came up to the "bartender" to order a round of drinks for my group. He immediately made eye contact and nodded his acknowledgement of me. I courteously waited my turn, and when he was ready, I made my request. I got my drinks right away and showed my appreciation with a 25% tip.  When I found out that I had ordered the wrong drink for a friend, I came back to the bar.  The "bartender" acknowledged me, and I requested the correct drink. I was ready to pay for my own mistake, as I was standing around, holding my credit card. I saw him making 2 drinks, took a drink request from the group of girls that arrived AFTER me, saw him making drinks for them, and another drink or two for someone else. I tried to make eye contact, but he avoided me like the plague. My bf checked up on me to see why I was still waiting so long at the bar. Finally, I politely informed the "bartender" that I've been waiting for my drinks for quite a while. His reaction took me by surprise because I was being polite the entire time.  He hissed at me that he's in the services industry, and people in the services industry tend to forget. On top of that, he told me to find another bartender to make me my drinks!  Well, if you're in the services industry, and you see a customer lingering around trying to make eye contact with you, shouldn't you follow up with your customer to ensure that he/she's been taken care of? That's what I would do, as I was in the services industry myself. Nor would you ever stoop so low as to react in such an immature and unprofessional fashion, especially to a customer who was generous to you.  Being a bartender means servicing each and every customer with consistency and with the highest level of professionalism, not making fancy drinks to whomever you please and being a snot while you're at it. Perhaps you should learn what servicing is about before you call yourself a bartender.

BzP-xGII8xxKfg_CPCO_ig.review_text: This was the dancing stop on my friend's 21st birthday.  From the website, we were thinking it would be more speakeasy than it actually was.    The place has multiple floors and more dancing on the second floor than the first.  I liked that they had a coat check, because being in SF, you're going to need a coat at some point, but it was way too hot in there for one.  The music was great.  The bartenders were so cool and friendly.  Towards the end of the night, one of them came over and danced with us.  It was kind of funny, because my friends were some of the only non-Asians in that entire place.  But we were having so much fun that by the end of the night, we didn't even care.  And maybe it was only that night, I don't know.  Just an observation.  With that said, one of the funnest dance clubs.  If I were in this part of SF again, I'll definitely go here to dance!

ipleTHGh9KR8hO5U1yxzXw.review_text: Nice digs...the bar is pretty spacious considering the entrance is fairly narrow. The lounge area has solid seating and the smoking area aka dog run has benches and is covered for moderate protection against the cold.   The bartenders get a little overwhelmed on a weekend so don't get too thirsty..the wait is a bitch for drinks. Alas...what are you going to do? Oh, I know...order two at once. Save the trip back.   DJ booth sits low and personal on the floor. The back bar area is great too with easy access to the smokers/dog run. Chill for happy hour...not so chill once the night settles in.

zxk9g0L__pJpsZfwE77UpQ.review_text: Really nothing special about this place in my opinion. And it smelled funny. That's all there is to say.

Ed20T0T3jkAqVBBiyXju6A.review_text: 3.5/5  I typically don't review bars, but this venue is unique where it played a lot of the 90s music, which I truly enjoy. Not sure if it was a 90s themed night, but came here for a bday celebration. Cute venue. I pretty much situated myself in one area, so I didn't explore much.  There are two bars, by the front and in the back, and there are stairs that lead up to somewhere..not sure where..haha

cKmh3yWeADbvKqkZqo0ECw.review_text: Great cocktails, awesome music selection, two spaces for dancing; Raven is an awesome place for a chill night out on the town!  Go early though, cover after 11p.

71zTZ2lfZdEAxkhR915pVA.review_text: I was responsible for putting together a holiday party for the office and decided to go with Raven Bar.  Working with David was awesome!  He responded to all my emails very promptly and went above and beyond to ensure everything ran smoothly!  We reserved the back bar for our party with David as our designated bartender for the night.  He also put up signs with our company logo without me even having to ask!   Our company had the greatest time and they all were so happy with the venue and the helpfulness of the staff at Raven Bar.  Everyone said they loved our holiday party this year much better than our last one.  Whew!  Thanks David!  Vince and Jonathan were also a great help as well.  Thanks to both of you also.  Good things to know about Raven Bar:  -Bottle service and bar limits not required for booking tables, etc. -Staff is super friendly and cater to your needs and requests -Food can be ordered from Triptych (the restaurant next door) -Weds-Thurs nights - house music, Fri-Sat nights - hip hop  -Great specialty drinks - Switchblade is my go to - cilantro, lime, honey and jalapeno with tequila!  They always make it extra spicy for me! -Bar in the front and back on the main floor, bar and dance floor upstairs  Thanks again to David, Vince, Jonathan and all the staff at Raven Bar.  Your bar is a hidden gem and I'm glad I found you.    This is my new go to spot for happy hour and dancing!  :)

BUkL2QYc45x0-3N2K-R7xw.review_text: A co-worker told me about this bar and we decided to host our holiday party here - it was great!  The drinks are insanely tasty, and David made sure that planning the party was a breeze.  He accommodated all our wishes, and then some.    Josh, our designated bartender for the night, was awesome.  Working the second floor bar alone, he was a friendly efficient drink-making machine.  The prices were completely reasonable, and to have the whole second floor to ourselves (with our own bathrooms, bar, music-control, and dance floor) was fabulous.  Got our food from the next-door restaurant, Triptych, which worked out quite nicely.  A great pairing!

wveSuWGNDD9H4g1h_0XGpA.review_text: Great bar with a good vibe, nice range of drinks and goldfish at the end of the night (which I apologise for throwing handfuls of at my "friend" in a drunken rage). Staff were friendly and I had an awesome time dancing to some classic hip hop/pop tunes.  Free wifi was an added bonus!

EXhc6EZ49kVI4FDbYfxRxw.review_text: My girlfriends and I came here on a Friday night and had so much fun dancing to oldschool 90's songs (I mean, what gets better than rehashing those middle/school days with Britney Spears and Justin Timberlake and Spice Girls!?!?!) SO glad that this club doesn't just play EDM music all night long - which is what a lot of other clubs have been doing.  I docked a star because the place does get a little cramped. It was so cramped that there was a second line (after the one to get into the club) to go upstairs, which I think is kinda ridiculous. Thankfully we got some VIP wristbands and got to skip the line! :)  TL;DR - love the music, hate how crowded it is...but had the time of our lives here anyway!

T_VFY-sBgAymG-K4iXGhwQ.review_text: The Raven looks great after the remodel and grand opening.  We were there early one night so we could unwind after work.  I liked how it was not over-crowded and loud at first, so we could actually have a conversation with friends.  The atmosphere was fun since the bartender got us to try a few new speciality drinks that matched our personalities well.    As we stayed a little longer, and got more tipsy, the crowds came in and and it becamse a good party atmosphere, with a good mix of people.  Loved the hip music and trendy crowd.

Ma_gwnVShENgTuhHNpAvyQ.review_text: Great chill atmosphere.  Don't have to get dressed up to meet a fun group of people willing to drink and get down.  DJ spins alot of hiphop, so its pretty fun.  It can be cramped because it is a rather small venue.  Definitely leaning towards the lounge feel more than a full out club feel.  Great for a night where you just need to take it easy and don't want the pounding EDM in your head.

XdFTSZAfWYwnRFpW1FPHYA.review_text: Wonderful low key alternative to Bloodhound, with a fresh new design by Michael Brennan (Zero, Zero, Harry's Bar on Fillmore & a bunch more).  If you would like to enjoy a sophisticated cocktail in a more sophisticated environment, you should check this place out.l

AubXuSYHoTvI_ItAPBbjiw.review_text: Great bar for a group of friends to chill and talk. There's a bunch of good group seating options and it's not too loud to overpower a conversation (although I will disagree with their choice of music).  My only complaint is that the bartenders are the slowest I've encountered in my life (at least the ones working that night). Most bars I've been to, the bartender always seems like they're in a hurry and you're just short of wasting their time. The Raven bartenders have a more laid back attitude at the Raven which is good but it will take 15-20 minutes to get your drink (from the moment you order to getting the drink and your credit card back).

BbIjpB4FB9n1bN63BXEoZw.review_text: Highly recommend- this place is amazing. I threw my 23rd birthday here and it was such a great experience. The team at Raven Bar helped coordinate my large party of about 40+ guests. They were extremely easy to work with, very accommodating, and went to great lengths to make it a personal, fun, and enjoyable time. The GM came to personally wish me a happy birthday which was a really nice touch. We were at the bar the entire night- the drinks were creative and well made. I would throw another event there in a heart beat.. Cheers!

Ag4Wc_NMOj34M2pTnBQKEQ.review_text: I rarely write 5 star reviews, which pretty much means I'm hardly ever impressed! Lol. However, Raven really earned my business!  I reserved a table for my party over the weekend. While the website indicated their reservations were full, they were still able to accommodate one more table for me! Upon arriving, I ordered 2 bottles. Our hostess was sweet and kept on checking on us. The guest list went smoothly for guest despite the long line. I was given a tiara and they accommodated all my late arrivals coming in! Also, can't beat free coat check!  They music was great: old-school hip hop!  I had a really great time! Would definitely recommend!

BsM1_ZnnlHM12xmH7zytBQ.review_text: Good music and good vibe. The place is a little small, but there's an upstairs area to help with that.  Make sure to arrive before 11pm, as the line gets pretty long. Also, there's a line for the upstairs area that may not be worth it. To top it off, the girlies also showed some strong talent too ;)  $10 cover

Yf9rRS1N47rurtYjRa_iFw.review_text: This is one of the best new craft cocktail bars in SOMA. They squeeze juices fresh daily for their awesome cocktail menu. I highly recommend their signature cocktail called The Raven. It's sweet, flavorful and has complex layer of flavor. I am also a big fan of The Basil of Death, Apple Poe, and the Caiprinha Noir. They have cheap well drinks and good beers on tap. It's a nice place to go for happy hour with $5 dollar wine, $4 wells and $4 draft beers. They have awesome, knowledgeable bartenders who are very friendly and who make you feel like you are the only one in the bar when you order a drink. They show care and attention to every cocktail they make. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!! Great for groups and partying on a Thursday, Friday, or Saturday Night. It's also great for a quiet cocktail throughout the week.   Pros: Beautiful remodeled bar. Great for parties. Very good bartenders. Awesome cocktails. Cheap drinks. Smoking patio where you can bring drinks. Sweet bar and dance floor upstairs.   Cons: couldn't think of any.

Q3J6EBmw241z0AGgd_uMBA.review_text: Now this is the story all about how My life got flipped, turned upside down  And I'd like to take a minute just sit right there ...I'll tell you how  Yes those were the first two lyrics of the Fresh Prince of Bel Air, however there is more of these awesome plays at Raven not to mention some taste-bud melting drinks.   Call me crazy but when someone says, Mint, Basil and Spice infused in an ice glass with alcohol...I'm totally game.

XudC_LBdLZoQsKS5v5aMMw.review_text: Music is great upstairs tonight. Lighting is pretty bad. All lights conflict with each other. The green laser is blinding. The clientele is not from SF. High heels, lots of makeup, lots of polyester. Bridge and tunnel folks. Lighting is really bad upstairs. Lights are hideous!

-UMfTNkO8X_U1Sqy8R5ciA.review_text: Good drinks, great service, 80's/90's hip hop & R&B music + Ninja Warrior on TV? Two thumbs up.

xOEAuMHhA_YPIvu9eA53fA.review_text: AWESOME TIME!  I give Raven 5 stars because of their awesome bartenders! Came here this past Saturday night for a bachelorette party. This place can get pretty packed! There was a short line when we got there around 10pm, but luckily we were on the guestlist so we didn't have to wait long at all.   The music was definitely on point - top 40s and 90s! We danced for awhile upstairs, but it eventually got too crowded and stuffy up there, so we made our way downstairs. We ended up hanging out in the corner of the downstairs bar near the front door. This is where the real fun began!  Our bartenders were the best! They were super attentive and made amazing shots. They definitely gave VIP treatment to our bride-to-be! It was a very entertaining night and all the girls had a great time!   We will for sure come back again when we're up in the bay area!

rrg0jmMCkXoAqCuSIf8a7Q.review_text: Well I saw the good reviews and decided to come here. My friends and I were having such a great time! Music and the crowd  was great! BUT as we were leave a security guy came up to my friend out of no where and said that she had to leave cause two random people said that she throw up in the bathroom! So he kicked us out! 1. She was waiting in a long line to use the bathroom! 2. She was no where near needing to throw up!! This ending ruin my night here!! This was my fist night out in SF!!!!

QkWxnc8gBNu4TaA6Uewpxg.review_text: If it wasn't for my host, Dzu, I would not have put 4 stars.  The bar has a nice, low-key atmosphere and the crowd is friendly and laid-back.  There are no in-and-out privileges. It doesn't make sense to reserve a table and order bottle service ($350/bottle) but your guests can't get in because the line is is not moving, even though is is plenty of space for people to come in.  If it wasn't for my host who was extremely attentive and helpful, I would not recommend this bar for parties/bottle service unless your party is already with you.

bRXgdy0b8cGRgOJgw0X0vw.review_text: been to a couple birthday parties here and it's a chill atmosphere. 90's music always makes it a nostalgic good time

bpKNRKiY6m7uZZqWJ8Xltw.review_text: Amazing staff that wants to take care of you and a very nice venue!   Came here to celebrate my birthday on a Saturday. I read online that they do free table reservations but of course being a procrastinator, by the time I planned everything they were booked out. I was exchanging emails with the person in charge of table reservations, and he was very polite, responsive and attentive. David put me on the wait list for a table in case of a cancellation or a no show.   Got to the place around 10 pm, no line at the door and if you get on the guest list, entrance if free before 11 pm. Even the guest list girl was super nice. My boyfriend was on the guest list twice so we thought we could put someone else's name instead of his once we got there. The girl said she couldn't do that, but instead she offered my second +1 a discount. How accommodating of her (as opposed to just shutting me down.)   Security was everywhere and they were all really nice. David eventually was able to accommodate me and my group with a table as one party left early! He was around all night and made sure everyone was having a good time! Props to that.  I must admit, that I feel that I got better service here, than at a place where I actually paid a lot of money for bottle service....  Music was amazing (a mix of old school and new stuff) and the bartenders poured really good drinks for reasonable prices! Overall I had a great time and me and my group really enjoyed ourselves.  Big shout out to David for taking very good care of me and my party! Will definitely be coming back!

moWDYsnF8SiJCsiszQ7rgQ.review_text: First experience of SF night life. So different (in a good way) compared to LA. This is probably the first time I saw Mariah Carey on screen at a club, ever! 10/10 music selection- old school hip hop. Two story lounge- good vibes, good energy. Thanks to our bartender Chris for my birthday drinks ^_^. Drinks were such a good price, it'd make you feel like tipping.   Entry fee from what I heard was $10 for a Saturday night. Not bad at all. No line when we walked up, but a really nice amount of people inside- crowded, but walkable. I'm happy we hit up this bar for my 23rd!

ARVe3WjrQ3IdUm9MyLGLfQ.review_text: If you're into 90's and 2000's pop music - this is your spot. A little small, casual environment, sign up on GL/get in early otherwise you'll have to wait in line.  Something about hanging out in the club while watching Nelly's "Hot in Herre" brings me back to my elementary/middle school days.

4ayHp_rg2FVKpcl5FuTSWw.review_text: One word for this place L-O-V-E!!!!    On my Friday pub crawling adventure, my friend suggested this bar after our wine tasting was  a dud and boy was I impressed.  I got there around 5 when the front bar was empty, then the crowds started building up.  There are 3 sections, the front bar, the lounge place in the middle and the top level with a dance floor.  The decor was pretty and upscale.    For drinks I think I had something similar to a Basil Gimlet, very refreshing and delish! My other cocktail was a Lychee Martini.  Both are a definite must try!  Overall I am very pleased and impressed with my experience here and I cannot wait to go back for some more HH!!!  Definitely my go to spot from now on.

gnHGRpU_d3pszxH_poN0Aw.review_text: I was here with friends on their once-a-month gay night. My girls and I got to dance freely without any contact from creepers (aside from a pair of sweaty drunk boys that I didn't realize were not gay).. but a lot of the guys on the dance floor got some action going on. You don't need details regarding that, but it was liberating to have our own space!   Love the layout of the bar, downstairs is lounge with two bar areas and some dance floor space, while upstairs is another dance floor with it's own bar. The music downstairs is a combo of top 40 + 90's (perfect!). The upstairs is more house music, but it's a lot more spacious for dancing. I spent most of my time upstairs until it got extremely hot  and the condensation fogged up the windows-- then I went downstairs and requested a song.. and the DJ played it 3x IN A ROW (prob to kill me). Gangnam style danced for 10+ minutes.   TRY THESE DRINKS: Fruity drink lovers, get the Liquid Marijuana (don't think it's on menu but seriously delish), the Apple poe (stronger on the alc), or Lychee Bliss.  Note: Not a fan of the Herbal Remedy drink.. it's taste is of Chinese herbal teas + basil. Quite bitter.  Overall, I really like this place-  lots of space for hanging out or dancing with your friends. Plus, very unique & creative drink menu and no minimum requirement for table reservations.

rrYkyfKDnnhmXT6arNDNmw.review_text: truth is i'm conflicted about raven.  the space is a bit small and tight! sometimes you have to wait in a second line to go upstairs (but never been a huge issue for me personally, though it almost has been and THAT would've been annoying).  but... the music. is pretty dead on. old school hip hop and popular 90s music (um... backstreet's back? alright!)  the only thing is when i got my drinks my cup was hot! ew.  guestlist = free before 11. but after 11... $10 is not bad (and that's what i've paid 3 times now).  have pretty consistently had a good time at this place so... can't complain yet! i wouldn't go by myself, but this is a place my friends like and i like spending time with them there!  not a fan of downstairs, but upstairs i'm all about it!

RoSO1yEbzVh4p3N5_uWf5A.review_text: We came here at 9:30 no line, small amount of people inside made it comfortable. Enjoy the setting, the music wasn't too loud, the specialty drinks were too sweet tho. As the evening dragged on it became super crowded, and who knew this was where all the asians hung out? No space to dance, had to push in to order drinks. When we left at 12 there was a huge line outside, wow good thing we started early. Overall a nice place, staff and bouncers were friendly enuf.

2Em_AVyZXH7hOiEdtu3UAg.review_text: This place is AWESOME! Many clubs is in the city is usually a non friendly environment and expensive for cover. Cover here is only $10!! That's half of temple, grand and even city nights!! Drinks  are about $2 cheaper than other bars!! Friendly fast past staff who's constantly smiling. The venue is very chill. They have a huge monitor upstairs on the dance floor. Although, the dance floor may be a little small but hey, a dance floor is a dance floor right?!  Back to the cover charge. They have a guest list option and when you get there b4 11 and is waiting in line tip 11:30 they will still let you in under guest list entry w/ no charge. Many clubs will close the guest list regardless if your arrival is upon 11. Not here! Not Raven!! And what makes it a super bonus is the Drop dead Hot friendly Window girl who works the guestlist. Many times, you assume or encounter stuck up females at the window.. But not here! That's alone is an automatic 5 stars!

W-RM0SQYIpUc9MfpfUVSLg.review_text: So I went o Raven recently with some girlfriends and must say that I had a perfect experience!! The bartender Jeff (who could be Patrick Dempsey's twin!) was quick to greet us as we came in and very attentive. I love the ambiance of this bar, and the drinks tasted amazing. It's fun to watch a sexy bartender, and he made our experience fun, entertaining, and exciting. It's the perfect place for a private party, and the dance floor upstairs was a pleasant surprise. Oh, and the DJ kicks ass! I will DEFINATELY be back, and if u haven't visited yet, put it in your to-do list because its more than worth it. Hats off Raven, u have a great staff, great location, and the specialty cocktails are the best!! Keep it coming!!!

UMzVMDf9CVCwbubOnO6Q5A.review_text: If I wanted to go out and dance, I usually prefer EDM over top 40's or hip hop, but I keep coming back to Raven because of their MUSIC VIDEOS. The first time I came here I probably sat at the table for 30 minutes watching the VJ throw on some hip hop classics like Will Smith - Gettin Jiggy With It and Warren G - Regulate. I couldn't turn away. I mean how could you? It was like I was young again watching TRL with Carson Daly. I've never gone upstairs because it gets way too hot and crowded. The downstairs area usually has a good amount of dancing area and if you don't feel like dancing, I usually don't have a problem finding a place to sit in the back bar area or some of the tables on the side (if they aren't reserved).

X2fXra-c7pxtIMTAjQeP4w.review_text: This place has changed so much in the last 2 years. We used to have a lot of fun. Now it's crowded and feels unsafe.

K5Q8X8Wt7Iez2sztB3Yw_Q.review_text: My kind of music... every song that comes on I get excited about and I'm super picky about music, and it can make or break my  night. Everyone that works here is so welcoming and friendly and the bartenders make excellent drinks! Love this place!

WRdXMEGqq1YzmjmwSJ-T-w.review_text: I came here for a private party, so I can't really speak to what this place is like on the "regular."  It's solid though.  Room for getting all hot 'n' sweaty.  (so let's take off all our clothes... it's gettin... so hot in heeeeerrrrreeee......I wanna take my clothes off.. )  Don't worry.  It's not that kind of bar.  People kept their clothes on.... and then congregated by the window to get some fresh air.

g3WxRm8_BkL9E3YPSUCnxA.review_text: Pretty small lounge that plays some really good 90's music. Would be a good affordable place to host a birthday party.
