My friends and I got here before midnight and the line outside was long. Waited about half an hour to get in. They had a guest list so entrance was free for those whose names were on it. For those paying, I think the door charge was $10, which wasn't so bad. However, it was really packed inside and we had to queue again for another half an hour just to get to the second floor where the dance floor was at. Crazy long line.  Although I love the music here, this is not really the type of bar I would visit again. I'm in my late 20's and the crowd here are really young (early 20's) and Asians (which is not a bad thing). If you don't mind the age gap, then this is the perfect place for you.

85SpLFoP9ftUSGVOrpvM_w.review_text: This lounge has a really great atmosphere. If you want to avoid the younger, drink to get faded crowd, come here and enjoy a few well prepared cocktails. The decor inside is nice and welcoming, in the back they have booths, good for parties.   The only thing I found obnoxious was a few comments heard from the bartenders. A group of us came on a Tuesday to have some beer. It was Tuesday so it wasn't very busy inside, and only the front section was open. We were not aware but they close at 10pm, we came in around 9:50pm...the comment from one bartender to another "I guess we're staying open later..." A little while later (past 10pm) another group of people came in. When they went to order the bartender says "hey you know we close at 10....but if you hurry I can make you something."  It's not the customers fault for assuming you're open when the door is unlocked and there are people inside! The bartender's comments should be directed to their managers, they have the ability to stop people at the door and let them know politely that last call had already happened.

ynVPMVRLBPgVbMpvHz59KQ.review_text: I have to give these guys some love.    Nice place, good variety of bars, decent music.  I left my card there and they only charged me what I drank (vs. some bars which will nail you).  Thank you Raven.

l0lmpWZzTP2zy5_eI6ZFMw.review_text: Considering my work schedule, i barely have time to unwind with a few cocktails at a bar in the evening nowadays. Well, the other night was different for me. I just finished having dinner with childhood friends at Basil Thai (restaurant next door) and was meeting a friend for a drink after dinner. We were initially supposed to hang out at Bloodhound, but the lounge was pretty full and way too loud. We would have to scream at each other over drinks in order to communicate. I was totally not diggin that...lol  So we decided to check out Raven's Bar instead and the ambience was pretty cool. It has a narrow layout with more floor space towards the back of the bar. At first, it seemed like the place was slightly crowded, but it was not overbearing. We ordered our drinks, which the bartender served right away. It's always a plus when bartenders serve drinks immediatley with minimal wait! And the pinot gris on the wine menu was definitely refreshing, just like our bartender recommended! Now that i look back on that night, i think he was the only bartender working. I'm pretty impressed the wait was not long to get a drink!   The music was pretty cool too. It was upbeat songs that were up to date, yet not to trashy or trancy or hippity hoppity (i think i just made up some words there...) To keep it simple, they were a mixture of songs you can hear on K-Fog, Alice and 94.9 strategically blended together with a smooth transition so each song doesn't clash and interrupt my intimate conversation with my friend!   Overall, it was a great night. Well deserved for me since i barely go out to bars nowadays. My friend and i had a great time (and we could actually hear ourselves talking) while we were well aware that everyone else at the bar enjoyed their party's company.   I wouldn't mind checking Raven's Bar again and doubt i would get sick of this place anytime soon.   Funny thing...i just found out it used to be a gay bar. But based on the environment from my first experience there, i would have never guessed it was a gay bar before!

0hEXbAURBmmETEMkR7YTqw.review_text: Trashy and classy meet here. They play good old school hip hop. You can reserve a lounge spot without buying a bottle. There's ample room to dance and the bartenders can make a solid drink.

3Kh9GKnsuhD3jE1H2tG3ew.review_text: My friend and I went here on 8-22-13 11:40am'sh.  (Earlier I was at cat club, and met my other friend, he told me that they play '90s music).  The doorman checked our id's and we went upstairs, There was a small dance floor, and I purchased two heinenkens $5 each.  It's alright for what it is, but it is another option for club/bar hopping.

bRZgkpM8e8Hpu4KXhvp7VQ.review_text: Raven is a nice and chill bar located in SoMa. I was recently here for an event. They play good music, make good mixed drinks, and the bartenders and staff are nice. Don't be fooled by small space you see at the entrance. There are 2 staffed bars on the 1st floor (1 at front and 1 at the back), and they also have a 2nd floor space with a 3rd bar.

3VxkUiGLxq_rjMXe1WV9vg.review_text: Hosted a tech meetup for 30 people last night at Raven Bar's upstairs room. From the get go, they were quick to answer my questions and confirm the booking. Leading up to the event, they clarified what we'd need for our presentation (which we had on a laptop). On the night itself, I arrived 40 mins early and was impressed at how organized they were - on hand were staff preparing the bar and an audio-visual pro (Mark), ready to setup the projector and mic.  The upstairs room has a separate entrance from Raven Bar, so the staff prepared a sign for my meetup outside and attendees had no problems finding us. The venue itself has a great AV setup (including DJ booth behind the bar). Being separate from the downstairs area means that you have a bar exclusively for your group - it's a very private space. Everyone at our meetup appreciated the personal service, not to mention, the very attentive staff. They even made sure there was good, upbeat music playing all evening - and at a good noise level, too.  Afterwards, one of our attendees mentioned that he'd be booking his birthday party at Raven Bar - for groups of up to 60 people, I'd say it's a fantastic space.  Overall, I can really recommend Raven Bar for customer events and meetups - they have the model well rehearsed and really made our evening a really memorable one. Thank you so much to David, Jonathan, Mark and the team - we will be back!

ihqfOa0RpyhsU8zXOJpC_A.review_text: Was looking forward to a mash-up of old school and mainstream music.   Came the weekend before Halloween and the place was pretty busy. Upstairs, there is a dance floor which is more fun than downstairs (where the tables are).   A lot of Britney, Beyoncé and Avril was played. I love them, but where was the mash-ups?

FI8jzrNrVNhYU9TXmf_fng.review_text: One of the few low-key, unpretentious places in SF that plays great music and serves great drinks.  Everyone is very friendly.  I love how you can order from the entire menu from Tryptich next door.  Sweet potato fries, nachos, sliders... anything your dehydrated drunk heart desires.  Typically at night (including Fri and Sat nights), they play the '90s hip hop and R&B jams.  Awesome...

3Ql7ank2AC9eul10YtcO2Q.review_text: to crowded didnt even drink because i didnt want a push and shove battle. music was good , that was it the layout sucks very narrow andf only one toilet on each floor so you may have to hold it or wait in line for 20 minutes

WdV_xJ-dhFHrqyMF3BNMuA.review_text: Loved this place! It's in a weird area but had a fabulous time! It was my friend's wedding weekend and we decided to reserve the back area with a private bartender for free! for some pre-wedding festivities. The owner started the night off bartending and was very polite and met all of our needs, then the night shift started and the other bartenders were just as nice. There were a bunch of Russians in there so we definitely drank a lot of their booze and they didn't seem to mind our rowdiness which is a star itself. Beforehand they provded us with some caterers we can order from but another option was to bring our own food as well and no charge! So we got costco pizzas and a bunch of apps which turned out to be awesome.  I definitely recommend this place, especially for a private party. The owner and staff were friendly and their music was off the hook!  Thank you Raven Bar for treating the Russians with absolute fantastic customer service!

UK_-podnDLO6WCM4C3a58A.review_text: Raven bar is THE place to go if you want to get away from the EDM scene. They play 90's and mainstream hip hop. I had an amazing first time last week cause I could literally sing to all the songs they played!   I tried to get on the guestlist for tonight (oct 18th) but apparently, their guestlist has been closed since Tuesday... -___- this place is gettin too crackin!

YVEJvfH9bWw8JpYO7XPdCw.review_text: A nice place in the middle of hipster Haight st. It feels like a lounge that should be in downtown. anyway, besides the ambiance itself, the food is pretty decent. They have some good cocktail choices too- i tried the summer's kiss and 5spot. both were very good.

LPkXc94_xyRN09d8sXSR7Q.review_text: Sometimes you can judge how ratchet or crazy your night will be based on the TYPE of cup your drink comes served in. At raven, you get most of your mixed drinks in a plastic clear cup.   Details:  The Venue (3/5): Two story venue with two dance floors and bars. If you're signing yourself up for lung cancer, there's even a smoking patio outside connected to the club, so you don't have to go through the bouncers again.  I came at 11pm on a Friday and there was no cover and no line. When we left around 12:30am to go to another bar there was a line. At 11pm, the club was already poppin' on the inside. You'll find your pushing and shoving yourself to the bar or to finding yourself a place to boogie down on the dance floor or to wall flower.  Bathrooms both on the first and 2nd floor near the staircase.   I would recommend being careful in the staircases if you're a girl. A narrow, very dimly lit, crowded staircase with spilled drinks in heels isn't safe at all! The front staircase outside has lights lighting the steps, but not the back one. Another thing that I didn't particularly like about the venue is that drinks were getting spilled everywhere and the floor was wet and often gross and I didn't spot too many staff around cleaning things up and keeping things from just getting SLOPPY.   The crowd (2/5) : You see a lot of younger faces here - everybody looked like they had a newly minted fake or just crossed the line of 21. This isn't the financial district or marina crowd. There are a lot of RUDE people dancing like they don't care throwing arms everywhere, people who wouldn't let you through the crowd and a bunch of awkward asians taking selfies.   The music (4.5/5) : The DJ's do a good job of hitting a lot of hip hop/pop jams... but at the same time i'm in my mid 20's and i could barely recognize some of the oldies they played. Still good to whippin my hair back and forth though.  If you're looking for an EDM type vibe, it wasn't there. They had music videos playing on the walls on the second floor.   Bartenders (5/5) : One guy I swear looks like Ryan Gosling. They deserve an extra star for this.  The bartenders themselves are great. They make drinks quickly, don't ignore you, aren't snotty and serve the pretty people first. Only downside --- they bartenders pour just a little too much over the rim and most drinks just end up spilled everywhere. Well drinks and shots $7, pretty standard.   Verdict: The overall vibe at this place is one that could be summed up as: Divey, chic-ratchet, dancing on the line of  trashy and classy, yet a SOLIDLY fun night. Good bartenders, 2 dance floors, poppin' music will ensure you a fun night. Just remember to not accidentally fall on your butt, laugh at the awkward kids taking selfies, and whip your hair back n forth!

XEiR8wnL5lqnj4G6uoaf-g.review_text: I should preface that I didn't stay long enough to write a great review of this place, but judging from everyone else in there, Raven Bar looked fun.  We waited in line for about 30 minutes and paid a $10 cover to get in.  No big deal.  But when we got in it was wall to wall people!  There was barely enough room to walk, let alone up to the bar to order a drink!  It was definitely a younger crowd, too, so this probably was no big deal for them.  Unfortunately it just wasn't my scene.  I went in, said 'hi' to a friend, and walked out.  This definitely looks like a great spot to go if you love loud music, like to dance, and don't mind waiting for a drink!

1qcq_VTO9fYIslCUwudlOA.review_text: Wow, I found this joint on Thrillist.  So I had to check it out one night with a couple of folks after work.  It's a dark but hip bar.  The drinks have interesting names.  I had the Malbec wine then I moved over to the Cab.  They have nice wines, the bartender was awesome and very friendly.  I'm checking this joint out again.  Loved it, and I love Edgar Allen Poe, one of my favorite poet and writers.

9uhOuCTlULaxLZj_j8KWHw.review_text: I have been going here since before it became Raven. I will always be a dedicated customer here as long as Jonathan and Vince remain the owners. I love those two and love what they have created in Raven! It is a beautiful loungey environment downstairs and upstairs is perfect for dancing. The mixologists here make AMAZING cocktails that far surpass anywhere else I have been. I love a good cocktail and detest mixed drinks. The owners went above and beyond making sure their bartenders are cocktail-capable. It's impressive watching them whip up a fresh cocktail. Their music is not the typical top 40 crap either. They mix it up and have 80's and 90's nights. It's a fun and chill vibe and the only bar/lounge/club I am comfortable going to.

g82R2_L85cOxE3ADIUdRpA.review_text: This place is too small for my liking, and it felt like a college bar scene. Yes, they play 90's hiphop (the best era of music ever!),  but the overall vibe just read "small town bar." Not only was it overly crowded, there were hoes and bros who just didn't know how to handle their liquor (ie. messy dancing, a guy who yakked on the floor while next to me, and shoving galore)... AND what's up with making people wait to go upstairs right after having to wait to go in?   OH. and that $10 admission fee to get into a joint like this? MEH. Next.

XbgV6Gp1c0LEp312lUsEsw.review_text: I love the set up! Chill people, love it!

fSzJO3tSVQ6DNx6jNf_fzA.review_text: Awesome local bar with a decent sized (25x25?) dance floor. The drinks are good, normal prices, but the real draw is the music. There's tv's and a projector playing music videos going back to the 90s. Where else do you hear Ace of Base played right after Tupac and just before the Harlem Shake song??!

6Rz0FpkDt0bfAKGr1FFLvA.review_text: Not the BEST place to go in sf, but it does the job. I went to Raven for the first time for a friend's bday. At first, I was a little surprised by how much my friend emphasized signing up for the guestlist, getting there by ten so you don't have to pay cover, etc., because by 10:00, the place was still pretty light so I thought "how popular could this be?". However, by the time the clock struck midnight, I knew why she was so paranoid. The line was out the door till at least the end of the block and they weren't letting anybody in because they were filled till capacity. In the end, my other friends who came late and were waiting in said line decided to just go next door.  The Pros:  - Killer house cocktails (a big plus for me) - old school/throwback music (sometimes, you are in that mood!) - Nice-looking but casually-dressed crowd  The Cons:  - Lounge areas (while nice) are small and limited unless you have a reservation for the back area - Dance Floors are small, both of them (I like to dance and for a place that identifies as a "dance club", Raven Bar was really cramped) - the long lines (it sucked that my friends couldn't get in) - Cover (I just hate cover, period.)  The cons are enough to knock off a star for me. I realize that some things like the long lines are out of Raven's control but as for the cramped dance floors: if you are going to charge cover, I better enjoy myself and not have to worry about bumping into people and/or feeling trapped when I am dancing. Don't get me wrong, I will probably come back, because I don't know many places in sf that will play throwback songs, but I will definitely need to make sure that 1) I get there early and 2) I will spend most of my night there, two things that I generally do not enjoy.

kAeMg6g6-2l3SpsZlEWzcg.review_text: Came here about a week ago and I must say, it was pretty fun!   There are two floors: didn't expect that.   The music is a mix of hip hop and edm. The crowd is mostly Asian and there are three bars with a outdoor smoking area.   It gets pretty crowded second level when the night goes on and harder to move around especially the narrow area from the bar to the dance floor.   Overall, I like this bar alot and had many descent priced drinks. I will definitely be back!

DSCYTUK4yF4M5HK_Ugkrbw.review_text: Thanks to Raven, I had a great birthday celebration last night!  A very nice bar. I like how you can reserve table for private party for free. Originally we agreed to do bottle service, but because of the bad weather a lot of friends couldn't make it out so we have to cancel the bottle at the last minute. I feel bad so I told David (i believe he's one of the owner) that i will still pay the gratuity. He agreed and bought us a few drinks. Not long later he came back to me and said since i didn't do the bottle service he should not charge me anything so he said i could use my paid gratuity at the bar. He wanted to make sure i enjoyed my birthday there~ That was very nice of him!  It's funny how they decorated the wall with hello kitty "happy birthday" sign =P I had a great time at Raven. Thank you!

2XbQIi87ySz7KSOI4RgCuA.review_text: I came here for Club Vogue on a Friday night and had a such a fun time! The downstairs music was all those great 90's pop hits you know and love and upstairs was current alternative dance music (like Yeah Yeah Yeahs, Goldfrapp, etc.).  It was the best of both worlds!  There were 3 bars (2 smaller bars downstairs and 1 larger bar upstairs that opens later when the top floor opens for dancing) and quite a few places to sit if you wanted to take a break from the dancing.  I arrived a little after 9 and missed happy hour (dang), but there was no cover (yay).  They had quite a few cocktails on the menu that were Raven specialties, but I didn't have any and can't comment on them except price (average was around $8, which is pretty standard for a club).  I can say that the bartender was really sweet and I got a club soda for free (nice touch).   I definitely want to come back and try out happy hour sometime since the bar is located near several restaurants that I like (Citizen's Band, Radius, Basil, and Triptych) and then return later if it's a Friday when Club Vogue is there again!   Oh, I should also comment that the remodel is beautiful.  I was here once before when it was another bar/club and it wasn't anything special, but it's so much nicer now.  Very clean and modern look.

5gYuDNajn4FiF9LQ3HV5FA.review_text: I hosted a 35-person birthday party at Raven and they were totally awesome.  We reserved the back bar, which is a 35-person space (and we fit very comfortably), for no rental fee and no bar minimum.  As others have mentioned on this page, that's a rare treat in SF.  We set up the reservation with the manager, Vince, who was easy to deal with and quick to respond via email.  When we arrived they had decorated the space with balloons and happy birthday signs, which was a really nice touch.  They gave us our own bartender (Dave, who is super nice - ask for him if you can) for the entire night, and made sure nobody else encroached on us.  Vince offered to let us adjust both the lighting and music volume in the back bar to whatever we wanted, although we found the default settings to be perfect on both counts.  Their list of signature cocktails are delicious, and reasonably priced at $8-9.  Also, they let us bring in our own snacks and food.  FYI, they have an upstairs area that you can reserve if you have a larger party (it was too big for us).  TLDR:  Very highly recommended for either an impromptu drink or a private event.

qnF-Fo5VDP5Tp2PxFsBNkQ.review_text: Came here on saturday and it was jam packed.  They let way too many people in through the night, the place was so crowded you couldnt walk anywhere!  Not to mention the dance floor was way too packed and there was no A/C...the whole dance floor was stuffy and gross.  The bartenders are cool but they dont serve beer on tap..uhh what kind of bar is this?  An OK place, but if your looking for a better bar atmosphere go next door to bloodhound.

Z88N6qly3Dp5C06XbZ9IMQ.review_text: Raven, you got me crushin on you.  Bartenders that actually smile, HOT HOT HOT dance floor (2nd floor is much better!), booths for private parties and an outside patio to cool yourself if it gets too stuffy inside.  I don't go clubbing anymore, but Raven brought me back. Waaay back into the 80's 90's and the boy band era.  I mean, Justin Timberlake didn't even have chest hair! (oooh, but I still like him though) And it's good to end the night with hip-hop music coz let's face it, all that twerking you do at home in your living room? FINALLY pays off, right?! :p  I loved the Fuego cocktail, which has tequila, jalapeño, cucumber and lime juice. If you need to take the edge off a little bit, do an extra shot of tequila at the bar. Don Julio knows wassup.

cvNHL2TIus0dKSZOlGwC8Q.review_text: This review is long overdue...been to Raven more times in the last month than I care to admit, haha.  Love it here on a Friday night - no cover.  Saturday there's a cover of $10, so if you know you're gonna hit up this spot get yourself on the guest list.  Music is always fun without excessive EDM, and my friends and I always have a blast dancing here.  I'll echo the sentiments of other reviewers - the bartenders are awesome here.  I've become a sucker for craft cocktails and they do it right.  Even on really busy nights they keep their focus and are attentive.  And it's true...they aren't bad to look at either ;).

H9FnhuwhThIk7-alE-FdwA.review_text: Got in contact with Vince (the manager?) a week in advance about table reservations. And guess what? It's FREE (rare treat in SF)!! No bar minimum nor bottle service required. He was really quick with email and I highly recommend this bar for your next celebration :) I reserved a table for ~15 people at 9:30-10pm on a Saturday night for my boyfriend's birthday. We came in a little late (10:15pm) and was glad to see that the table was still there, with a "Happy Birthday" sign hung on the wall - nice touch.  When we got there, the vibe was more chill. It wasn't packed and no one was dancing, though it was quite loud in there. The music was throwback 90s, which was great! Everybody seemed to enjoy themselves. We left around 11:00pm to stop by another bar in the area (WISH Lounge), but wasn't feeling it too much. Therefore, we made our way back to Raven about an hour later. At this point, people were starting to dance, though still not packed. Actually, I think it was only my group of friends who were dancing and singing to Gangnam Style (my friend requested it). We had a blast! Stayed here until 2am, and was sad that it was over :(  Would definitely come by again. See you soon, Raven! :)

LU7ikPXZ5R8tv4oNQZQkKw.review_text: The 2 stories helps this place out.  It reminded me of Gravity in the Marina.  I wonder if that place is still there. I am getting freakin old.  The dance floor is on the small side but a great place if you are not a fatty.

UVxY0iyPaqY7s4BSFtt-xA.review_text: Came here several months ago for an event. It is a cool place, narrow in width, but long in length, and more than one story in height. There are cool little corners you can collect your group, and as I recall, there were 3 bars, 2 on the ground floor, and one on the next floor up.   TheDJ beats were bumpin and thumpin, just up my ally as far as sounds, but can't say they have a lot of space to cut a rug with your best moves. Some flatscreens here and there with music videos mirroring the beats.    Lotsa creative drink mixes for the ladies and the dudes that like to experiment. Me, I stick to what I know, thank you.   This places has a cool vibe, chill and relaxed, SOMA neighborhood. Perfect for those Techsters who grew up with "That's So Raven" on Disney, and even OK for their older siblings.   Their parents? If they saw the original The Raven movie with Vincent Price, that is too old for this Raven. But if they were Ravin when it first started back in the 80's, they may still like this Raven. But don't bet on it.   I Caw it like I see it!

LoLysvZP0o0hm-gk9qQONg.review_text: This bar is so cozy and accommodating. The staff here is super friendly and it's one of the only bars in San Francisco where you can regularly find the owners in the bar and chat with them. I regularly attend Tech Trivia here at Raven Bar. The hosts of Tech Trivia are awesome and I can't believe no one thought of the idea sooner.

fB5VLeUBuaxyCLldt_hpCA.review_text: Crazy hot! In the worst possible way. Terrible BO smell all night. Asian Central stay away unless that's your thing.

1ljC2JgUafYC9wtEUXJ3bQ.review_text: The kind of place that you'd have a really fun time at if all your friends were there or if you rented it out for a private event.  I came with a bunch of my younger law school friends... and we were definitely the youngest people there.  There were a lot of 50 year old creeps lurking and trying to dance with my friends... following them around, etc.  And these guys aren't the "sugar daddy" type.  Just straight up weirdos who come to Raven Bar alone.  Downstairs was nicer.  I liked the side / outdoorish patio they have for smoking.  Not a smoker myself, but it's nice for people who smoke to have a place to sit outside, rather than lurk around dirty SOMA at night.  If I come back, it will probably only be because I'm at Bloodhound, next door.  One perk is that they play some booty rap / music that's played on 106.1 KMEL, in addition to whatever is on top 40.

oMI7eaE2DYfNKpk1CU7spA.review_text: Hosted my girlfriend's 30th birthday here. I contacted the bar 4 days in advance and got lucky, they had a cancelation in their VIP section and they were able to fit us in. The staff was awesome- with the VIP room comes guest list of 10+ with no one paying a cover fee, private seating area upstairs with boots, and access to the dance floor without waiting in lines. The best part about all of this-- it was all done FREE. absolutely NO FEE to make large group reservations here.   We went on a Friday night because they have hip-hop DJs and we all love to dance. They played 90s hip hop music videos and we all had an awesome time.   The drinks were delicious and reasonably priced. Though, the BEST thing about this bar is that my girlfriend lost her phone that night---we called them the next day as a last ditch resort and to our shock and surprise THEY HAD HER PHONE! They worked with us and coordinated for us to pick up her phone the next afternoon.   I cannot say enough good things about the staff here and how great of a time we had. They respond to emails in a timely manner, are professional, fun to deal with, and honest and respectful when it comes to your personal items.   We'll definitely be back. Best place to dance on a Friday night- by far. Thank you!!!

rTpX-Rkb2e90itDkCW1ulg.review_text: I came to Raven for a friend's birthday and I would definitely consider coming back!   I recommend singing up for the guestlist as soon as as you decide on coming because they do close the guestlist once it's full. Better safe than sorry! Expect to wait awhile if you come closer to 11pm when guestlist closes. A girl was checking the line and stamping those on the guestlist. My friends and I got our stamps but still had to pay $10 right at 11pm. What's the point of stamping everyone then?  The music here is pretty good for the most part! They played old school 90's/early 2000's and hip hop. I will say that the music started off great but worsened to obscure songs the longer I was there... to the point where my friends and I were confused as to how to even dance to certain a songs. Perhaps that's how they get people to leave towards the end of the night.  As for drinks, my friends and I had bottle service and they were nice enough to check to make sure the mixers were refilled. I had their lychee cocktail which was refreshing! Not your typical watered down, 75% ice drink.   - As a side note, the crowd here is primarily Asian.  - They do have a free coat check, so take advantage of that.  - Parking can be difficult, as expected in the city.  - The dress code here is relaxed, so no need to bust out a dress and heels unless you want to!  Overall, Raven has great drinks and music so I would recommend checking it out on your next night out in the city.

FuPsBiugKkjHWEtG72bKfg.review_text: Cover starts at 10pm if you didn't sign up on the guest list! Otherwise, guest list closes at 11pm. Came here on a Saturday night relatively early. They were playing 90s hip hop and it was really slow. Music videos are played on the tvs and projectors. Around 11, it started to pick up. The music got better and it all of a sudden became extremely crowded. The dance floor upstairs was packed that they closed the staircase to go upstairs. A few of my friends couldn't get upstairs so my bf talked to the security and he let them up.   Overall, the bar was decent. I probably wouldn't want to go back if they are going to restrict people going up and down the staircase.

fg0DA4pw05NccrXF_ZBkbw.review_text: I hosted a birthday get-together here this past Saturday night. I booked the last table two weeks in advance, something you want to keep in mind when making a reservation. There was no table minimum and no required bottle service. I got bottle service anyway. Josephine was our servicewoman, and she was very attentive and helpful. The music was throwback 90s-2000s hip-hop/r&b, which got a lot of compliments from my group who found it easy to get into and dance to. The bartenders were quick to respond and make drinks. Overall, had a really good time and would definitely come back for another birthday/special occasion!

WdGZ7heq49vI5IkEU0u_oA.review_text: So.... I'm obsessed with this bar.  Jeff and Julien were some of the best bartenders I have ever had-They make awesome drinks and are super attentive.  Not bad to look at either ;)   I highly recommend the basil drink that they have (I forget the name) but anything that these guys make will not disappoint.  I can't really speak to the dance floor/weekend vibe, but we were there on a Wednesday evening and the bar was chill and had a really mellow feel.    I will definitely be back soon and hopefully Jeff and Julien are working because they are amazing!  They took care of us ALL night.  We came in for one drink and couldn't seem to leave :)

qMki_xyExAiIs1_ljqOg8g.review_text: Great Cocktails. Bartenders are extremely knowledgable.

eKUGKQRE-Ywi5dY55_zChg.review_text: The old married couple.  Those who are attached by the hip, rarely go out with their friends, and are in bed by 10 pm on the weekends.   Coitus? Forgetaboutit. The most action they get these days are from vibrators...vibrations from their better half's anal acoustics that is.  Been there, done that for nearly 10 years. Never again.  Last week, the plan was to watch a movie but I was insistent in going out. It was a Friday night after all and Mr. Fernet was calling my name.  A quick Yelp search leads me to Raven. Two visits in 8 days. That's how much I love this low key venue that's part speakeasy, part lounge, and part nightclub.  COVER Free. Zero. Nada.   DRESS CODE None. Whooo hoo, I can wear my granny panties and my frumpy flats!  COAT CHECK $2 on second level.  BAR/DRINKS 3 bars. Shots were a reasonable $7-$8 a pop. Specialty cocktails are $9-$10. The bartenders are very nice but more are needed upstairs on a Saturday night (there were 2) because drinks took a while. CC's accepted with no minimum.  Happy Hour is Monday - Saturday from 4-7 pm: $1 off specialty cocktails, $4 wells, $4 drafts, and $5 house wine.  CROWD Friday night was chill with a mix of older tech nerds and the badminton club. Saturday night was cracking with a very mixed late 20s to early 30s crowd. No hipsters unlike Bloodhound next door. No sleazy douchebags. No pretentious Marina princesses. ME LIKEY.  MUSIC VJ DJ Mark plays Top 40s, Rap, Hip Hop, EDM, Pop, and Old School music videos on the numerous flat screen TVs and huge projection screen TV upstairs. Shake your money maker/hokey pokey/cabbage patch/crunk/fist pump to Florida's "I cry", Swedish House Mafia's "Don't you worry child", Bell Biv DeVoe's "Poison" and MJ's "Billie Jean". Or sing horribly to Jackson 5's "I want you back" and Taylor Swift's "You belong to me"...*ahem ahem* Mr. NSS. =X  AMBIANCE/DECOR Long, narrow speakeasyish bar downstairs (super crowded) with a back lounge area, a second bar, and a small dance floor. Upstairs is "Club Raven" with a small couch area, a third bar and a dance floor equipped with fluorescent lighting and a smoke machine. The outdoor patio/smoking area is on the first level.  RESTROOMS I love dancing but not doing the pee pee dance because there's only one stall upstairs. Although I heard there are several stalls downstairs, MORE stalls upstairs please!  PARKING Easier street parking on the 7th and 8th streets as opposed to Folsom.  I had a blast at Raven the both times I've been and it was the most action I got in a long, long time. My bad for my anal acoustics ruining the mood.   Note to self: Mr. Lactaid and Mr. Beano are my bffs and Mr. NSS'. ( ^ _ ~ )

zRnI9WSppkVHasS1Gti7tw.review_text: Went here this past Saturday, the place is smaller than I thought and bottle service was pretty bad. We waited an hour to get our bottle and had to complain about mess ups on our tab. We got a free shots but after waiting an hour that was the least they could do!

NR6Y46Ni2JjQcj4vDbqKUA.review_text: A couple of my friends love Raven and have dubbed it our "new neighborhood bar."  The awesome bartenders and free drinks probably fuel their love.  What used to be a gay bar, they've revamped and it's pretty sleek and nice instead.  Situated next to Bloodhound, I always overlooked it.  It's dim and cozy inside.  We sat at the bar and now know the bartenders enough to just say, "Please give me a drink!" and they know what we like to make the perfect drink.  For example, the apple pie shots Dave made for us were sweet enough to drink without grimacing but strong enough to have us stumbling in 5 minutes.  Mimosas were an amazing ratio of 10:1 champagne to OJ and Lychee Mojitos weren't overpowering with mint, which I loved since I could taste the lychees more.  They also have a drink called Anchor Whet(?) that is a delicious mix of whiskey and Anchor Steam.  We've also thrown our NYE party and watched the Superbowl here (don't say anything about bad JuJu please) and had an amazing time both times (until the end of the game of course).        Point of the review...get to know the bartender and every bar will be your favorite!

l7joJBDkXDVxz-7iSLa0vA.review_text: Club Raven is one of the hottest bar/clubs in the Bay Area.. with the friendliest staff!  I threw a Birthday Party for my Coworker Jesica last month and i was pretty stressed about the situation because it was soo last minute!  Lisah was so helpful and put my mind at ease about the table booking. she set me up with a table and informed me about the different bottle services they offer. this took a load off my shoulders! i told her what i wanted to plan and she got right to it. convenience!!I LALALALA--OOOOVEEEE IITT!   the night we got there for Jesica's birthday party there was a nice banner set up saying "Happy Birthday" across the back wall where we sat. I was surprised! i didn't expect them to go the extra mile and help me get decorations too!   the waitress was super nice although at the moment i couldn't really catch her name because of the awesome music in the background. she came back multiple times to make sure we were doing fine which, through experience at other bars/clubs, we don't usually get.  i highly recommend Raven for your weekend nights out! It's the new Hype in SF!   Don't miss out. You would probably regret it!!!!

3FiLjZpOtS7nHxbxmbYSDQ.review_text: I would have given Raven 3 stars had the staff not been total pricks.   This place is fun because it's truly a group of misfits. Lots of birthday party groups and bachelorette parties. Everyone has a good time because they are out with their friends and it's not really a "scene" of any sort. The music is old school, which I think is a hit because half of the crowd seemed to be made up of people who were probably saying to each other, "Oh my god! I haven't been to a club in 10 years!" They let in just about anyone. All ages, ethnicities, sizes, types, etc.   The venue is pretty low budg. Kind of like a diner that turns into a club at night. The tables are something you would see in an airplane or on a boat. Very narrow to try and make more room in the middle area dance floor thing. In most clubs this would just be the entry way into another room, but it was the dance floor here.   I had a fun time with my friends because our crowd was similar to the one I described in my first paragraph. We could have been anywhere and had fun. My friends ordered bottle service, of which the items barely fit on our table.   You are probably asking, why only 1 star then??? That seems a little harsh. Well, because the bouncers and bus boy were horrendous. Considering my friends dropped a lot of cash at the place, we got less than par service. The one guy who was cleaning our table kept going over the couches where our purses and jackets were. He kept clearing glasses and drink before they were empty. This is a huge pet peeve of mine!!! We had 3 bottles of Vueve, a bottle of vodka, and whisky. DON'T TAKE OUR DRINKS WHEN THEY ARE HALF FULL. Period. It is so basic. This guy took so much of our alcohol, it was insulting. Then in his mission to clear our table every few minutes, drops a glass under the table (because of course he was on the couch/seat side), it shatters and we all feel glass hit our ankles, and wetness because .... yep, you guessed it, the glass wasn't empty because he was clearing a half full cocktail. He then proceeded to look up and say, "don't worry, I got it." Uh...YA! I hope so. I'm not trying to be a pretentious bitch, but come on. No apology and then implying that he's doing us a favor by cleaning up the glass shards from the drink he dropped.   The last straw was that we were leaving and I told this same little shit that we would be heading out and could he get the caps to the bottles. He literally flips out on me, and starts screaming like he is ready to fight me. Super rude and sarcastically he said, "Are you serious?! Are you serious?! ARE YOU REALLY FUCKING SERIOUS?! I dont' think so! You really think I'm that dumb. If I see you take this bottles out of here, I will get your ass." .... uhhhhhhhhhhh......ME = STUNNED. WTF just happened?? Oh my god. Not sure if he was on meth or what, but he freaked out. Ok, I just learned it's against the law to do that. I didn't realize that because other places must have turned a blind eye.   The next thing we know he has another bouncer and the manager. The bouncer comes over putting a flash light in our eyes. He was more calm, but still SUPER CONFRONTATIONAL. He stood about 3 inches from me and my friend asking us what our problem was, etc. To be honest it was quite embarrassing. Unfortunately, my drunken friend had already left with a bottle and was outside the bar. So, thinking that we were plotting against all of them, which we were not, and just wanted to be compliant, the little crazy one went outside and started yelling again and running up to her like he was going to attack my friend (honestly, I hope this is just a weird night) and the other flashlight guy came out too. In their toughest, scariest voices told my friend to stop, and then searched her body and purse and got the bottle. She had no idea what had gone on in the club, so was like a deer in headlights. After they got the bottle, the little guy continued to scream and yell at us as we were leaving. He was jumping up and pointing at us with his finger saying stuff like, "That's right. You thought you were going to get away with this. I'm 24 and I'm smarter than you!" (He actually said the thing about being 24 and smarter than us).  I hope that this was a one-time unfortunate fluke. However, it was one of the most aggressive, unnecessarily confrontational events. It was weird and left a nasty taste in my mouth. Oh, the main a$$hole guy I was taking about is about 5'7" or 5'8", half white, half African American, he's a bar back or bus boy type person, almost shaved head (very short hair). If you see him, run for the hills!

MtQE4j3xuYLfZ3k6f6nglg.review_text: I celebrated my birthday last weekend, and we had such an amazing time. This was our third time there, and this time we reserved a table to celebrate with my group. I absolutely love Raven because they have delicious drinks, the best mix of music, and great staff that provided such helpful and prompt communication to plan my event. Their website and guest list are easier to navigate than any place I've seen before. Their team showed great hospitality! I had a wonderful birthday. One of the best in a while and all the attention to detail that they gave to me and my guests and others celebrating parties really added to my experience!

wgsNnBpKEAtFyZnJaIoCkQ.review_text: I've heard about this place and went here recently two consecutive weekends in a row.  I love how Raven Bar does play mostly 90s music accompanied by their music respective videos but the second weekend I went they were playing 95% of the exact, same songs.  Guest-list fills up early but if you make it before 10 am you can avoid the $10 cover.  I enjoyed the upstairs scenery/dance floor more than the lower floor but after 11 pm it gets so crowded everywhere.  I wish the mixed drinks were stronger but I would definitely come back again.

txrANKGe5_pxA9vw4XqyTA.review_text: I feel like this is the second coming of the old Sloane, when it was good.  90's throwback mix of pop and rap make this joint a place to check out on Saturday.  Despite waiting in line for about 20 minutes, I still had fun.  It's really dark in there and the place was packed, probably against fire regulation (lol) but hey they want their money.  The drinks are relatively priced for a club ($7). 2 floors but all the action is upstairs unless you're tryin to chill.  The place however does lack bathrooms and you're bound to wait in a line.  Other than that, I wouldn't mind coming back here.  Please don't get played out!  P.S.: This place is Asia central.

4RUXeyp_Af2C5t9JFyJlBQ.review_text: HOT Bartender. Looked like Ryan Gosling.  Good drinks. Old music videos.   Really enjoyed it. Must go back.

vMFr6Rrz_BhHnUl1APwdrA.review_text: Uhhhhh...Will definitely be back!  I stopped by last Tuesday for happy hour, and got their signature drink "The Raven."  It was scrumptious, to say the least!  Bartenders seem real nice, and more importantly, know what they are doing.  The prices are reasonable as well, and even better during happy hour.  Fun bar with a cool vibe!

V0Kg9fkgfoCNvYpNJcv0Ng.review_text: I discovered Raven about a year ago and found it to be an outstanding venue playing 90's hip/hop and dance music to today's top 40 jams and EDM.  David was very helpful in the process to get a booth reserved for the co-birthday celebration with my friend and I. A couple months before the date I emailed him and he assured me a prime booth spot. He also mentioned emailing me a sign up list a week before the date so all my guests could have free entry into Raven all night. Awesome!  After having a celebratory dinner at Radius down the block, we walked to Raven, waited in line for a bit to check-in, and headed inside. The place was rockin' as usual. I spotted David and he led us to a wonderful booth in the main area. He introduced us to Larry who would be snapping photos all night and we could grab him if we wanted any photos taken of us.  There is bottle service available should you choose. We chose to buy our own drinks instead with 2 bars, front and back, on the main floor and one long bar upstairs. Although the main dance floor with the flashing lights and occasional burst of fog is upstairs, people do get their groove on in the area between the booths on the 1st floor.  It was a wonderful time had by all thanks to David and the crew at Raven. I have been back and will continue to do so.

QPrGz52r3eA6alJMjCDHCw.review_text: One of the bartenders totally looks like Ryan Gosling

ef3JsDIb6VaBdXo1DduSSQ.review_text: I love this bar- the drinks, the laid-back but classier vibe, and of course- the bartenders!    Usually, I visit on more low key weeknights because I just want a neighborhood bar where I can kick back with my friends and enjoy tasty drinks and banter with the bartenders (who are individually awesome people).  I also celebrated NYE here with a big gang of friends and enjoyed the dancefloor upstairs.  It was a blast!  I think I must have tried nearly every cocktail on the menu by now, but generally, I just let the awesome bartenders mix up whatever drink they can think up for me or are experimenting with.    Overall, this place is for keeps!!!  Def recommend this bar for anyone looking for a place to hang out with friends in a chill, non-douchey atmosphere.  If you want to reserve a space for an event, this is also a great place - they don't charge a reservation fee!

7kPR3NAhl72EGbUU1h9FOw.review_text: We didn't mean to come here, but stumbled in as we were waiting for a show down the street to begin. What a great random treat! The space is excellent for a casual drink or a more ruckus time with friends.   I was truly impressed with the mixologist behind the bar! He was clearly knowledgeable, and improvised very well.   raven will definately be added to our regualrs list when in that neighborhood.

XnqhCCmXN9DYmytbqXCpWg.review_text: Great drinks, friendly bartenders, and not too crowded. Plus, the restaurant next door delivers food into Raven until 10:30pm. I got a decent burger for $7.

BGRCiOQNwuvduyEdefqKfw.review_text: First time on a Saturday, had the upstairs area reserved. Extremely crowded,3 bars the 2nd bar downstairs was the most laid back area. Bartender gal with the fro is on point (didnt catch her name) outside area, very narrow. ...however, music was slappin rap,hip hop and a bit of the 90's old school. Definitely would go back only if i have bottle service/ vip reservation due to the limited space.

7t6EaupzXHdlsKFgZ5eu5Q.review_text: You would think the best thing about this bar is the amazing cocktails both on menu and off but you'd be wrong. The best thing about this bar is the bar staff. Intelligent, witty and on a good vibe you won't believe the level of enjoyment you can get here until you hang with the staff. Be friendly and tip big. It pays off.

R_ID5xU9Mm78pH9pJNiggQ.review_text: +5 stars for great music and bartenders. (Seriously, they played Missy Elliot... 12 year old me finally gets to live out her dream of going clubbing in the late 90s)  -1 star for EXTREME crowdedness. I know it's a sign that this place is happening, but can you imagine a place so crowded that your face is bound to be firmly pressed up against some douchebag's back cleavage?   I would go back though... Overall it's a very down-to-earth atmosphere and the crowd is casual and positive. You don't get preyed on with the same creepiness as you would at a place like The Grand. Also, the music makes me dance and takes me back to a time when I didn't dance, which is kind of a delightful paradox.

IdnbvI-jYalwwSdLldiw0w.review_text: Super fun place to get your drink and dance on. I suggest getting there relatively early so you can get upstairs because once it gets crowded, they block it off and once you leave, you have to wait in line to get back in. No thanks! The only reason to go downstairs, though, would be the much talked about Ryan Gosling look-alike bartender. Super nice, would've been fun to chat by the bar and get some drinks. Next time!

Cv7ojfqfwDbLlrNJpfWxkg.review_text: Absolutely amazing! I love this place.   I decided to have my birthday party here this year because I've heard great things. They were so accommodating and let me book a large table reservation for free! No bottle service required. When I had arrived I didn't expect much but I had a large table booth and they had set up a sign and things that said happy birthday to me! All personalized. Super sweet!  The music was awesome. 90s hits all night long made me feel like a kid again. So fun and it's awesome that they have the music videos playing a long with the songs, a blast from the past! The dancing can get a little crowded, but what good dance floor doesn't?!   Now onto the drinks. The bar is crowded but when you can get to the bad it's awesome. All the bar tenders are great and when you tell them to "surprise you" with a drink, they really do and it's always great! The bartenders know their stuff!  The one thing I didn't like was that I had a personal guestlist with my friends on it but they only had 1 line outside. My friends would wait in the long line but raven said they would go trough the line and ask if ppl were on the list so that they would get in faster. This was not the case. This is the only thing that upset me. Otherwise it was a great place and I can definitely see myself going back!

LXjuoImv-Ug8t2XKrG2DXg.review_text: They won't let me in. I am not Asian!  Security and manager are rude. How can you say no to money. Guess they had important things to do at 1am. Back to NY where they love money and patrons. They only let Asian girls in.

M302yA7ZwXfGMbECqhUhtA.review_text: New Years 2015 was a success!  Their New Years entrance fee was $35 with free party flavors and a free mini bottle of champagne!   My friends and I were scrambling to get party flavors thinking Raven Bar would only offer the minimal. But I am so glad we weren't able to get any! (We went to BK beforehand to get food, and desperately took some BK crowns for plan b...) When we entered, they had the exact party favors we wanted. 2015 tiaras and eyeglasses! You should've seen the looks on our faces.. priceless.   Even though we had a big group, we decided against getting a table. Online it said we only needed to get one bottle, but when my friend was contacted, she was told 2. No thanks, we don't need that much to have fun anyways.   For drinks, most of us got their Lychee Bliss, Ciroc peach vodka, Chambord, Cointreau, lychee, orange. I was really surprised they used real lychee rather than syrup! It was really good, and it was topped off with a lychee piece, a plus! My other friend got their Herbal Remedy, Zubrowka bison grass vodka, St. Germain, lime, apple, agave & muddled basil. I took a sip and it was light and refreshing!   For the dance area, we went to the second floor. It was the perfect amount of people, not too crowded but not too empty. It was packed by midnight though. And wow, their type of music was totally in our zone. Literally, throwback Thursday. From 90's to today's hit, every song was on point!   A few downsides. They expected us to carry the champagne drink ticket till midnight. I wish they had a better way of issuing that, because my friend misplaced hers early in the night and we couldn't do anything about it. Security would've been helpful on the second floor, there was a guy smoking in the corner in the midst of the fog machine and it was gross.   Overall, it wasn't too bad but could've been better. In the end, we all had a good time.   P.S. They only have one bathroom! So the wait might take a while.  They have free coat checks on the second floor.

06bCB7nvtUnaM5eyEisa1w.review_text: I wood have given this place a five but the music was just wrong and sui loud that you have to tell just to talk to the person next to you. The specialty cocktails here are a must! Each is unique in its item way and the flavor profile is amazing.

qIDy9zJfCuqxy6A3exPe_w.review_text: Warning: I become a bully after a few cocktails. ;)   David and Julien are both very sweet and good sports for putting up with me (& my friends) at the bar-- that alone is 5-star service. I had gone to Raven a few times before, but never really gotten to know any of the staff until Thursday, when I set up an impromptu reunion happy hour with some college friends. 1999 was the perfect setting for such an occasion.  Unlike any bar... they were extremely approachable, attentive, accommodating, fun, and friendly. I'd never had a knack of talking to strangers, but they made it very easy. Thanks, David, for giving me the upstairs tour, and adorable/charming Julien for all the ice refills! ;) Definitely true professionals who love what they do. You can see it in their eyes.   Triptych deserves some love too. They forgot about my nachos order for a while, and then only charged me half price when I got them ($4). The brie burger was veeeeeeeeery good.  I'll be back soon!

EiwxlbR8fb68lMgEXhcWKA.review_text: I am actually a pretty big fan of this place, surprisingly, since I didn't expect to like it at all. I came here for a birthday party where my friends got a table, and found out many other of my friends were also at the same bar by coincidence!   The bar area at the entrance is small, but very well staffed with several bartenders tending to the thirsty crowd. It was more crowded around 11pm than it was around 12am. The back bar is super busy through and it takes a while to get service.   They have some top shelf liquor in the front, not so much in the back. They play music / mostly hip hop on the weekends so you will find lots of sweaty people and good and bad dancing. Definitely a great place to check out for a group / party. Don't expect craft drinks tho!

_iSS1m_QBY9E1f1xOZovlg.review_text: An Edgar Allen Poe themed bar? Neat! No carding at the door, just walk in. It's a great alternative to Bloodhound next door where you'll have to do some work to get a drink there (more patrons). The atmosphere here is a bit more relaxed. There's a bar when you first walk in, then you'll hit an area with tables to sit, and in the back is a second bar in a private room. When I was here on a Friday night, the room was reserved for a birthday party.  +/- There was only 1 bartender at first making drinks; then finally, a second bartender came around. They're not exactly fast here +Great drinks! Loved the Lychee Bliss +Atmosphere +VDJ playing 90s hip hop/R&B!  Tip: Check in on Foursquare to redeem a 50% Scoutmob deal for any drink up to $10. One drink only though.

X8I52lrLMxOrbDIVmFJQcg.review_text: Asians. Asians everywhere.   Pros - Throwback and current music (think "What's Luv" by Fat Joe ft. Ashanti to "Blurred Lines" by Robin Thicke) - Sign up for guest list early and get in free before 11pm. Was worried that we wouldn't make it in by 11 since we got there at 10:45 but there was a lady checking our names on the guest list who gave us stamps ahead of time and got in before 11. Although I'm not sure what time she stops going around and giving stamps to those in line... - Parking wasn't too bad. Drove past the bar and turned left on 7th and found some spots there, only 1.5 blocks away. - Water stations at every bar which was nice not having to wait to ask a bartender for water. - Nice they had a designated smoking patio.   Cons - Sucks we had to wait in line just to get upstairs where the dance floor was.  - Bathroom lines are crazy upstairs (don't understand why only have one for each gender). - It really just wasn't my type of scene since it seemed like the crowd was around the ages of 25-35.  I just probably won't come back here for a while because it wasn't my crowd personally. And note to self: If I do plan on coming back, sign up for guest list so I don't have to pay cover. And maybe call ahead to try to reserve a table/booth.

f0R-Mjfwm2-xA47r36A_wA.review_text: Wow...what a great find! I was looking for a chill spot to celebrate my birthday while catching up over a few drinks, good music and not compete with the crowd or loud music. Since I wasn't sure how many of my friends were coming, I didn't want to pay for too much for bottle service and/or reservation fees either. Thanks to yelp, I found this gem of a spot. I emailed for details and Vince was super quick to respond and great to talk to.  The best part?  Reservations were free and they even surprised me with balloons and a "happy birthday" banner!  Raven is pretty detached from the typical bar and club hopping places so parking isn't so tough. Obviously the atmosphere varies, but when we went it was very chill and relaxed. Not to mention, the bartenders were amazing! You know that feeling when you really want a good drink or shot but can't decide what to get? Trust these guys, they'll give you exactly what you're looking for.   Overall a great experience, thanks Raven!

aXlyB7GGDHhv7WoEWxXJng.review_text: p.s. if you plan to go on a saturday night, there is a cover.  go to their website and rsvp for gl.

f81Y2EzuRqefayCrL1Ra3Q.review_text: I'm a little undecided on how I feel about Raven. On one note, they are not really a club but on another note, they are not really just a bar.  There are two dance floors, upstairs and downstairs. Downstairs has a couple of booths for the people purchasing bottle service, there is also a back area, which can be reserved for parties  and the upstairs is all dance floor, a bar and coat check.  Music is good enough. They do cater to people in their mid-late twenties' (Kris Kross, Salt n Pepa, etc.), also a selection of top 40's. People are dressed relatively casually in normal bar clothes but the vibe is a little club-ish.  Ordering drinks: I was at the front bar and my drinks came out perfect, nice and strong. At the back bar, my mai tai came out yellow... It also tasted disgusting.  Mm, I wouldn't say no if my friends wanted to go but I'm not in any particular rush to get back to it.

iXlY0hqX1GrIukdOsRg7Rg.review_text: Have you ever met someone who was so passionate about their job that they had the ability to make their work look exciting? The Raven has arguably one of the best bartenders in town. Watching David mix drinks is like watching Magic Johnson in the 1980's thread a pass; he's precise and does it with a smile. I witnessed this guy take five cocktail orders at one time, carefully make them, all while keeping the other patrons at the bar happy by chatting with them. The guy could probably be a pilot.  If you want to see perfection in the art of mixology, then watch David prepare one of his signature Vampire Slayers or a more traditional Old Fashioned. He's fast but never sloppy, and meticulous with peeling the twist and prepping the rim.   Not only is David good at what he does, but he's incredibly friendly and strives to make sure his patrons are happy; whether it's a simple gesture of greeting people, asking how your cocktail is, or if you're okay with the channel the TV is on. If you own a bar or are thinking of owning a bar, I'd go and observe this guy. More important than his knowledge of spirits is how he treats his customers.  I went on a Thursday for their happy hour. The prices were very reasonable; $8 for specialty cocktails, $4 draft beers, and $4 well drinks. They also have a menu for food from Triptych which they'll bring over from next door. Upstairs at around 9:00, a Video DJ spins and projects music from the 90's, not to be confused with a VeeJay (i.e. Bill Bellamy, Daisy Fuentes, Kennedy, Idalis, etc.)  He mixes music and the accompanying videos. Pretty awesome. I've never seen anything like it.  The bar fills up pretty quickly, which is to be expected with their drink specials and their service. The crowd was also pretty diverse, from tech people to Burning Man attendees who were doing fund raising. Seems like the type of place where you would feel comfortable enough to strike up a conversation with just about anyone.  My one complaint would be the server who didn't ask if we needed change for the food from Triptych. She just assumed it was hers to keep and off she went without even saying thank you.

As71uCzIDIwkZ8s1p40cmQ.review_text: My first time going here was for my cousin's birthday. I enjoyed the music (old school 90's/hip-hop) and we all had a great time. I decided to celebrate my birthday here as well, did my research, checked out their website, etc. I got intouch with the General Manager David, who explained the details of hosting an event here. Since this was my first experience having a table at Raven's Bar, I assumed in order to reserve a table you would need to purchase a bottle which you didn't, unlike most places! I ended up purchasing a bottle anyways, since I thought it would be well worth it. I love how they didn't try to rob you for your money when throwing a party here. They offer free coat check all night which is amazing!   Ok, now that you know Raven does not try to rob you for your money, I want to share my overall experience last Friday night for my birthday. A group of my friends and I arrive a little before 10pm, no lines no list yet, which was quick and easy. (I suggest getting there early to hold your table). I get to my table and they had a "Happy Birthday" sign in my area and signs saying "reserved for Gracielle's party" (totally VIP) we got our wrist bands to get upstairs. The bartenders were super nice and I must say the whole staff was too!!! Ok, not only did they make my party VIP exclusive, and special. David also gave me extra VIP cards for next time and a Happy Birthday card/Thank you note for celebrating with them! Wait, there's more, David also gave me a "Birthday Girl" tiara! Which I thought was so sweet and super cute!   I honestly, have never been in such an epic bar/lounge like this one! This place is awesome! The only thing I could possibly wish for is more restrooms and for them to renovate to a bigger bar. Because it can get really hot and extremely crowded inside. Other than that, the service is great, ambience is great, music is great, and of course the alcohol is great! ;)

IRsj3x6eRpluPrFyXtYVGA.review_text: Came for 90's night on Thursday. Drinks are a little on the expensive side. Good music, much nostalgia. Nice and diverse group of people in there.

mFt934crYEVqfAfCzR9olw.review_text: Should read 4.5 stars!   So I went to Raven Bar once in August when my friend was DJ'ing there and immediately knew I wanted to have my birthday party there (which wasn't until November!) Everything about the ambiance made it appealing to me -- I'm not a big fan of the club scene at all, and especially not for hosting my own birthday at one. That's why I love Raven because it's more of a bar feel than anything, with the upstairs almost like a little lounge.  Anyways, so I made reservations to host my birthday in November and the manager, Vince, was more than helpful. He booked me the upstairs private seated area two months in advance and not to mention everything was free. No charge for the table, no charges for bottle service, no mandatory spending amount -- nothing! It's not common you find a lounge with perks like this. Oh and I got there and there were two huge "happy birthday" banners in our section as well.. so sweet. Anyways, all in all, after my party last night I can honestly say it was one of the best nights out I have had.   Only reason why I wouldn't give it 5 stars was because of the music. When we first got there it was around 10:45 and they had been playing 80's club music for a good hour. Later I found out this was the DJ's specialty. I actually went up to the booth to ask him if he had more of a selection for the rest of the night. Around 11:30 the vibe changed to mostly top 40's and some random 90's songs (TLC- Waterfalls, lol). Anyways, I would have wanted more house music but it's okay, all in all it was an awesome night and it's always fun dancing to top 40's as well so I can't complain.  Great experience and I really suggest Raven Bar!

Wh2Y4k8MPPvBAGoRu4WCNw.review_text: 90's music?! I. LOVE. IT. Okay, so yeah they play the songs to completion. I'm not sure if they have a DJ, but still! I had a good time. It was like a flashback to the past with all of those older Usher songs. They even played a lot of music videos on the TV screens!   By the way, I just love dancing to hip hop in general so this place won me over on that one alone! It was just a plus that it was 90s hip hop.   The place itself was somewhat small and it felt really crowded. There are two floors with 3 separate bars. There was one part that was closed for a private party downstairs. The main dance floor area was on the second floor so we mostly stayed up there.   The bartenders were great too! They work fast and got us our drinks. The prices are pretty standard.   I would definitely come back again!

VP9bk26Wzufn3T8QEWgSwQ.review_text: Fun place with pretty good music and clean bathrooms which was a big surprise! It was hot as hell in the back room though.

3xsmXxDysn5yqflq3AzWKQ.review_text: We held a college alumni happy hour here on a weeknight and the staff was awesome.  They were more than happy to set aside some couches for us towards the back of the bar, making it really easy for us to gather in once spot.  I loved the ambiance of the space and their clever cocktails as well.  Now I really want to get here on a weekend.   Nice work Raven!

xiBGreimmO1XYqznZIwv1w.review_text: Raven is poppin' on a Friday night - unexpected fun for sure last weekend...  We headed here just for some drinks and catch up after 10pm on a Friday night with some friends, and it was nice that the lower bar area had ample seating for our group. Drinks are on the pricy side for their signature cocktails, but I think that their concoctions are worth it...my friend destroyed the lychee bliss..nearly chugged it actually because it was so good.  What I didn't realize until later was that there was a video DJ upstairs - basically it's a relatively small dance floor with music videos and a DJ mixing 90's rap w/ EDM w/ top 40 and old school pop. A very eclectic variety, but it was so fun just to goof off on the dancefloor with friends to songs old, new, and plain interesting. That mix PLUS the wall-sized projection of the music videos themselves AND the cool laser lights entertained us for quite a while. It did get pretty crowded and hot toward the end of the night, but again, pretty surprised that Raven turned out to be a really fun night!

uSVgYDjxSftY8VO3VK_R0w.review_text: It's a fun place to go to if you're youth was spent in the 90's and early 00's. They play both newer music and throwback hits and the DJ is pretty good with keeping the flow.  The drinks are kind of pricey like your would find at a lounge but they are very well made and unique.  Get in there early to avoid paying a cover fee for when it gets crowded at night.  Bottle service is first come first serve but honestly, unless it's a big party, forgo the bottle and spend the money trying a variety of different drinks.

lLfcbYGTeVxQN5Ig0ompJg.review_text: I haven't been to a venue that even resembles a club in forever! So I wasn't sure if I was going to like Raven. Surprisingly, I had a great time! They play great music here. A mix of 80s/90s/early 2000s, hip hop, pop, etc. A lot of my favs. Plus I do love dancing!  It can get crowded, so if you'd like to dance the night away, get there early so you can get upstairs. There's a bar and dance floor there. They only let a certain number of people up there at a time, so the line can get a little long. Downstairs, it's a little more loungy, but it can get super stuffy when crowded. I found myself out in the smoking patio for the last hour or so since I needed air.  Not sure if there's a cover, but we were on a table guest list and got in for free. We did show up early though. Around 10p.  Again great music and a nice vibe. Given my old age, I almost skipped going to Raven since I felt too old for the club scene. I'm glad I didn't!

tj2GPWuaJsTbR2YwP6Yd7Q.review_text: I stopped by here for a private party associated with the SF Asian American Film Festival.  Given how often I'm in this area I was surprised that I wasn't familiar with this establishment.  Then I found out it had opened just month prior and the grand opening party is scheduled to occur this coming weekend.  My friends and I tried out a few of their signature cocktails made with fresh fruit juices and their beers on tap.  They have three full bars, a DJ with dancing upstairs and plenty of space for hanging out.   I really liked the music they played - not too loud and created just the right vibe for a fun time, but then again I was here during the day when the space wasn't too crowded.  The drinks are very reasonably priced ($5 for draught beers) and they carry a good variety of wines, beers and liquor.   A huge plus are the super nice bartenders.  Not only did they remember the crazy complicated request from one friend but they were fast, efficient, funny and down to earth,  No attitudes to be found here.  A great place to hang out and relax with friends.  I cannot wait to make a return visit!

r_KAjTn5Thb-PV4-qZ8SnQ.review_text: This bar is a must hit for Friday night fun. Caught somewhere between bar and club, you have as much of a change of dancing the night away as catching a good convo in the couches downstairs.  Each time I've been the music has been 90s to current hip hop which almost seems to go over the heads of the barely 21 attendees.  Go before 11 and skip the door price.

xdT-CrIx2a8qvR1SSOrOcg.review_text: Another stop on the happy hour tour, Raven's cocktail menu skewed on the sweet side of things for my tastes, but the drinks we sampled weren't bad. The Vampire Slayer with Bulleit Rye, citrus, bitters and "cherry-orange flavors" was heavy on the last ingredient, but not totally out of balance. Similarly, the Anchors Away had a bit too much cherry flavor for more than one, but $1 off the signature cocktails was enough for us to look something else to try.   Unfortunately, the bartender got wrapped up in a conversation with another patron, so despite having 25 minutes before needing to leave for dinner (and despite indicating we were interested in another round), we had to eventually just ask for the tab and go. I'd hate to see what happens to service when the place gets more than 3 customers in it.

cmAHVj0b5Wz5Tun6Op0ksw.review_text: Came here on Halloween around 630, made it for Happy Hour.  It took a while to get served, I think the bartenders were new, but then DAVID showed up.  Chinese, not Korean bar tending genius. He was efficient and had his own special drinks that were not on the menu.  Tell him what you like and he will make something awesome.  He made me a strawberry basil drink that was delicious.  Quality definitely skyrocketed once he came to the rescue. 5 stars for great service and great drinks.

JKIkdVqAJLEXTq92gF98bA.review_text: Maybe it's just (the grossly immature 10 year old in) me, but as we walked into Raven, I just wanted to start screaming, "CAW! CAW!" at the top of my lungs.  Fortunately for me, my friends, and everyone within shouting distance, I restrained myself, for fear of overly embarrassing the birthday girl.  (Side note: And no, not as some sort of mating call to attract the ladies, as my friend suggested.  Plus, if it did work, I would have some serious questions about those girls...).  Over the last year or so, Raven has, for better or worse, become quite a popular spot in SoMa.  The only reason why I say "worse" is that, despite having two floors, the place isn't all that spacious.  In fact, it gets really cramped really fast, so arriving earlier is better.  While we were able to walk right upstairs (with no cover), our friends arrived 45 minutes later and had to wait in line downstairs.  Thus, once you make it upstairs, stay there.   Since we spent pretty much the entire night on the upper level, I can't speak to what the lower level is like.   Upstairs though, there's a good amount going on - more of a club-ish vibe, with a decently sized bar, a handful of tables, bathrooms, and a modest sized dance floor.  The highlight though might have been the music (and the lax dress code), which was mostly top-40 and hip-hop ranging from 90's hits to today.  If it weren't for how uncomfortably crowded the upper level got, and if my friends and I were still into the scene, I'm sure I'd be an advocate for returning to Raven.  It certainly doesn't hurt that there's a Mission Dog Cart right outside either.  In this case though, Raven Bar was just fine for a quick hit-and-run for a birthday party, and far more appealing than some of the clubs and venues we used to go to.  THREE AND A HALF rounded down.  CAW!

GqzoKYXv6F1O85bhywyoSA.review_text: Having been gone from the bay area for almost a year, all I can hear are my friends going to Raven now.  My friend suggested to stop by Raven for HH.  I got there at around 5:30pm on a Thursday and boy I was by myself!  I was kind of iffy at first, but Dzu made me feel very welcomed at the bar.  And that was just the beginning of a great time at Raven!  $1 specialty cocktails during HH.  I tried the herbal remedy, which was very refreshing to the point that I drank it like it was juice.  Then I decided to spice things up by ordering the BItter Love but Dzu said he was able to make an even better drink!  I thoroughly enjoyed their craft cocktails and their creativity that they showed us.  I also got to meet David.  Both of them working together behind the bars was awesome.  They make a great team, making their customers comfortable, being attentive to them, and just making the ambiance very enjoyable! Loved their personalities.  Food can be ordered from next door at Tryptych, which I thought was different.  They deliver it to you at the bar!  We tried the tater tots, mini crab cakes, and nachos.  Tater tots was the win!  There are plenty of bar seats at the front and few booths in the back.   I now wonder how this place is at night on weekends.. 0_o  Way to go you guys! I definitely will be coming back!

RT-zQ4lKNgSWp2fc1-HLsQ.review_text: I was here last night and, yes, you did miss your chance to rub up against me ...  (I just felt a great disturbance in the force; as if millions of women just sighed in relief and were suddenly elated. I fear something terrible has happened to my mojo).  A rather large group of us commandeered the entire back bar for a friend's B-Day Bash and that was pretty awesome. We were so thick back there that others attempting to use the bar really had to work for it.  The whole place was packed. The dance floors upstairs and down were really jumping; but they are a bit on the small side (which is why my awkward white butt stayed off it... Think "Elaine" from Seinfeld, but more spastically jerky, less rhythm, and none of her classy moves).  The two bartenders at OUR bar were really hustling and I was impressed with how fast they were shaking/pouring because there really were a lot of us and they kept up pretty well under the pressure. The prices were really reasonable and the tab at the end was much better than expected; so that just made the night even better.  The music was a pretty decent mix (which should tell you nothing because I can't dance, so what the hell do I know, right?) with a range of house and 80's on up. And, this will seem really weird, but it seemed as though the music got better and better as we drank more and more; I think the drinks might be magic...  ... come to think of it, everyone got better and better looking at the same rate - OMG, the drinks ARE magic! ...  I recommend - Go check 'em out.

nLH48VyCpl8FLrUiUF-sBg.review_text: Having seen its website and being lured in by the promise of a, "21st century update of the shadowy, brooding hangouts...", I had somewhat high hopes for this new drinking spot.  As I approached, however, I knew that what awaited me was something less foreboding; the cheesy "drink specials" chalkboard out front was the first sign of my plight.  Sitting down at the bar - a very over-lit one at that - I ordered one of their special drinks, The Raven, and dove into conversation and calm.  Glancing up, I couldn't help noticing the television screen, with a baseball game on, above the bar. Yikes.  Then came,..well,... .yes,... Brittany Spears on the sound system,...and the Back Street Boys,... and on and on it went.   My friend and I quickly drank our drinks and bolted, making quick calls to our other friends, telling them to instead meet us at the Stud, where darkness and killer music are pretty much the standard.   I hope that the management does something to get the bar's identity a tad more defined.  Until then, it appears that this is just a really cheesy bar that's trying to recreate itself into something far more appealing.

z7H2ZPjjozYLQ8VSTP8VQQ.review_text: Port in the storm from the hellhole across the street.    Young man running the bar was funny and kind to my group.  The place is well kept and clean, looks more like a place to get mixed drinks and dress up as the sun goes down.  I'll be heading over another time with a group of single ladies rather than single dudes next time :)

Sqk1SP4mcDdwm9ZnyDhuDA.review_text: heard so much about this place was excited to try this place on the Green Light Party night.  it's a pretty small venue in SOMA if you get there early it's easy to find street parking nearby and you get in without a cover charge if you sign up on the guest list.  The music is really good and progressed from the 90s to top 40s, I enjoy the big video screens.

7NRGsP8yrZ3iYaUUZ8xnnA.review_text: I came here with a group of friends after dinner to grab some drinks. Since we got there super early (around 8:30), we didn't have to pay cover. Not sure if people had to pay cover later in the night.   Service: The place was empty so it was easy for us to get drinks when we got there. Our bartender was super friendly!   Music: Pretty much all old school music, like 90s and even earlier! Hip hop, some pop. No EDM which is what I like so that's why this place is just "A-OK" to me. Hearing some of the old music was pretty cool though and brought on a lot of "OOH shiiit I havent heard this song in so long!" moments.  I wouldn't mind coming back again but probably not anytime soon.
