xTikNqkKmebiy2zOlquTzg.review_text: Watch out!  Female bartender (shorter female, there were two working) on 11/14/12, double charged me!  I suspected that she was shady when she was quick to take my credit card because my friend already had his credit card on file, but I wanted to get some of the drinks so I provided the bartender w/ my credit card too.  When I realized that we were leaving this bar shortly after giving my credit card, I asked for my card back because I decided to pay with cash.  Today, my online bank statement shows a charge by Raven Bar last night.  It's not much but I'm disappointed.

F7MnPV_iIqR8TdQrvWjvtg.review_text: The bartender is so friendly and cool. He literally greets you at the door and wishes you goodnight as you leave. The crab cake burger was tasty. My buddy and I shared a cocktail (don't know the name but it had a mint leaf floating in it) which was pretty tasty as well.

cqKMpi-j32YJ-bvBsbjJVw.review_text: Never been to a place like this in SF before! The music is refreshingly different from other clubs. They don't really play EDM. Instead, they seem to do this throw back theme at the beginning- and yes I still love the occasional backstreet boys and old school britney-  and progress to 2014 as the evening approaches the end.  Tip: THE dance floor is on the second floor. You'll want to get there earlier to get upstairs without a problem. They limit the amount of people and the line gets crazy by 11. Coat check is also on the second floor. There are two bathrooms on the second floor- a ladies room and a unisex.

bN9TFVqHvxDPlGvB8OWhaQ.review_text: I just had my birthday at Raven, David (the manager) and staff are so accommodating & nice!! They allowed me to bring my own food. It's a great atmosphere,chill crowd & vibe a good mix of music & delicious drinks made with fresh ingredients!! Looking for a fun night out? Then Raven's your place!!

HgO-zIwjzQstUu9FvnKgaw.review_text: First time hitting up Raven and it was fairly successful. We came pretty late around  1130 on a Saturday and our group of seven got in fairly quickly seeing to how long the line was. The bouncers were nice especially Gabe. But the highlight of our night aside from the great music was the showmanship and great drinks Dzu was whipping out. We spent the last 40 mins at the bar just trying out all his specialties!   Thanks Dzu we you! Great place for night out of drinks, dance and fun! Definitely will come back.

tH4UWCdXozCrfB1doE9EBQ.review_text: Drinks: I'm a cognac drinker, so it was $11 per henny shot and $14 for vsop privilege. It's a bit steep, but oh well.   AMBIANCE: Awesome place to get your groove on. The place is packed and requires a $10 charge if you're not on the guest list. They have two floors and play music from the 90's. If you want EDM, this is NOT your place. My party was singing along to every song and you know that's always a blast.   SERVICE: Okay, first of all - Julian is the best bartender hands down. Cognac is typically not in any mixed drinks (for obvious reasons), but he made a special drink for my girl - which actually tasted great. I ordered drinks from ONLY him, because his customer service was one of the best I've seen at any club or bar. Management needs to promote this guy or give him a raise.   PARKING: It's quite tough, but go checkout the alleyways.   Overall: Awesome place. The bouncers are nice, even though some male employee attempted to kick us out for no reason. The bouncers listened to our side and allowed us to stay, as they mentioned "it's all about good times." Honestly, employees who power trip ruin the fun. That particular employee didn't say a single word to us and pointed us out. He was the reason for this 4 star review, thank Julian for making it up.

6LSjB-LHvhqw3pgePh04HQ.review_text: I went to this lounge on a Saturday night to party hard with 18other friends, we signed up on the guest list and had no problem checking in the bouncers were very nice and quick to help even though we got there at exactly 10:50pm they still let us with no cover charge as promised unlike other lounges who promise free entrance before 11 but once they see a long enough line they begin to charge. One last thing, the drinks were super delicious and the music was 90's hits, thank's RAVEN we had a blast for our double birthday celebration!

Rs0Ue4gGogyW7QsLst8DVw.review_text: Five stars for the music alone! Video DJ Mark Andrus plays all the jams from the 90s to current music. The top floor is always cracking. Yes, it gets damn crowded but all you can say is "the music is too good!" and you can't leave the dance floor.   Beware that there is a $10 cover on Saturday nights. There's a guest list for free admission before 11:00 p.m. but the place is so popping now that there's usually a line and you might not get in before.

i0NJC99TB1l_s9aU4akH8g.review_text: I wandered in with a neighbor for a casual drink - and realized there is a great cocktail space I never knew existed. The space is very well done, the staff (especially Josh) is engaging and welcoming. Am excited to have a new SOMA location with no attitude and some really great cocktail selections.

aw973Pm1nrTbRjP4zY9B9g.review_text: RAVEN .... BAR! RAVEN .... CAW CAW CAW  Man this place is too sick. Nice group of bartenders and pretty stuff drinks. I MEAN STIFF LIKE MY PEN....CIL?  anyways, nice lounge areas where you can actually chill and hang out and they have this sick upstairs with a mini dance floor and a good DJ that spins almost anything  Dress code? not really. just look good to gawk at females

EcNS3VUpK_PcO0vpz5P0_A.review_text: As a venue, it's great. 2 stories means more places to hang out. It had a great chill and dim vibe and the music was pumpin'. If only I enjoyed the music more, it's a little too old school for me. But overall the venue seemed like a great place to chill or to get your groove on.

kKSdriMwhHVoQkWjcZnwkQ.review_text: Ladies leave yo man at home. The club is full of ballas and their pockets full grown. And all you fellas leave your girl with her friends. Cause it's 11:30 and the club is jumpin' jumpin'.  If you know that song, if you like that song, this is the spot for you! It's that simple. And Yes, that song came on last night.  11:30pm, 20 minute wait in line. $10 cover charge. Lots of Asian guys. Mid 20s. THE BEST MUSIC SELECTIONS. 90s pop, hip-hop, current pop and hip-hop.  Some Destiny's Child, TLC, throw in that Justin Timberlake, Drake, Chingy, J. Kwon. Like 1, here comes the 2 to the 3 to the 4. Anyway...  Security to the upstairs was really friendly and nice. Gave him my purse as collateral (I trusted a stranger??) and he actually took good care of it.  Next time, I'll arrive by 9:30pm...I hope. All those '91 and older, see you there. We'll sing some throwbacks together next time! (Dang, my favorite tracks are now considered throwbacks. FOREVER YOUNG!)  Sent from my iPhone. Typos galore!

W_MuoJIhSJYCXJ3q6TkyWA.review_text: A little overrated or maybe because it's been too hyped up.  Came here on a Saturday night and had to wait in line for about 5 minutes.  the line moved pretty quick, but most of the people are upstairs which means another line.  Downstairs, there are 2 bars and tables, but not much else going on.  Once you get upstairs after about a 5-10 minute wait, there is a small dance floor with another bar.  This is a cool spot if it is not to crowded, but it has recently been the go to spot on weekends.  Not worth the hassle if you're just trying to have a chill worry-free night.

U9yWtQO_0LPjtaU9jN0JsA.review_text: Meh. Had a scheduled happy hour through work. This is definitely a neighborhood bar. Small space. No fancy drinks. Mediocre bar food - that's not true, it was definitely better than the usual greasy bar food. Polenta stars, tuna tartare on fried wonton chips. I guess I shouldn't expect too much from a bar. It's also a bar bar - like from what you thought bars were like when you were in your 20's. I think this is a sign I'm too old for this place.

jX84_Qo16y9NiVVf5DbEQg.review_text: Used to be my "go to". Until one of the staff spilt a drink on me and got upset over my boyfriend getting "aggressive" with him. He mentioned that "he didn't care" that I was his girlfriend and got both of us kicked out. No sorry? Rude..

eIa4QJXp5ZNmuFORnuPvDA.review_text: Had a fun time for a friend's birthday here. She had the back of the first floor reserved and we essentially had that separate bar in the back to ourselves. The back was still part of the flow of the bar but felt like its own room which was nice. No cover before 10pm! Show up early. Saturday night drinks menu 7/13/13: yelp.com/biz_photos/rave… * Switchblade - 4 stars (spicy yet smooth; bright yet intense.  Raven's spicy signature cocktail blends our homemade jalapeno cilantro honey syrup and fresh citrus with premium tequila) Great spicy drink! Light and refreshing.

dQ51A3iBnuWfwdTflGQ-PQ.review_text: I chose Raven Bar as the venue for my birthday party because my best friend had her birthday here a couple of years ago and it was so much fun. This time around it was even better!  Booking a table is FREE, no bottle service is required, and you get to have up to 19 people on a private guest list for free entry all night! Reserving a space was super easy. I filled out an online request form 2-3 weeks before the event and I received an e-mail from David the General Manager a few days later. We finalized the details of the reservation and he answered all my questions through e-mail. It was very quick and easy. AND on the day of my party David came up to my booth and personally greeted me. I even got a birthday tiara and a card with 2 VIP passes.   My party was the Saturday after Thanksgiving so it was pretty packed. Me and a small group from my party arrived around 9-930. It wasn't crowded that early in the night but definitely filled up later on, but I had a pretty big group with me so we held down our space haha. There was a little bit of a wait for the line to go upstairs to the main dance floor but a friend of mine was able to talk to "a guy" who spoke to the bouncer guarding the stairs and he got a group of us to skip the line. I LOVE the music the play at Raven Bar! A lot of throwbacks. The drinks are average price for an SF bar but very good. One of the best places for Midori Sour.   All in all I had an amazing time and all of my friends they had a lot of fun too. I will definitely be coming back to Raven Bar and also recommend it to others!

SFCwl4J3Ycgftmt6W9YJ8w.review_text: Not a bad place.  I came here last Friday when they were playing 90's Vogue music.  It was a fun throwback.  They had a mini dance floor and tables to sit around.  Our table ordered a bunch of beers so I didn't try their cocktails.  The service was fast and efficient.   This place is a little far from the the civic center bart station. We had to walk a total of 4-5 blocks from the bart station. Our party was coming from downtown SF.  So bring your walking shoes if your not from this neighborhood.

k7EtVY5AzDQCrDRGNWuFWw.review_text: Had an amazing time here!! The staff was great, especially out bartender, Jeff. He definitely got our night started off right and kept the libations flowing.  The drinks were delish and the DJ played awesome music!!  I especially love the videos!!  It's a great place to get your drink on AND your groove on!!  Can't wait to come back!

pRrfEXsV1WK-a3kv_JfMQg.review_text: I've been to Raven a handful of times now and it's been fun every time. The place is definitely not an upscale/Vegas type club with all the bells and whistles. As a matter of fact, its the exact opposite. The dress code is very casual and almost everyone gets in free with guest list if you show up around 10. It's not a very big place but it is two levels, which is nice if you want a change of scenery.   Every Thursday they have 1990s VS Y2K, playing 90s music upstairs and popular music from the 2000's downstairs. I managed to make it out one Thursday (July 4th weekend, so no work Friday) and it was pretty fun. It brought me back to my college days with the 90s music. Also, it's free all night long on Thursdays.  I love the music they play at Raven. Most clubs nowadays play EDM and there are so few that play hip hop, let alone old school hip hop. I like many just can't really dance to EDM unless I'm completely plastered, so it's nice that Raven sticks to hip hop.   Another great thing about this place is the tables are free as long as you request them in advance. But they do fill up quickly, so plan ahead! Bottle service is optional, but a pretty decent price.   The crowd here is fairly mixed in terms of ethnicity and age. I don't think there is one target audience, so that's pretty nice.   The drinks are decently priced, about $8-10 for a cocktail. They have a wide array of specialty drinks too, but I have yet to try them.   So if you are looking for a nice casual place to have a few drinks with your friends, dance it off to some hip hop with a mixed crowd, this is the place for you. Don't come here if you are looking for an upscale Vegas like club where all the girls are wearing skin tight dresses and heels. You'd have better luck at The Grand or Origin.

2ILxSblUWx4q02E2H_e9YQ.review_text: I just threw a party here and the people at Raven Bar were amazing. Everyone was easy-going, nice, and super accommodating.  Everything from the get-go was perfect.  They even put up cute Happy Bday signage for the party.  The upstairs area is the perfect place to host a private party.  The bartenders were cool and Raven provided me with my own Video DJ.  That's right I said video DJ.  I sent Raven a list of songs for my party -- they played everything on my list and improvised perfectly within the same genre.  My friends had a blast and we all danced our asses off.  Thank you Raven Bar for being AWESOME.  Special love to Vince, Jonathan, and our awesome video DJ Mark.  Thanks for making my birthday party one to remember!

XvKdp9PB4rKJKwI798mJgg.review_text: This was a cool place! Came for the first time for a friend's birthday. We had a couple reserved tables, and there were a couple other parties with reserved birthday tables as well. I think that's their "thing."   I liked that there was a front bar, a back bar, and an upstairs. I also liked that there was a free coat check!

sN6XqrVCINH-_fBbLiPleg.review_text: This place used to be a fun, vibrant gay club. Now it's another boring place for boring marina type straight people to go and look pretty.  How sad, sad, sad. Soon there won't be any gay bars left in this city, except for a few that look just like Raven - blackbird, churchhill.. this trend needs to stop.

uCHi-qeQXR4lYyCFPWQdZw.review_text: This place was awesome.  Dave, the bartender, found us staring at the menu for too long so he chose a couple drinks to make for us based on what alcohol we liked and they were great!  We stayed the rest of the night going through the rest of the menu of cocktails and even trying a few 'experimental' drinks he said he was still working on.    The place is pretty nice.  It looked like there was a second bar in the back, and I'm pretty sure someone mentioned an upstairs, but it was a weeknight, so I don't think anyone was up there.  The drinks are priced great at just $9 a cocktail (and I think $1 off during their 5-7pm happy hour) and they're all pretty tasty too.  Pretty much all the drinks I had were tasty without being overly sweet and still had enough alcohol that the taste wasn't drowned out by the mixers.  I will absolutely be coming back to this bar quite often.

KLbtQdvtcWFdVNCFMT93tA.review_text: I recently came here for the first time to celebrate my birthday with my friends. If you are looking for a place to eat beforehand, because you know you will need the food to absorb things, I recommend Basil Thai Restaurant, which is like a 30 sec walk from Raven.   Since my party was 10+ people i emailed the bar a week before so that i could reserve a booth. The reservation process was super simple! I just emailed the bar and the next day i got a reply from the general manager, who was super nice and chill. Since Raven doesn't require a fee for reservations, minimum bar tab, or bottle service, it is very nice on your wallet. You can save the extra money for the yummy cocktails they offer. However, if you wanted bottle service you can always get it at the place too. The bottle service girl was super friendly, helpful, and showed some of the girls in my party a thing or two on how to have some fun on the dance floor.   The music was so-so. We went on a Saturday and the music selection was old school and top 40's. I am not a fan of the EDM or House music so I opted for the stuff i hear on the radio (instead of grooving in the car i can now dance it out in a club). We got to Raven at 10 pm and the old school music was a little too old school for us. Which was okay because then we could just focus on what drinks to get. Fortunately , around 12 am until closing the music became a little less old school and more of the recent stuff we all know and love from the radio. They also have a bigger dance floor upstairs, so you can strut more of your stuff.   Since it was my birthday celebration, i blacked out probably 3 hours after i got to Raven, so i don't remember much after i hit the dance floor. Surprise Surprise. However, the next morning all my guest told me how happy they were at the club and how cute and friendly all the staff at Raven was to all of us.   Bottom line: If you are looking for a club to go to, Raven should be one to check out! Great drinks for a very decent price and plenty of dancing room for all. Plus the staff was really great! Definitely coming back here again, but sober for the most part!

1WpYGy2ByT25RlXMhe29XQ.review_text: Unfortunately we arrived 5 minutes after 10 and had to pay the $10 cover. However we only waited in line for 5 mins which was pretty good for a Saturday night. The actual lounge/bar is small (2 floors) but despite the crowd I didn't feel overheated. I could tell it got super packed towards 11pm, and when we left at 12:30 there was still a crowd outside.  NOW THE MUSIC. The best! I hate clubs that only play EDM so this was an awesome change of scenery. I'm not huge on the boy band songs but I loooove older hip hop, and of course MJ.  Really the music (and the fact that the music videos play on the walls) is what won me over. I'd definitely come back to sing my heart out.

HQTuvMrM4_MIWU1PSoKPDA.review_text: Party of 10 celebrated a friend's birthday.  We had a booth reserved downstairs.  When we got there around 9pm, the place was still kinda sleepy.  We decided to order some drinks from the bar.  My husband and I ordered Rusty Nails and Lychee Bliss ($18), White Russian ($11), and Martini ($13).  We really don't go clubbing or drinking in the city so I don't know whether those prices were expensive or reasonable.  At least the drinks were strong.  We left our reserved booth for about an hour to go dancing on the second floor.  Some in our party just left their coats in the booth.  Happy to report that they weren't stolen or anything.  Security roamed the area periodically.  Music was mostly 90's hiphop.  Our group considered leaving at around 11pm to transfer to a more exciting place, but when we went down to get our stuff, the area downstairs was already pretty lively so we decided to just stay.  Good thing nobody else tried to use our reserved booth while we were upstairs.  The booth was a heaven-sent especially since one of us was infanticipating...(having a place to sit that is close to the restroom is a major plus!).   We did have a better  time dancing and crowd-watching as the night wore on.

XcWmZ6BTXyiEGL6lofBAbA.review_text: I go to bars for 1 of 3 reasons,   1. Try and forget about my problems 2. Pretend to hit on my girlfriend as if she were a stranger 3. Dance the night away  Raven offers 2 of the 3, which is good enough to get 5 stars. The drinks are pricey though, but they don't play EDM, which makes up for the high priced drinks.

oF4d5SqbWRFlFB-7GuovTA.review_text: Hands down the worst service I may have ever experienced in SF, on a birthday no less.   I was in touch with the GM (David Luu) in regards to a birthday party. We were promised seating to buy a bottle. When we arrived he was nowhere to be found, even though we were told we "had" to check in with him for seating. When we asked various staff where he could be found we were scoffed at and told to wait. When David was finally located (in the apparent vast enormity of Raven Bar), we were told there was no seating available. We got 2 drink tickets for a group of 4 which just seemed like an embarrassingly charitable pat on the back.  At one point David came back and told us a table had just cleared up and that we would finally be able to buy a bottle (seriously? all I want is to GIVE you my money, can it really be this hard?). But surprise! By the time David had made his rounds and spoken to every single one of his friends on our way to "our" table it had already been taken. What's more? You cannot purchase a bottle when you do not have a table.   I'm never going back. This place is a joke.

qUGMYSGV24KD8QFCdGGIlQ.review_text: Really cool vibe for a dive bar with extremely good looking bartenders! They're all dressed up in dress shirts and vests looking quite dapper. The crowd is a mix of young 20s up to mid-late 30s and the music is a good mix of 90s chart toppers. Im not sure what the DJ was like later in the evening because we were only here to 11 when we decided to switch over to a more club-like venue. Theres no cover charge before 11 if you sign-up on the GL on their website, and its $10 if not. I really loved how friendly Christopher the bartender upstairs was and he engaged in great conversation with my friend and I before things got busier in the bar. The drink he made me was one of the best I've had in a while so that was a major plus! Once the crowd started picking up things got packed quick and we started noticing that it wasn't very diverse.. It was about 95% Asian with a few other races mixed in. I personally prefer to party with an extremely diverse crowd and thats the only reason we left. I would still come here as an early night starting point though!

qHpLjdcdZyJbmOITumHjHA.review_text: I've only been to this bar once but I loved it. The drinks were reasonably priced, not to mention the shot glasses were huge. Loved the music, they played a lot of 90's which is my favorite era. I will definitely go back to this place. It's not too large, it's more on the small and intimate side.   There are two levels and full stocked bars with tv screens all over the place. Oh I forgot to mention the Ryan Gosling look a-like bartender. (grinning from ear to ear as I recall this night) LOL

tWtvZ0krDHo56FtThlFa6w.review_text: I went to Raven with all my single mom girl friends. We had the best time. Jeff was our favorite bar tender. He was personable, talked with us, had good drink suggestions when we needed them.  It was the first time I had been there. But, between the atmosphere, the great drinks and our super cute bat tender Jeff, we are definitely going there again!

I-FmdvI28N7OIIt4JZOgIg.review_text: Fun bar lounge that has an upstairs and downstairs dance floor.   It is quite spacious on the inside - contrary to the exterior looks of this place.   Their music is pretty poppy.  It brought me back to the 90s music, mix of hip hop and with a little bit of mainstream tossed in here and there.  Bars are conveniently placed at the entrance, in the back and upstairs!  They are prepared for you to get hammered!  There is a cover after 11, so try to get your way in before then!

-g7YriPrRTcuXPQYRE9yjA.review_text: Tech Trivia is so much fun!  Great staff, super fun and friendly!  Awesome atmosphere and super fun on the weekend to shake your groove thing!

uZdFsE_aHbFBChgN6Xa8tw.review_text: Someone stole my iphone from my purse and from my friend's purse on Friday night at the Drink for a Cause toy drive (hers was unzipped, mine was open).  It's so stuffy and crowded on the second floor, it was not a surprise this type of thing has started since the iphones go for at least $250+ on Craig's list.  I emailed management about our phones and they responded within 24 hours.  I will update if our phones are found (which I doubt, but who knows).  Thief, if you are reading this, please return the phones.    On the flip side, the bartenders and bouncers are awesome here.  I think they all get along and are friends.  The DJ was really good on Friday, he played great music and the music video is actually the music playing, which is nice since no one watches MTV anymore to catch up.

GfOEmTx_iL9y50NqOm2PDw.review_text: I had a good time at Raven Bar, and I liked the music. There was just the right amount of Bon Jovi being played, and I went home with a soar throat from singing in a circle amongst 30 of my friend's closest friends.  We celebrated a birthday massacre here. It was fun, a little messy, and we still aren't sure about a few odd details that we're deciphering from photo evidence. But that's okay, we were celebrating.  The drinks aren't cheap, the location is a little further from BART than I usually like to be, and I thought the description was a bit off. If Edgar Allen Poe and Humphrey Bogart were to meet for a drink, they'd probably go to Rick House, Local Edition, or even Vesuvio. But this place? Likely not.  It's an okay spot- it's trendy, and had a good bartender in the back who must have injected a RedBull into his forearm before coming in for his shift. The pours were consistent (wouldn't call them generous) and the place got a little crowded toward the 11:00 hour. I also thought there weren't enough bathrooms for a bar of it's size (considering the upstairs opens up later).

VlVx6clfF7iZfO_idvuMfA.review_text: Another great cocktail bar in this neighborhood.  We stopped in on Saturday night, and were actually the only people there. Great service for us, not great financially for the bar owners.  The space is beautiful, the bartender was nice, and the drinks were really well made. I especially loved how fresh the fruit is. The cocktails here are well thought out, and I enjoyed both I tried.  This place is right next door to Bloodhound, which is one of my favorite places for drinks. I'm guessing they're pretty stiff competition for Raven.  Even though Bloodhound is awesome, stop in for a drink at Raven. They're definitely worth giving a try.

13hWBSwjT_mIxkrB273dvQ.review_text: Fun place, good music, attentive bartenders.  I come here in the evening pretty often and its one of my favorite bars in SOMA.  It doesn't look like much from the outside, but when you go in it is awesome and has two floors!

6veSoRwdfGBjxigxV91BsQ.review_text: Much more adult and manageable than Bloodhound next door.  You can actually hear each other speak.  The bartender was quick and greeted guests with a bright smile.  What else can you ask for?

-z0TEVb3YpYbKpXZmJS0oQ.review_text: My friends and I love the vibe of this place. It's a happy medium between a club and a lounge/bar. Guest list always fills up by Tuesday or Wednesday so I would recommend signing up early if you're trying to make guest list.   Last night we went to parlor first then hopped on over to raven at around 11:30pm. There was still a line and it took about 15 mins to get in. I had to use the bathroom so I asked the bouncer if I could run in while my friends waited in line and he was nice enough to let me in, but he held onto my ID for collateral. Fair enough.   It was pretty crowded from what I remember, there was a line to get upstairs to the larger dance floor. Upstairs is usually packed with people. The dance floor is off to the side at the end of the bar. It's pretty small but there's always a good amount of people dancing. The music is great to dance to, mostly 90's hip hop. I'm so glad it's not all EDM. I don't believe there's a DJ but they play music videos on the wall next to the dance floor. Pretty cool, although it doesn't always match up with the song lol.   They have a few tables downstairs and one section upstairs to book. Although it's a fun place to wander around and meet new people. They have an outdoors smoking section which is a great place to get some fresh air when it gets crowded inside. The smoking section is pretty well ventilated so it doesn't reek of smoke either.   Dress code is pretty casual. But you won't stick out if you decide to wear a dress and heels. They have coat check upstairs and bathrooms upstairs and downstairs. My friends and I will probably be back in the near future (:

Vkf4e4SLFm3gApONFnWk7Q.review_text: Okay yea I did not really like this bar :\  It was pretty poppin though! It kind of reminds me of the Loft in Downtown san jose.  The crowd was not really my scene and they were playing throwback music. I love throwback songs, just not at bars/ clubs.   These kind of bars confuse me. Is it a bar? or a club? because the space is so small that theres no room for people that lounge and stand about and the people that want to dance. So then the "dance floor" gets all awkward because theres like the 3 drunk guys and girls that are just whipping their hurr back and forth...... into other people that are completely not on that level. hahaha.   Anyways yes so these bar/lounge/dance places are not the type of place for me. I used to enjoy these when I was younger but I have since moved on.

9BeniTtjCRyUe8c5dUW2ug.review_text: I went on a night that they had advertised quite a lot about. Had heard decent things about the place from quite a few people but came back highly disappointed.  The music was tepid. The place smelled weird. Most of all I thought the crowd was too old (No offence meant). Normally you'd find a mix of people across age groups but here I found almost everybody was above 30. Clearly that leads to a very different dynamic in a club and one which I do not enjoy too much.  They do have a lot of space so thats definitely a plus. I did not end up having any drinks (since I did not like the place at all) so cant really give my comments there.

dYgcrxIi38eJh53NddnFYQ.review_text: My GF decided she wanted to celebrate her birthday here a few weekends back.   She was able to reserve a table without any hassle. No bottle service fee, no minimum amount of guests, no minimum amount of drinks to get! Music to our ears, haha. But wait, I'm not done, it gets better! With a table reservation you have your own guest list, and everyone you add to your guest list gets in for free ($10 cover).   There are two levels in this place, the upstairs seeming to be the much more crowded area. Our table was downstairs where the dance floor was much more open. There are 2 bars downstairs so that was great. I think there is only 1 bar upstairs.  90's, 90's, 90's!! This place really takes you back with all the 90s music. They play music videos downstairs and I remember seeing Criss Cross, 2 Pac, Salt n Pepper, and Digital Underground (oh yeah, Humpty Hump, you know what it is).  We eventually went upstairs to dance because it had more people and a DJ. The music upstairs was a mix between old school and new stuff, we liked it. They go a little crazy with the fog machine IMO.  Due to all the perks you get when reserving a table I would highly recommend this place!

NzUoUscLwnoHHbgqXHmQNg.review_text: I celebrated my birthday party this past weekend at Raven Bar, and had an awesome experience. I reserved the back bar area of the 1st floor, which had its own bartender and was roped off. Big THANK YOU to David Luu, the General Manager, who worked closely with me in the preparation and who provided excellent customer service during the event. A shout out also to Garrett, Tammy, and Woody for helping to make it a successful (and crazy-ass) night. Thank you!

eJgAeR9LknjXPJkdsedVAw.review_text: I researched bars in San Fran before I came and visited and this came up with 4 stars. So I put my name on the "list". It maybe got me free cover inside but my cab to and from cost more since we left without going in. We waited in line for 20 min (10:50) and didn't move. There were at least 30 people in front of us. So we left.  The music was loud and not great. However the bouncer was nice and... Apologetic?   Won't recommend :(

ILyyqefYz_iF6cFnXpGRNQ.review_text: Celebrated my birthday there this past weekend and as much fun as I had, there are a few reasons why I wouldn't give this place 5 stars:  1. No in and out privileges. Not entirely sure why but I couldn't even put my gifts in the car which was parked 10 feet away. A friend of mine just went outside to make a phone call and she couldn't come back in, even though she was standing at the door and had a stamp. 2. Luckily I got there early enough to not pay a cover or wait in line but my party got stuck in line and even though I was promised a certain amount of my guests would get in for free but security wouldn't let them in. Apparently the line outside didn't even move and not sure why they weren't letting anymore guests in. Didn't feel as if the place was at capacity. 3. Only one bathroom stall downstairs for the ladies even though the men has two! No need to say more, I'm sure you can imagine the line and wait.  The music was nice and we had fun but it could have been better if my entire party was allowed to celebrate with me.  Oh, and if you want reservations, please do it at least a week in advance!

lzuMj7gYizpgxgT5BzteXw.review_text: I worked with David to organize a company event here. It was so easy to organize, and they have a great room we were able to reserve, with a private bar and great bartenders.  The event was great, the music was fun, we had access to some fresh air from back there, and the bartenders really took care of the team.  They made awesome, delicious drinks, and they had a great attitude despite all the work they had to do!  I will consider them for our next event fore sure. It was a great time, they have a great crowd, I look forward to going back!

y6I7waddCQUpHKelJ9sC2g.review_text: My main issue with this place: Their signature cocktail, The Raven, just tastes bad!  The ingredients include light rum, tea, fig, and lime, and all I can say is that the drink could've been saved if they had used a more earthy and creamier spirit, perhaps bourbon, in place of the light rum, and if they had been a little less heavy-handed with the lime juice.  Instead it seemed like the flavors were fighting instead of harmonizing with each other.  Moreover, my drink was pretty weak.  $9 for a bad tasting, not even strong cocktail from a place that prides itself on being a cocktail bar?  No thanks.  My friend's drink was not bad but nothing special.  Made with Bulleit bourbon, Campari, and Cocchi Americano, it was a $9 glorified Negroni.  Unimpressed, we left Raven and ended the evening at City Beer Store down the block.  Yes, it's a nice space with an upstairs.  Yes, our bartenders were friendly.  But there is no excuse for subpar $9 cocktails.

7z-Crwkwo3wyngtjFhdJ9A.review_text: Shimmy, skip, run, walk or cab... whatever you need to do to get your sexy self over to Raven Bar.  The friendly neighbor of Bloodhound, this SOMA bar-slash-dance club offers original cocktails, killer bartenders, two dance floors, three bars and booty-shaking beats.  Mon-Wed's are pretty low key for those who want to throw back a cold one and enjoy a mellow evening. For party-seekers looking to forget their problems (all 99 of 'em), Thursday's are their new 90's jam night. (not just hip-hop but Nirvana and Ace of Base) Fridays and Saturdays are guaranteed to be packed and good times.  Check out the dance floor upstairs and get lost in the crazy strobe lights!  Cheers to a great establishment and ALWAYS fun times. :)

Vi_qBZBXgkNbsO1qXXkoVw.review_text: Taking it back to the old school! For REALS! Came here Saturday night during my visit to SF.  Paid the $10 cover (reasonable) and walked in and up the stairs to the 2nd floor.  Typical bar and dancefloor.  It was a bit crowded but what isn't in SF?  The music was hip hop and pop... A wide selection from Top 40 hits now and from 1999.  It was a random mix but I had fun nonetheless.  The scene is fun and being in my mid-twenties, it was fun dancing and signing to to songs from when I was in middle school.  Songs from BSB, Britney Spears, Jagged Edge. It puts a smile to my face now as I am typing this because these songs are so old but once you hear the first note, you start singing along as if you heard it the day before.  Drinks are average, the bartenders are pretty quick and attentive.  Didn't have to wait too long to get a bartender's attention. Restrooms can get crowded.  Doesn't matter if you try the ones upstairs or downstairs, you will still probably have to wait.  There are A/C units around the dancefloor.  Try to find where the air is being blasted.  Nothing better than a little refreshing cool air to keep you for burning up (literally). You are probably burning up the dancefloor, which you should do.  I appreciate my friend for suggesting this place.  Had a great time and will not complain if she suggest to go back the next time I'm in SF.

ZZlylZYQK2YgkugH42ieOQ.review_text: Great first impression, decent ambience and good drinks. This place is cool, it looks like a bit divey in the front, loungey in the back, and hints of a small nightclub upstairs. Plenty of space with comfortable booths if you can get your hands on one. The place allows reservations on sections of the bar so don't be surprised if you are blocked off by a party or two. There is a total of three bars, two downstairs and one upstairs so make sure to get your drink on. Music varies with the nights. The lighting is a little tacky and if there's a party, the Happy Birthday decorations and balloons just makes it worse. As far as the drinks go, they have a huge selection across all three bars but only the front one makes their specialty drinks. Herbal Remedy and Hazel Eyes were good but not outstanding. Also, there's a 50% off all drinks on Scoutmob and Foursquare, so make sure you download those handy money-saving apps!

nwyn40lYhUyEZn3J2a8Xyg.review_text: The atmosphere in here is unmatched. It smelled incredible (like candles and fresh fruit), it was airy and cool when all the other bars were dank, and the lighting was key.   Why three stars? Expensive and painfully weak cocktails. Granted, I didn't spend $11 on one of their signature drinks, but after spending $7 on weak-ass well, I wasn't too motivated to spend more.

bcxcQhp0sKYd9eUnEVUzPA.review_text: That's so Raven - it's totally Fresh! Yes, on Thursday nights, the Raven Bar has 90s Night. And I came here on a Thursday night!  Sadly, foolishly, I stayed downstairs, supping on a five-dollar OJ. I don't know much about US bar prices, but that seemed a little on the steep side to me...  Anyway, to business. It was about 7pm when a clutch of Yelpfolk about 12 strong descended upon the Raven Bar to enthuse and amuse. The bar staff were really cool about the sudden influx and there was plenty of space at the bar for us to sit occupy. I actually sat on a bar stool and talked to strangers, which was awesome. I love America.  The bar itself is really nice - the bottles at the back are nicely lit and arranged, and it was good fun to watch cocktails being prepared skilfully. The bar stool was extremely comfortable - I was there for a good couple of hours without fidgeting, which is quite something for me, and the back room, which I didn't really enter, seemed at once spacious and cosy - quite an achievement. I do wish I'd seen upstairs as the photos on the website look wonderful.  The toilets leave a little to be desired - a bit poky and rickety - but overall this is a really nice bar that I hope to return to next time I'm in San Francisco!

NPRyDEG1D2taLdbdXhrNlA.review_text: I am utterly shocked by the high ratings this place has received. I would not consider myself to be a "bar person" but I think I know an average one when I am in it. This is an average one.  There are a number of reviews that have properly pointed out the problems with this bar. First, the most positive thing about the place is the nice friendly bouncer who stands outside. Unfortunately, it is all downhill after him.   I shall be succinct: The drinks are weak. From time to time filthy transients made their way in to requests water or something while scratching as if they had pockets full of ants and we were all on alert to watch our personal belongings. The bartenders were only moderately friendly. In fact, they could not wait to go home, evidenced by the fact that at exactly 1:59 am they ordered us to put our drinks on the table and they stopped the music mid-song.  The DJ was pathetic. He refused requests and played the same house music beat over and over. At one point I offered the bartender our IPod so we could hear a decent song and he actually acquiesced!   If t weren't for the relatively nice appearance, you would think this was a dive bar. I would stay away. Again, I cannot believe the great reviews this place has received.

EhIolH5byA5_IO7VVZyAPQ.review_text: Meh. Friendly service wasn't able to make up for poorly made cocktails. If they were cheap I could see going here for happy hour but, unfortunately, my disappointing drinks were pricey. The music was somewhat redeeming. Somewhat.

N1yra7f04sSOk5zuW5rdMw.review_text: New bar right next door to Bloodhound. Bloodhound is pretty popular these days, so it's sometimes difficult to find a seat or have a conversation without yelling. The owners of Raven are super friendly.  Cocktails are still a work-in-progress but they are developing/experimenting with a list currently so there should be an interesting written menu soon.  It's still trying to figure out what its clientele and theme will be.

76vIFZcC7owykCBjMfGVXg.review_text: Raven Bar is one of the few places in San Francisco that still plays hip hop and hasn't succumbed to the crappy EDM craze. It's a good sized bar with two levels, 3 bars (when all the areas are open), and a couple of small dance floors. There is also a free coat check available upstairs. I've been here on two different nights:  -Saturday: Packed. Make sure you sign up for their guest list early so you can get in for free. Otherwise, you have to arrive before a certain time to avoid cover or pay a discounted cover. Once it hits 11 the line starts getting crazy long though, so coming early is your best bet. They also restrict entry to the second floor when it starts getting too packed, and it gets difficult to find parking. -Thursday: They play some good old school jams, but it wasn't very crowded at 10pm (the upstairs was dead). However, there is no cover and plenty of parking.  I've heard Raven is also packed on Friday nights, so this is the place to go on the weekends if you're looking to dance to good hip hop music.

6JeTaXe3rtyvoPQP71IbKg.review_text: Been here a couple of times and pretty impressed so far.    Only other disclaimer is that its predominantly Asian on some nights, not all.  I don't mind personally since I myself am asian.  So if your group might get weirded out by this, another bar might be a safer bet.   Pros: -Top 40  -Hip Hop -Absent of EDM (awesome place if you want a break from the big room club scene) -Decent Drinks -Multiple Bars -Dance Floor  Cons: -Gets packed way too early -Cover (10-15$) -Do not go here if you have a group.  The place is pretty small. You'll just get frustrated.

BksNhcduRFM4bNWF3vnqBA.review_text: Not sure what happened, but all of a sudden they decided to be more "exclusive" with their guest list and charge a $10 cover. I normally don't have a problem paying if I think it'll be worth it. I used to go every so often since it was just a chill place to just dance and have a drink (or two... or three). I went last week since I signed up on the guest list, or so I thought I did. I signed up on Thursday night, so I thought I was good for the next night. When the woman couldn't find me on the on guest list, she asked if I had an email to show her that I was actually on the list; surely enough, it was for the next week. Who closes a guest list on a Wednesday? Since we were already there, we decided to suck it up and just pay the $10 cover.   This place filled up REALLY quickly. Apparently, there's a line to get upstairs now and they had someone guarding that stairway, which used to be a come and go as you please deal. My friends and I were observing these poor schmucks really waiting over 2 hours just to go upstairs. It is NOT Disneyland.    The only thing that really saved the night was that the music was cool and they were playing all the 90's/early 2000's hip-hop, which is my personal preference. They even slipped in some Britney Spears & Backstreet Boys.  I can't guarantee I'll be back, but if I do, I better decide a week beforehand just to get on that guest list. Hah.

sND8hpfRodfx0wcP_mVmtQ.review_text: LOVE Raven Bar! I went there for Tech Trivia and fell in love with the decor, the music, the layout and the personality of the crowd it caters to. I now routinely book private events there and I've been back to Tech Trivia several times.

rVs5Ttf3TcjX952G289c9w.review_text: Eh, they're supposed to play "90's/old school hip hop" here but I felt like it was more 2000's/music from my high school dances.  The dance floor is a bit small and when I went, not too many people were dancing. The crowd was also very homogenous :\. The music videos projected on the screens were always fun to watch, as is the sign, "Raven loves you so much, so there's free Coat Check" plastered everywhere the bar.  Drinks were ok, nothing too spectacular.

iUyaIOEs9tLPYpE6CKQaiw.review_text: This is the only bar in SF that I will drink anything other than beer. Seriously, the drinks are that good. Ask David to make you something and you will be amazed! You will probably be so amazed you will want more drinks and wake up a lot more hungover than you anticipated. Clearly I've done this before.

6ImN7CLRvsDnrAx6DF4nIw.review_text: Came here for a close friend's birthday party and a just because. And wow is this place lively. It definitely is geared towards an older 20's early 30's because of the music they play. C'mon now. Who doesn't like to listen to Usher, N'Sync, TLC, Eminem etc. etc. My early childhood/teenage music.   Anyways I came here on Friday and Saturday. Friday was def less crowded, but still crowded. Saturday.... now that's where the real party is at. Almost every booth is reserved for someone's birthday! And if you're the birthday guy/gal, you'll receive some VIP tickets I heard. If you're going Saturday, make sure to get on the guest list for that day before Friday... once it fills up the link disappears. It's free admission until 11 if you're on guest list, otherwise it's $10.   Drinks are a decent price. Not too expensive. I mean a glass of beer was $6 and their signature drinks are their mojitos (around $10?). I have to say those mojitos... are too sweet to my liking. But my girlfriends loved them and constantly had one in hand - whether it be a regular mojito or strawberry infused mojito etc. etc. The bartenders are nice and A+ for hearing our orders when wearing ear plugs!   It can get really crowded even though it's a two story place. Ground floor has two bars - one right when you enter and one all the way in back. And the second floor has one bar. Free coat  check on the second floor. But when it gets packed the security guard limits the amount of people that gets to go upstairs. You may have to fight your way up (;   Come check the place out! I guarantee you won't be disappointed! And if you didn't drive, don't worry. Taxis pass by the place all the time. If you did, you'll find parking - yea it might not be close, but you'll find a spot.

Cj8mjd1ZWsI10yGCT3ptaw.review_text: Wow better places in the hood.  The staff was pompous and very rude would never think of coming back.  Better places to spend your hard earned dollars.  Asked for the manager and got him way later.  Wish we would have not asked for him.  Ciao!

M9WXpe77MMlRAdq2Av8Haw.review_text: I reserved a booth here a few weeks ago, and the service was amazing! The manager was very helpful and responded to questions very quickly. They let you reserve a booth without buying a bottle or having a minimum tab, which is unheard of anywhere else! They're also very organized, give clear instructions about how to add people to your guestlist, and really accommodating! Not to mention, their music is always great! Come early because the line can get pretty long!

9KwZqKwiczej8pcL0YBuTQ.review_text: I can not say enough about how great everyone here is. We had our second b-day party here last Sat night & the bartenders, manager, & all the staff were so gracious (& patient) to our group. There were a lot of parties & everyone had such an incredible time. The DJ created a really fun playful vibe & just makes you want to play & dance. I lost my phone & was most sad about losing my pics of the night. Just checked their FB page & they had pics ! They did check everywhere for me & were so kind about helping me, just want to say...  Thank you again Raven Bar.... we will be back,soon.

9YpFIourNrN4d9MwhVfXjA.review_text: I came strolling in here along with my friends a few weeks ago and we all had a great time. A huge shout-out to the bouncer who allowed my friends in even though they weren't "dressed up". He suggested for them to coat check some jackets, etc. Unlike other places, they actually want you IN THE BUILDING! They played mostly your late 90's and early 2000's hip-hop music and this place gets crowded. I would suggest for you to show up around 10PM so, you wouldn't have to wait in line just to go to the upper level which was craccccckinnnnn'. This place is small as other reviewers had mentioned, but it isn't tiny. You have enough room to chit chat with your groups of friends while you shake your bootay. I'm glad I gave this place a try. Parking wasn't too bad either and there is a $10 cover. If you don't want to deal with any bullshitting bouncers, come here!

yW-GBoKnzyduaG86Y1NLzw.review_text: Is not bad at all!  So I came here a while ago for a happy hour, and stayed entirely downstairs. Comfy couches, fried food brought in from next door, cheap drinks. Was pretty awesome.  Then I came here for evening fun, and had a great time too! And...realized that this was where Dragon used to be. Wow...I'm so old and out of it. o.O We came because the majority of the group grew up in the 90's, and we were swayed by the 90's theme. Got a little confused downstairs when there was no 90's music...then realized it was upstairs. Oh. Nice!  I think my favorite part of the 90's theme was when you saw young ones (like, early 20's) watching the music videos on the dance floor. Its like it was their first time seeing those!  Crowd here is pretty mixed. Drinks are delicious, and made well. Speaking of well...well drinks $3! SWEET.

qUUMmANmVRuQxagzH8irhA.review_text: I take back what I said about Raven!! It was so much fun Friday night!! On Halloween it was dead and only upstairs was open, but second time coming, I didn't know this place was that big!!   - Friday night - after 11pm, it was $10.  But there's FREE coat check! So make sure to get here before 11 if you don't want to pay cover! - 2 stories, 3 bars, 2 dance floors!!! - Old school hip hop songs! How can you NOT like this place?! They also play music videos on a projected screen! - No dress code  - Outside patio if it gets too hot or you need to smoke  - Good crowd, lots of asians though - Drinks average $9  I think this bar has it all.  Good crowd, music, and pretty spacious for a bar, probably one of the biggest bars in SF. I'll see you again Raven!

qVWzlwN6Y4K4wh7gsncpng.review_text: FINALLY!!! A PLACE THAT DOESNT JUST PLAY TRANCE/RAVE MUSIC. I've been hearing great things about this place BUT the music is what made my heart melt. Don't get me wrong - love the trance and rave music not so much the ones i hear on the radio but i just MISS the music i grew up with listening to before the trance. Being here made me feel like i was back at a high school dance - loved it. okay so yeah i think we get it that i love the music here haha moving on  APPARENTLY there's TWO floors... and bars on both main and top floor. Very convenient. There's a bigger? dance floor upstairs and i say that with a question mark because downstairs is kinda hectic when everyone is tryna line up to go upstairs...doesnt really leave much room for dancing.  The service here really is spectacular.. my not so little bbg celebrated her old ass here and had a table reserved for her peeps- nice! and there was a banner that said Happy Birthday - and two signs that said Reserved for the birthday girl. i thought that was really cute. OH and she got a birthday card? from the owners? not sure but from raven bar and A BIRTHDAY TIARA!  i mean yeah it's plastic but what better way to get shitfaced that a sign on your dam head sayin "it's your birthday - time to fck shit up"   I came early so i wasn't aware of this "line" that forms outside after 10. So good thing for that because it was a cold ass night in sf and although i was mostly covered - i was not at all warm walkin to the bar. SO YES GET THERE EARLY! Before guestlist and you'll find parking and no line but an open door for you to march right through!

Sg_BvnTHsbc1AABiJjaiPA.review_text: Not sure what this place is trying to be, but whatever, I dig it.  They have a standard bar in the front on the first floor. A cocktail menu, reasonably priced. I think their red bull vodkas are $10, should have just gotten a cocktail. Lounge area in the back on first and second floors. Another bar in the middle of the second floor, with a small dance floor in the front.  Highlight is their AWESOME music. Great classics mixed with newer songs. Play Icona Pop's "I Love It" and I'm all yours, baby. I danced my ass off and I wasn't even drunk. Aw yeah, even got some high fives from some bros. It's a good mix of people, which can be hard to come by in SOMA.

g3elZp6S-MM5Wkl60JxEtA.review_text: I had a great time here. Good music, great vibe, excellent drinks, fun crowd.  I was here for Club Vogue, the 90s music night and it was really grooving. Downstairs was more Pop and Hip Hop, which was fun, but I spent most of the night dancing to the Alternative and Techno music upstairs.

Tpkkwva2pK-KE55h3JOjeg.review_text: They play mostly 90's music but they also throw in some top 20 here and there. So, it's a good mix of music. They have a unique drink list and can tailor your drink the way you like it. Bartenders here put a lot of effort into your cocktail, it's not a typical well- drink-make your drink in 5 seconds- type of place. I agree with another reviewer that one of the bartenders looks like Ryan Gosling!   If you sign up for the guest list, it's free before 11pm. It is two stories. It's a place you can hang out by the bar casually or go to the dance floor. So ladies can dress however they want to get in (casual or dressed up!).

vTugBdYg34rX4KvGpzBrNA.review_text: Came here last Friday with a couple of girl friends, and realized it was their Grand Opening shindig. I had just heard about the place on Thrillest, so with dining close by, it seemed like the obvious choice. In the pictures it looked like a cool lookin' lounge, but once inside, it seemed much different. It was loud and clubby (Soma style), and filled with young kids. Not really our scene. We decided to at least stay for a round, so our friend bought us 3 cinnamon whiskey shots. After a medium sized mouthful, I couldn't drink anymore....I'm sure it helped make my cab ride home blurry-- what was in those shots? Anyways, our friend also started chatting it up with someone who claimed "it was his spot", and bought us some free drinks, which he also claimed "he usually doesn't do." Right dude, we really believe you.  Even though we weren't sure about the place, I glanced around and it seemed like it would be a somewhat cool place to go during happy hour or when it's been on the block longer than however long it has been open.

Aeak_MtjLgtjje3BT5DSxA.review_text: Review for happy hour - great happy hour prices, friendly service, not crowded like the FiDi bars.  I love the space.  Only MINOR complaint - the music was too loud to have a conversation without shouting, at least in the front bar area.

tl7BzUtnzAj_r1WYFXLiug.review_text: Pros:  HOT bouncer! Looked mixed, curly hair, dimples.....and barely legal but he was the cutest thing I've seen in ages.   HOT bartender. Also looked mixed, less ethnic, more Ryan Gosling-ish. So, sooo fine!   Music and music videos were more of a pro than a con.   Cons:  Crowd. Tacky, gross and annoying. That alone is enough for me to cut my losses and never return. Maybe cause it was a Friday night? Idk. I'd have to check it out on a slower night and update.   Overall just meh.

WnurcIP2hudXCrKxgNvbaw.review_text: It's bittersweet writing a review for this place; I love it so much that I wish I didn't have to share, but such greatness deserves its spotlight.  The highlight of this venue would definitely be the music. Who doesn't like spending a night on an intimate dance floor with your friends while jammin to throwbacks?! So much feels.   I also enjoy their specialty cocktails and the creative hands that crafts them! The bartenders are patient and are attentive to what you want. I've asked for suggestions multiple times I've been here and I've always been happy with their choices. If you're looking for a night out with your girls, try their basil gimlets. It's delicious.   Or...if you're looking for a wild night, just knock down some shots. Their full bar is all yours.   Great people. Great vibe. Hence, long lines. Try coming a bit earlier to avoid the crowds.

hH_QPpRV8mDnkL0ECmIa3Q.review_text: Stumbled in here before Cat Club yesterday and was so glad I did. The bartenders greeted us like regulars and immediately made us delicious cocktails. He got The Don Draper, a rye cocktail and I told the bartender what I was in the mood for, something light but not overly sweet, and he whipped me up a treat. He called it "The Palisades" and it was gin based with something pink, and honey. So delicious and exactly what I wanted. The bar tender said he had found the recipe from a vintage cocktail book he owned. Hear that? They study cocktails there and perfect them! Minus two stars because it was pricey but ultimately this is a classy joint with a lovely staff.

-v8HOwloL99xoho6sRuzeA.review_text: Planning on just a dinner date with my girls, I felt under-dressed for the SF nightlife last Friday night. To my surprise, the venue welcomed folks of all attire, from the skimpy dresses to the hoodies and sneakers. Yay under-dressed me (skinny jeans, boots, and a cardigan)!   Music was amaze-balls! 90's hits and flat screens in every view of the actual music videos! When the men weren't appealing enough my eyes were focused on those videos. Plus the crowd was great -- everyone was into the music and dancing. It's really a great atmosphere to just have fun with your friends, drink, dance, chat.   The cons... the inability to move at a reasonable speed between the upper and lower levels. Traffic jams were so bad it took us 10 minutes, including the line at the stairs, just to move between the levels. They need to find a better strategy to get people moving. Also, there were so many people upstairs that in some sections I thought I was going to have a panic attack from feeling claustrophobic!   I am not sure why the lower level is so unpopular... I actually thought it had a nice loungey feel.   I'd definitely come back with my friends to hang out -- but not to shop for eye candy!

cLLErV1CAAXcRkh396PA4g.review_text: Really enjoyed this place!  We got there early maybe 9:35 on a Saturday, so we missed the line and missed the $10 cover.    The bartenders were very nice, i asked if they could make a mojito, since it was still super chill at the lower bar.  Then around 10:30 it started to get really busy, we moved upstairs and it was like packed sardines, barely able to move. But super fun with the 90's music! I did like the music, its a nice change from EDM music.    Drinks aren't too expensive, and there always seemed to be a path to the bar (upstairs).  I think their popular bartender (looks like Ryan Gosseling from the side) was downstairs, it was way too hard to get a drink downstairs.    Super fun! Glad we decided to come to this bar.

DJPyN_3mDSIGU4zFF27RWg.review_text: Seriously if the chick that actually works there is trying to regulate on the men's bathroom so women can use it then she needs to be fired. Club night at 12:15 and she's trying to tell me I'm messed up for not letting a lady use the men's bathroom when  there is a line for the women's she's tripping and needs to learn about customer service when there is a line for the men's room. She was dressed as wonder women and tried to threaten me with the fact that she worked here not knowing that I was sober.

9UFu-vaMvHcM4pTM4o1CLA.review_text: Place was so much fun... they didnt play the "cliche" 90's music all night and played some of the songs you wouldnt hear again UNLESS you came to this spot.... GREAT Videos dance floor and set up is just BANG... As GOOD as it Gets.. YEs!!!!!!!!!!!

y_GMw0XBty_LRrFgSciPeA.review_text: I really enjoyed this little joint.  We are big fans of the place next door, but hadn't made it in to Raven Bar until this past Friday night.  A friend was in town and having a small event here.    First of all, props on the soundtrack.  I really was brought right up out of my quarter-life crisis by the sweet tunes of my youth with music videos to match.  Remember when Mariah Carey's video for "Honey" was like, the biggest deal ever and lived at #1 on TRL for weeks.  Me, too.  So does Raven Bar.   Second, the cocktails are delicious.  We sipped mostly on the Raven (a rum based drink with lots of bitters and fresh grated cinnamon) and the Anchors Away (a beer cocktail built on Anchor Steam).  The bartenders were quick and friendly, even when it got packed later in the evening.    I like the distinct feel of each of the areas of the venue, with the three different bars each having their own vibe.  There were plenty of places to take a seat, but a pretty disappointing lack of restrooms, so ladies beware.   Bottom line: I think I'll be putting Raven Bar in my regular lineup.

RNsCRzGBelO6kD5GH1-rUQ.review_text: Love this bar!  Great atmosphere, tasty drinks, and hot tunes.  Fast becoming the SF "it" bar!

VgtcRwMPiAEeuPsayXB4kA.review_text: This is how much I love my friends: I got talked into going to goth club night here and downed a delicious caipirinha. Enough said.

IhVTv8VJyCDPVyFvXEloKQ.review_text: This place was formerly known as "Dragon" but now has turned into a straight bar/lounge. I've been here twice now for Happy Hour and and just for drinks later on in the evening and I must say that I really like the place. I mean I liked it before when it was just Dragon but it's nice and a good spot to go to. It gets a little crowded at night but other than it's a chill but still fun atmosphere. They have TV's playing club music so it's not too boring. Prices are good too!

9e1izoQvo7YDDA8QnU2KCg.review_text: Came here for an event, but I didn't think it was the right venue for it. I'm not sure about the downstairs, but the second floor was narrow and cramped.  I dug the vibe though, and the bartenders are nice. They gave great recommendations and seem to really take care in making the cocktails. Speaking of cocktails, the drink menu has some interesting concoctions.  I want to come check out their Thursday 90s music night!

UziJPRoSOgZwDZ2qXxrU3Q.review_text: One of my favorite bar-clubs in SF! I had low expectations for it when I first went here, but I'm delightfully surprised and had an amazing time here! They play great music, from the 80s to pop hits with hip hop and R&B, a lot of my favorites!!! I also really enjoy their cocktails! (+) Great cocktail and drink selection! (+) Great music! Mostly old-school, 80s-early 2000s (+) Asians ... Asians everywhere (plus for me lol) (+) Happy Hour! 4-7PM! (+) Love the ambiance and atmosphere!!! (-) 1 bartender most of the times ... extremely slow to get your drink (-) Hard to find parking, street parking! but welcome since when can you find good parking in SF? (/) Come before 11PM for no cover (be sure to put yourself on the guestlist), or else you'll have to pay $10! Also they don't let anyone in after 1AM (so be sure to get in before that!)

tgDoCTmtO3TReVsHRrGrsQ.review_text: Hosted a birthday party for a couple friends here and could not have been more pleased with the entire process. Had been to Raven once before and really enjoyed myself, so I reached out through their website to host a party. Was contacted by management same day, and they set my group up with a fantastic table and an ample sized guest list. Everything went extremely smoothly day of, and we'll definitely be back.  My only complaint would be how hot it gets on the upstairs dance floor on both occasions I've been there. The place is always packed, which is surely one cause, but if they could open up some of the windows that would be a huge improvement. Still a great place to spend your night!

FGmwQ2eV2pOy1j7u4Q-XrQ.review_text: I came here on a Saturday night for my boyfriend's company event, so I have to say that I didn't have to pay for anything and can't speak on the value of the drinks, BUT I thought the offerings at the bar were all really unique concoctions you probably can't find anywhere else!  My favorite drinks were the Lychee Bliss and the Apple Poe. Even while they were making the Apple Poe, I couldn't wait to try the drink because I could smell the cinnamon in the air. It's so tasty! I also drank the Lychee Bliss prettyyyy quickly because it was so good and fruity.   Another thing I really love about the place is the music downstairs (where we had an area sectioned off). I feel like a lot of bars these days play electronic or house music but it's so much more fun to dance to Top 40 or hip hop/R&B (as cliche as that may be). Raven played a good mix of all the above and I had a great time!   When we left, it was already after 11pm (we already drank during dinner so we didn't stay too long at the bar) but the line was already really long outside! I would advise coming early because when we left the bar, it was already pretty crowded inside as well.

R_6eAqfVlVfqx2bgs_zY0g.review_text: I absolutely adore this place. We came on a Friday and it was free before 11. The place is nice and quite spacious with 2 levels. I really liked the fact that it wasn't crazily crowded like the other clubs around. Music variety is another plus. There's a little bit of everything, and the music videos were nice. Will definitely come back!!

WecuAsHBDZGj7Z6_sJcQAw.review_text: Bitter love.  Surreal scene to walk into. Unexpectedly goth night. Not exactly the uplifting EDM vibe this crew is used to surrounding themselves with.  Fortunately a well made cocktail can alleviate any bout of awkwardness.  Drink menu took some time to review. Everything sounded superb. And inspired by Edgar Allen Poe.  Ordered a Bitter Love. Made from Bulleit Rye, Campari and Cocchi Americano. Just sounded right for a goth evening.  Confident bartender went to work. Impressively. Ingredients, mixing tools and glasses were all over the place. Furious activity that led to a subtle and captivating final pour.  One sip and I was sold. No bitterness at all. Just love.  Bar is the focal point upon entry. There are places to sit. Mingle. Converse. Imbibe. Towards the back you can do a little dance.  You'll just want to have a cocktail or three first. Especially on goth night.

4BrEsmvq6-VFgRvtQAJiag.review_text: Okay, first time here. It was a friend's birthday and from the moment we entered the bar, they were super friendly and greeted us all! Sat at the bar, they greeted and said goodbye to every person. Our bartender was Jeff he's super friendly and I loved my winter kiss (I was feeling the holiday spirit). He made these strawberry shots....omgggg delicious!   The vibe is great. Dancing upstairs or just some casual intimate booth seating-best of both worlds! This place is awesome. Love it. Will come back SOON.

phoMcYUbBJeAKUD0GE76GA.review_text: Happy hour from 4-7pm. Nice wide window.  The bartender was a bit slow, like she wasn't able to manage a crowd, despite most people ordering simple well + mixer drinks and beer from the tap.  Quite a chill place. There's an outdoor patio for smokers, about six or so non-mainstream beers on tap (think Lagunitas, Speakeasy, Shocktop, etc... OK, maybe that last one wasn't that ), and they'll make your drinks extra strong if that's what you desire. If you're feeling peckish, you can get decent pubby food from Triptych next door.  They play some hilarious music here. From TLC from the 90's to today's pop hits, it'll be loud, but not so loud that you can't hear what your friends are saying.  Bottom line: Great place for happy hour. Can't speak for the late night crowd, although apparently there is dancing and it gets poppin'.

ldgUHQjxGAd76GZt1AogAA.review_text: Pros: it's two stories tall with good music that differs from the "typical" club music you hear (e.g. When I went they were playing 90s pop, rap, and r&b - as a child who grew up during this time, I definitely appreciated that).   Cons: there isn't much space to move around (as in, the quarters are pretty narrow) and there are a TON of "Asian bros" - some of whom can be pretty aggressive (which may not necessarily be Raven's fault, nor is it specific to just one ethnic/racial group - I mention this though as this club did, in fact, have a predominant amount of Asian men there).   Because of that experience, I do not think ill be going back there again. It's not for everyone. However, the music is awesome, and anyone who likes clubbing and music from "back in the day" should try this place out.

UVO0vrdc8Jfm00p7ixuf7A.review_text: Play that hip hop and 90s! YES! Favorite club music.   Tired of this edm everywhere else.  Only 1 stall in bathroom. Means long line and antsy girls [and guys!] crowding around the bathroom door. That is where you usually bump into someone you know too, as theyre passing by.. and youre awkwardly waiting to pee. hahahah  Coat check avaialble  Cover is $10 Great bartenders= Good drinks not like watered down at some other places

D-anvESbGXSH60T4AalPEg.review_text: I came here specifically to celebrate my birthday on Friday and it was a blast! Thank you, David, for making it a truly special night.  I love me some EDM, but sometimes you just want some good throwbacks, and Raven definitely knows how to do it right by putting on Backstreet Boys at the right moment.  BIRTHDAY SHENANIGANS Table reservations were seamless and David was very responsive. They even give you a private guest list for 30 friends (no cover all night).  When we got to Raven, they even decorated my birthday table / booth and David came over to personally give me a birthday card with some VIP passes for next time, AND a dedicated server for our table. Can you say A+ for service?  PROS: -Fun music (Fridays are 90's-Millennial throwbacks) -Easy (and FREE) to book a table -Free coat check (WHAAAT?!) -Funny bartenders (Thanks for the drinks, Zhu!) -Full bar with specialty cocktails -Drinks are reasonably priced (~$10) and it doesn't take forever to get a drink  CONS: -Tiny bathrooms (only 1 stall?!) but they were pretty clean for a lounge/club -No re-entry (what's the point of stamping our wrists?)  Like everyone else said, the crowd is mainly Asian, but that's not a bad thing. We know how to have a good time!  Overall, great vibe and a fun time. I'd definitely come back in the future!  PS: Sign up for the guest list to get free entry before 11pm! Otherwise, there's a $10 cover.

l8p4iod0odc11QhP4nKDBA.review_text: This review is from my experience at Raven last night.   Please be aware of your bag/clutch/wallet and CELL PHONE!!  My iPhone 5S and debit card was stolen out of a zipped compartment in my cross-body bag. The same debit card was also used at Raven. I notified management immediately and learned that there has been a pattern of iPhone thefts at Raven. So girls, CHECK FOR YOUR PHONE even if your bag is zipped, unzipped, on your body or set down.  Although it was an unfortunate incident, I felt comforted by the staff and security's swift response.

R9O1CMMQXxkJLHQJjsSV2g.review_text: I planned an event here with a group on a week night.  We used the upstairs bar and floor for a special event with a panel of speakers.  Dave (I forgot if that was his name, sorry!) was terrific in helping to arrange everything.  He was very friendly.... and I noticed that with the regular bar patrons as well.  The drinks were terrific and they have a nice selection of tap beers as well.  I recommend checking this place out for a good happy hour.

zlgElttBVb_iFNYWLkppUQ.review_text: Was here this past Saturday night.  Getting in was effortless, there are two entrances at the front and you can either enter to the first floor or make your way over directly to the second floor. There are also stairs inside the building by the back bar that lead you from the first floor to the second.   The bartenders were all PHENOMENAL. Great service and super friendly. They even offered us water when they figured we needed some. It's great to see bartenders take care of their patrons, it's in everyone's best interest really.   The music was PERFECT. Hip hop/top 40s. There is a dance floor on the second floor that was the perfect size.   The people were chill and everyone seemed to be on the same page: grab a drink, dance, enjoy the night.   The only not so great thing is that I only saw one bathroom upstairs, not sure if downstairs has one and its unisex. Which means everyone piles up if there's a long wait.   Next time I'd love to try some of their signature drinks.

Hi0T4tXQWU48EweYwbpWcg.review_text: Order food at triptych and get it delivered. Need to do that next time.

Br5umT9RkqUyMmSfeoz4bA.review_text: Saturday night. 10pm.  Parking can be challenging but we're in San Francisco so that's expected.  (Do be careful of where you park there and not leave valuables in the car as my friend got her car broken into that night.  Just a warning.)  There's a front bar, then a middle room with tables and bottle service and a dance floor.  You can reserve a table for free but make sure you reserve ahead of time cuz I wasn't able to get one =(  Anyways, there's a small back bar and then stairs to go upstairs where there's another bar and a dance floor.  There was 1 bottle service area up there too.  The music is the same both upstairs and downstairs.  They show the music videos on flat screens.  The music was 90's...it brought me back!! Not bad.  The dance floor smelled like B.O. though so I hung around the bar.  The bartenders are all suuuuuper nice!  I think a shot of patron is $10.    There's a single bathroom upstairs and downstairs.  No cover. Coat check $2. There wasn't a line at the door when I came in. Gets a little crowded but not uncomfortable...I wasn't sweating. Cool crowd...good vibes.

NJOspTE_Ms-b8ACPKY73Ww.review_text: Good selection of drinks and cocktails, but it doesn't really matter if you can't try them.   Raven Bar seems like a cool spot, but its strange elongated layout makes it super crowded. You will have a very hard time getting to the bar, and getting the bartenders' attention. Once you do, it might not matter, because the bartender might refuse to mix you the cocktails you were so desperately craving because she is too busy. Well, I guess a beer was quenching enough.   For some reason they are always hosting a lot of large groups for birthday parties and such.  The best part of the bar is definitely the upstairs dance floor. Dancing to 90's music is nostalgically fun.

DEa615IKMclHk5UbsUK3tQ.review_text: Back in the summer of 2013 I frequented this place A LOT!!! It was my favorite place to go because the music and crowd were great! They played 90s music. It's always a mixed crowd. Nowadays I dread coming here because it's so crowded and no room to dance. On Fridays and Saturdays they play top 40, and occasionally edm. Don't get me wrong, I have fun every time I go here. But it's turning into like any other bar/club in the city.

4_UqGZzM6bu0xG7lVLiwPA.review_text: A friend and I had a joint bday celebration here last night (Saturday) and had an AMAZING time. We were searching to get bottle service at various clubs/lounges in SF and so glad we ended up going with Raven. Their prices are relatively reasonable as bottle service goes, and the email correspondence for reserving a table was very clear and detailed. I wanted our friends to get in for free, and I think almost everyone that came, was able to get in without cover.. If you have a party over 20+ the key is to have EVERYONE sign up for the guestlist by the Tuesday before the event.  Although we had a table, we still had to wait in line because the woman at the window had our guestlist - that was kinda lame, considering we had already made arrangements for bottle service. Either way, we arrived around 10:15, and the line moved quickly so it wasn't a big deal.   Music was SO BOMB. I'm def a hip hop & R&B fan, and I literally did not stop dancing the entire night - in fact, we ended up closing out the club. I can't remember the last time that I stayed at a club til lights on! Although I do like EDM, it's so refreshing to go to a club that doesn't play EDM. Dance floor was crowded, but not crowded to the point where you can't get your groove on. Who wants to dance at an empty club anyway?!   Didn't buy drinks at the bar, so can't comment on that. But I definitely can't wait to come back to Raven. It was my first time, and ooh wee, I am SOLD!

2kkvdeiYV9O1kispuYExYw.review_text: We just celebrated my fiancees birthday here and had a great time.  I emailed them earlier in the week about reserving a space and David, the general manager, responded promptly saying he could hold a booth for us for NO COST!!  No bottle service, no bar minimum... nada.  Nice change of pace from most places that require a $200+ bottle service to save a table.  When we arrived we were greeted to a "Happy Birthday" sign hanging over the booth, which was a nice little touch.  We ended up pretty much taking over the back area (sorry David), had about 30 people drinking and dancing and having an all around good time.  They had a VJ spinning upstairs (yes VJ... there were tv's playing old school videos)  and decent priced drinks (the girl bartender gave a stronger pour), what else could a kid want?   If I lived closer i would definitely hit this place up more frequently.

BOB9q7UDB2ojxEJsxBz5zQ.review_text: I've been to Raven a few times now. First time for a birthday celebration, and more recently just to go out. This place is suitable for birthdays, as you can reserve a table in their lounge and get free admission. It has a little something for everyone. Bars in the front, back and upstairs. Lounge in the middle, and dance floor upstairs. Fun mix of music from 80s-now with music videos to match.  Downsides are the few bathrooms this place has...
