One M & one F bathroom downstairs, and 2 unisex bathrooms upstairs. The last time I came here we were hanging out upstairs, saw a long line for the bathrooms, so decided to try downstairs. When we got to the bottom of the stairs there was a line to go back upstairs. Had they told us at the top that if we go down we would have to wait in line to come up again, that would have been ok. But there was no notification. Thus we were stuck downstairs for the rest of the night.  By 10:30 on a Sat night the place is already pretty crowded with birthday groups. By 11:30pm this last time I went, this place was overcrowded. I expect when I pay cover for somewhere not to be stuck in a room like a sardine. Free entry, no problem. But this place charges $10 if you're not on the guest list, which is not listed on their event page (price or guest list). Thus this place is just OK.

JoFsO6JRCetjBZ-NkjJsKw.review_text: Came to Raven last Saturday for a friend's birthday and I must say I was pleasantly surprised. I was pretty hesitant to come cause I was sick and bars/clubs really aren't my scene in the first place, but a friend convinced me to go even if it was only for an hour since there was no cover.  We got there about 11pm and surprisingly there was no line so we were able to walk straight upstairs. You would think that them not having a line at a peak hour shows that they're not that great but how wrong you would be. We were able to walk straight upstairs and got to the bar right away. The bartenders upstairs were really cool, super friendly and they move quick.  What really endeared me to this place though was the music. Instead of playing the typical top 40s, they would play a bunch of music from the 90s and 2000s with a few more recent hits in there. Also the fact that they had the music videos for all the songs playing on a bunch of tvs and even projected on the wall of one of the sides of the upstairs dance floor.  They also had a small area setup on the first floor where my friend was able to do the whole birthday cake and song thing. Only downfall is that it's right in the middle of the 1st floor where everyone needs to walk past if they wanna go beyond the 1st bar, so I felt like we were in the way of so many people.   They also have a large smoking patio which was cool as I was able to sit outside and catch up with a friend I hadn't seen in years but because it was so large I wasn't surrounding in 2nd hand smoke with was great for me as a nonsmoker. One thing that did suck though was the fact that the upstairs only had 1 bathroom so there was a line for the men's and woman's. I saw a few people watching all the music videos while waiting and getting distracted so they didn't notice the previous person walk out so a few times people would just swoop and cut in there before they noticed.  Overall I definitely wouldn't mind coming here again if my friends wanna go out in the city. Parking wasn't terrible to find, only parked about 2 blocks away.

1sPnh7KzQOdWmr4E6G6dVA.review_text: I went here since my cousin who was visiting out of town wanted to go there (his coworkers wanted to go). It's a cozy little bar, with 2 dance floors if you like dancing.  I honestly wasn't in a party mood that night, but it's a cute little bar. There's like two diff scenes here, if you like bar-bars.. stay downstairs, but if you like more of a club scene but not a full-on club.. go upstairs.   The staff here is cool. They might not notice who got to the bar first to order, but that's typical. Depending on the bartender they may make you a custom drink (I asked what mixed-vodka drink they recommend and Tammy made a good mix for me). The shots are also big here, unless my cousin's friend was ordering double shots. So I had to ask for a chaser (I never use chasers, might've been my lack of party-mode), anyways I wanted a juice chaser since soda makes me tear (haha! yea I'm odd). So the cute dancing bartender upstairs hooked it up with a chaser that goes with my shot. I learned that pineapple "masks the taste" of vodka. OH! Also when they were shooing us off when they were closing.. I ran to the bar to ask if I can still get a glass of water. The guy teased me saying he can't since they stop serving after 2. But he gave me a glass of water anyways.. complete with a slice of lemon! Dang.. ahaha.   Then by the end of the night I noticed I didn't have my card. So I emailed them and the manager responded even though he was on vacation. And they had my card all safe and sound! Yeayuh!  Also, when you call them.. they might startle you by greeting you by name. At least I got startled/baffled when they did it to me. (They have caller ID haha)  *whisper: I like this place better than Bloodhound (their neighbor)* haha  But yea, friendly staff .. cute little bar.. So if you like to drink and dance but don't like a lot of people.. this place is for you.

B43n4T1W1kZm708hAMvseA.review_text: Great bar with delicious drinks, jeff the bartender is awesome!

5BpJEC8YVi80ecWT5CtlfQ.review_text: A FUN NIGHT! although the 2 story bar was pretty packed on the upstairs dance floor   -loved the DJ's song selection! they even play the music videos in the dance floor area & i remember hearing some old school throw back jams  NOTE: a lot of asians!! take it or leave it

zChfeqNTyWGxsdcoVmdyjQ.review_text: I like the idea of this place more than the place itself. It's really nice and chic with several specialty drinks on the menu. But it gets PACKED at the bar; like perpetually eight people deep. The line for the bathroom is always ridiculous too. They need to let less people in or charge more cover or something because the crowd takes away from appreciating how nice the place could actually be.   One particular time I was the, the bartender did make a good strong drink, but looked at me like I was an idiot when he offered me Ketel for a dollar cheaper than my beloved Stoli that I ordered and I politely declined. I appreciate him trying to give me a deal, but I drink what I drink, I don't mind paying more for it so don't give an appraising look for that. Or maybe it was because I was at a superhero themed party and dressed like catwoman in February. Either way, kind of rude.   It's a good place to dance, drink and lounge. I'll keep coming here if I'm in the area, but wouldn't make a night of it.

m1Q0ZTeY5aJFrgfAfnVf-w.review_text: Raven is an awesome bar! The atmosphere is chill & comfortable, the drinks are delicious & the dance scene upstairs is great!  My bartender Jeff took care of us all night long, his drinks are amazing & he made a point to say goodbye as we left! Great people! Ill definitely be back for more.

D7ERu96F-7vBF3usfJsLtg.review_text: Love 90s night at Raven Bar! Came on a Saturday night for a birthday when it was 90s night. The music totally made me miss that decade! Drinks were yummy and came at a good price with good service - friendly and fast. The bartender made us his specialty drink on the house. It was a citrus drink with mint or possibly basil in it. Bartenders were pretty cute, too. ;) I tried another cocktail, the Castaway, I think, and liked that, too.  The venue has two floors. Downstairs: The bar is in the front and there's an open space for dancing/lounging in the back by the staircase. Upstairs: You'll find the dance floor, which gets quite crowded, in the front and the bar in the back. If you need to get some air, step outside to the side patio (on the first floor).  Come by 10:30 PM on Saturday night if any parties are going on; otherwise, prepare to wait. There were 5 parties the night I was there and friends said that 70 people were in line. Yikes. I'm not sure what the Friday night line situation is. I hear 90's night on Thursday rarely has a line, though, so you could always get your 90s fix then!

RaSq7WPbxH7Dm5yfVBAgYw.review_text: It's so cool this place has 3 bars. You'll never go thirsty here. The upstairs one is the biggest!! I don't like tequila normally, but the margaritas they had on the opening day was delicious. I had 2 glasses!!

_KDforIDsQS6bIaJi0_V0g.review_text: Came to Raven on a random Wednesday night while I was up in SF for a work conference. It was pretty empty... and that was the most awesome part. There was enough room to walk around, chill, and dance. Bartenders give you their undivided attention. The music was the next best thing... played everything from TLC to new top 40's shit to Backstreet Boys. I went from drinking to dancing to Chasin' Waterfalls to dancing to Shmurda to singing "I want it that wayyyyyyyyy" ... it was awesome.  Don't go here on a Saturday though. I heard it's hot as balls and Asian central and disgusting. Well unless you're into that.

Y8adrWFzckrjuC11aAs9Og.review_text: I went to Raven Bar for a YEE back when I lived in SF and had an amazing time. Raven Bar's high standards for cocktails, modern and classy interior and great service stuck with me, so when it came time to plan my high school reunion, I had it in the back of my mind to throw the event here. Unfortunately for me and the rest of the reunion committee, we had basically no venue budget since our high school didn't assist with reunions. Luckily, Raven Bar came to the rescue. I submitted an event inquiry on their website and they got back to me right away. I explained to David our situation and he was able to reserve us the upper lounge for free, with DJ, as long as we could bring in $500 towards bar purchases. Communicating with David and his team was super easy via email, and something I truly appreciated since I had to plan the event remote from Las Vegas. They provided us with a separate entrance for our event, privacy for 3 hours (although we could have opted for 4 hours), signage for our event outside, and a personalized table-top cocktail menu with drinks that paid homage to our high school. DJ Mark was great at providing music video mixing during the event and playing a ton of songs from the late 90s and early 2000s. He also made sure the slideshow we provided was playing on 3 of their TV screens (while music videos played in the rest). Luckily, hitting the $500 bar tab was super easy since their bartenders make tasty drinks. I was really impressed at everyone's professionalism and would throw another event here in a heartbeat. If I lived in the Bay Area still, I would definitely break my rule of staying at home whenever possible, and come out here for their chill vibe, great music and thoughtful cocktails. Everyone had such a fun time at the reunion and we got so many compliments on venue selection!  (Sidenote: some folks did order food from Triptych and have it delivered to Raven Bar - the sweet potato fries were yummy!)

vXTrBL35yCiPxlMKtNMp2w.review_text: I've only gone there one time, and as chill as this place was I just don't think it's for me- thus the three stars.   I'd give it four if I wasn't taking into account the kind of bar I prefer. The only true downer was the music- I love 90s music and all but it would've been nice to have some other stuff thrown in or better transitions or may be some remixes of the music.  Also- people weren't as friendly with me there as at most places and it just made me feel really left out, which I never feel at bars or clubs. It wouldve been fine if the people had been more friendly...   The bar tenders are awesome and the drinks rocked.

rVSFJGOVNK12rVomLb-Z-g.review_text: The staff members were really great. The bouncer, Clarence was amazing. The drinks weren't that good for the prices. It's filled with hella Asians and wasn't diverse at all. My friends and I felt uncomfortable the entire time. Also, the dance spaces were cramped and the music was old! They played old stuff from the 80-90s. I didn't like it at all. If I didn't meet the bouncer, I would have left in the first 30 minutes. So disappointing!

eZNhFI6m07dvu1zfLfJc-g.review_text: They have super cool laser lights upstairs at their Club Raven! It looks like a laser maze and it's very mesmerizing. @__@  The music plays the same whether you're upstairs at the club or downstairs at the bar. Only difference is that they have a dance floor upstairs. The night I went, the DJ was playing a lot of old school hip hop along with its music videos. It sure brought back some memories.  Drinks/Shots are decently priced at about $7 depending what kind of liquor you're getting. And of course, the high-end brands will be a tad more.  I went on a Friday night and you can say it was DEAD if our group wasn't there. You can look on the brighter side in which you don't have to wait a long time to flag down a bartender to order drinks, and it is very spacious for you to get your groove on!

xnlVxgrLP5HgaKZobRuHZA.review_text: Came here for the elite event. All I know is its in the middle of nowhere, has multiple floors, multiple bars, and the best St Germaine cocktails you've ever tasted. We NEED to come back here for the one with muddled basil. It's is a very cool spot!

CZ_r3TAPrWX-hIE7zSPCEQ.review_text: Had a great time here with my girlfriend. This was our first time here and the vibe, music and the staff were great overall. No attitudes here, everyone is friendly.  Thanks to David who was able to give my girlfriend who was returning to Germany,  a cool bon voyage card and a complimentary drink ticket.That was a great surprize and so without a doubt we will be back.

uQ6GQ6Vppl43W6ZSiTj7cg.review_text: It's hard to find a bar these days that doesn't play top 40 and that call me maybe shit...I mean who doesn't love to get drunk with friends and sing along to the songs we listened to on the radio as kids but didn't understand the inappropriateness of until 5+ years later?  Raven = Stiff drinks, cheap shots, friendly bartenders & late 90s/early 2000s music.   go with a fun group of friends that doesn't mind being slightly crowded and you'll have a great night...and don't forget to grab a dirty dog across the street before you go home :)

g29q98X6ImnDYcjtrPO5qQ.review_text: Swanky speakeasy feel to the place, fabulous (and interesting) cocktails, bartenders who are not only attractive, but know how to banter....yeah this is pretty much the only bar I will go to in SOMA.  Speaking of...I really need to go back....

s16-BUo-orUsELvMu5ocKg.review_text: Coooooocktaaaaaaaiiiiilsssss!  I love cocktails. I would start every morning and end every night with a fruity concoction; I would hook up an IV of St. Germain to my veins 24/7 and I would hire mixologists for every party I threw if it weren't so expensive and unhealthy and likely to kill me. I believe you can find nirvana at the bottom of a martini glass, so for me, a cocktail bar is church.  Raven Bar is an above-average church with a charismatic pastor. And by that I mean the bartender we had was fast, attentive, generous, talented and extremely friendly. The drinks are ambitious but not quite in that Tier 1 of Cocktails I have for mindblowingly original, unique creations.  Between the two of us, my friend and I tried the Melissa's Peachy Lychee, Max's Herbal Remedy and The Raven. Max's was definitely my favorite. It featured fresh basil (sprigs of the herb were literally right in front of me) mixed with sour and sweetness for a heavenly aroma that fills your senses. It was so good, my friend ordered it again. The Peachy Lychee was very fruity and very sweet, but missing that extra kick. I think it might have been because the lychees came from a can and anyone who's eaten lots of fresh lychees can taste the difference The namesake cocktail had a really interesting combination of ingredients, but unfortunately, most of it was lost to the overwhelming flavor of the rum (particularly the cinnamon zest).  I agree with other reviewers' complaints about the space. Raven Bar has a long, narrow layout so it feels suffocating no matter where you are. Personally, I'd recommend sitting at the bar unless you really need privacy. That said, the interior is quite dark and romantic, with strategically-placed lighting creating a delicious medley of shadows into which you can disappear if you should so choose. I'd definitely recommend it as a post-dinner destination, particularly if you're on a date.

d8z9uG3SHTgkCNj5iVcG8w.review_text: Came here on a Friday night with a birthday group of about 15. If you get on the guest list early, there's no cover! They had also set up a nice reserved booth/table, and we all had an awesome night. There were at least 6 other birthdays going on at the same time, but everyone coexisted peacefully and weren't overlapping. Between the bar area, smoking alley, downstairs lounge and upstairs dance floor, there is plenty of space to have a great time. I hate going to bars that feel like a sweaty mosh pit.   No dress code was pretty awesome - jeans, flats, and a nice shirt/top seemed to be the go-to outfit, and no one looked trashy. I LOVED that there was a full bar staff (three bartenders), which meant we got drinks pronto and there was no elbow-throwing at the bar. We ordered a couple drinks off the menu (Lychee Bliss & Castaway) and even got a show from our super-awesome bartender. I loved that they didn't seem stressed out and hurried. Drinks were strong, too!  Music was a little weird - all 1990's hits. After a few hours of N*SYNC and Backstreet Boys, even the excessive amounts of fruity vodka weren't enough of a distraction. If the night moved into more of a top-40, that would be spectacular. Doesn't stop me from coming back here, though. There are far worse things than BSB.   Unexpectedly great bar. I would definitely return!

hRCa5gk-TchVtiLQYUmtJg.review_text: Came here on a weekend night around 11 and the place was packed. Free entry before 10pm, or $10 after. With guestlist it is free before 11pm. Also, free coat check, yay. They play a mix of mostly 80s and 90s hiphop/pop music. There are some top 40 too. The music isnt really dance music. just a whole bunch or popular music from the past years. The DJ isnt the best. But I liked the music for nostalgic reasons.   This place is two floors, with a bar on each floor. Drinks average $10 each. The bottom floor is mostly for people with bottle service and reservations for booths. There is also a small outdoor hallway you can hang out on the first floor. The second floor is the main dance floor. One thing I did not like was that there is a line with a bouncer to get to the second floor. So you have to wait several minutes to get into Raven, and if you wanna go to the dance floor you have to wait again.   Crowd is mostly 20s. Most girls were in dresses and skirts (any kind, not just club wear) and most guys were in some type of collared shirt but on the more casual side.

t25mvijD56MNnOKvLE9wcQ.review_text: I will never go back to this place.  First off the good side.  The bartenders were competent and quick and don't deserve this rating.  The rest of the staff I should get ZERO stars.  The bouncers pulled out weapons on me for no reason!    I was at Raven for a birthday party on a Friday night.  It was a 90's night and the music was so-so for the 90's.  We had two of the big booths reserved for our party which totaled around 20 or so.  Other than the people that were with us the bar was pretty dead.  At one point there were maybe 10-15 people also there not from our party.  Overall pretty lame night.  One of my friends arrived late and had too much to drink before arrival.  He was not aggressive just a little sleepy.  A bouncer asked him to leave, which I have no problem with as he was in no shape to be hanging out any more.  I went to check on him on the street and he explained that a bouncer called him a racial slur.  Now I don't know if this is true as my friend was drunk but I have not known him to lie like this in the past.  None the less I waited outside with him till the rest of our party could leave.  While standing on the sidewalk near the edge of their building I was startled by one of the bouncers at the door who had his STUN GUN out and was pointing it in our direction and had it turned on. There were no other people around, we were not yelling or making aggressive behavior, and I was babysitting my friend.    THERE IS NO REASON TO PULL OUT A WEAPON!!    20 min later asked us to move down the road and I explained that I had called a Cab and we were leaving as soon as it arrived.  The bouncer with the stun gun was still very aggressive and pissed at us, for almost no reason at all.  I would think that being a bouncer you would have some sort of professionalism in your job instead of waving weapons around.   At the same time as this was going on outside another bouncer approached my wife and two friends who were having a conversation and told them they needed to leave as you could not sleep in the bar.  None of them were sleeping!  They basically harassed the only customers they had on a Friday night.    Avoid this bar at all costs!

9GrIgigmXT0LV3fQJ9KGOg.review_text: This is my rave on Raven. First off, I want to say that Raven is probably one of the more considerate dance bars I've been to in SF.  Number 1: FREE coat check. No more freezing in the cold while waiting in line! SF winds don't play. Number 2: It was raining this past weekend and they were nice enough to have people line up in the alley where there were canopies so that people won't get wet. Number 3: If you were single during Valentine's Day weekend, you got a pink bracelet to let others know that you are ready to mingle! (Why don't more bars do this? It would greatly reduce the amount of guys getting shot down with "Sorry, I have a boyfriend.")  Alright onto the...VENUE Raven is two floors, both have a dance area. I like the downstairs area better because it has two bars, instead of one, so it's much faster to get a drink. Also, I love that they play all my favorite jamz from the 80s and 90s. I also can guarantee that you will hear a BSB and/or NYSNC song at least one throughout the night (I heard both and sang my heart out.) Like most places with a dance area, it gets sweaty, but they do try to pump up the AC every now and then (again, they're so considerate!)  DRINKS They have a specialty cocktail menu, with drinks starting around ~$10. I tried "The Raven", which was ok, but I also went to Local Edition the night before and their drinks were much tastier. They also have some fresh beers on tap, which they serve in mason jars. Nice touch.  ATTIRE Dressy casual. Raven is great if you feel like dressing up, or not. They don't have a super strict dress code. I like that.  Overall, would come back.

Zn7lIByuJmQQMVTK7rNAyQ.review_text: Four stars for: *90s to 00s hip hop, r&b, and pop on Friday and Saturday nights. No EDM/House. Thumbs up. *None of that strict "for the grown and sexy" dress code so I don't have to worry about what to wear. I can just wear jeans and flats (or sneakers). People still dress up anyway, but you won't feel left out if you're not. Just don't wear shorts and flip flops. *Even though it was crowded, we didn't have to wait too long to get drinks. Bartenders were efficient, and not rude. (Drinks still expensive, but that's expected in this area.) *Free coat check  Things to note: -Predominantly mid 20s-30s Asian crowd. Thought it was because I went during Lunar New Year and all the Asians were out celebrating, but the second time I went, it was still pretty much the same crowd. More of a mixed crowd earlier in the night though. -Small, sticky dance floor. Dance floor gets crowded, people get drunk, drunk people spill drinks on you. Hence, why I don't like dressing up to go out. I'd say this is a bar/lounge with a dance floor. It is not primarily a dance club. -Although my friend got in free at 9:59, they made the rest of us pay $10 cover when the clock struck 10! No mercy. Be on time, or be on the guest list. At least the bouncers were nice.  Would I come back? Sure. But only if I don't have to pay cover. ;)

ZgHwzKY46X1G-ViSqsvWUg.review_text: Came here last night for a couple birthday celebrations and overall, I had an absolute blast!!   The music is what makes this places. The DJ is awesome! And finally, a place that doesn't play all EDM music. I love me some EDM but a girl wants to dance, dance!:) I mean, N'SYNC, Britney, Destinys Child and TLC dance party?! Count me in!  The security (sorry for my language) but are straight up a-holes. Like rude and on their high horses. Especially the ones that were checking id's last night. I had to take my sister home and was coming back. Given a stamp and having a reserved table, I thought gave me the privilege of going straight back in. But apparently not. The guy told me they were at full capacity. Okay...well technically I am already included in that capacity because I have a reserved table and am counted in on that. He told me I had to wait back in line. I asked to grab my jacket inside so I didn't freeze while waiting in line.  because I was in a skirt and crop top. Yeah, you get the picture. His tone was just disrespectful, completely.   I just hate being talked down too, who doesn't?   Other than that, it was a good time!

ahwpRaWh939Sjns5bWb36Q.review_text: Some friends and I came here on a Saturday night and got there around 11 pm. The line was so long.. and we didn't get in until around 12! Luckily, we were on the guest list and got in for free though.. I'm all for that free stuff :P Otherwise, the cover is $10.   My friends and I immediately headed over to the bar in the back of the first level. Drinks here are pretty pricey! Each drink we got was about $12.. the drinks were pretty strong so I guess they were worth it.  The place is so crowded that when we tried to head up to the second floor, we could only do so in a 1:1 ratio. As one person came down, one person could go up. So my friends slowly ascended the stairs one by one to this seemingly magical second floor. It took about 10- 15 minutes to get my group of ~10 people up.   When we got to that second floor, we could see why they were enforcing that rule. It was SO crowded! But it was well worth the wait to come upstairs. The lights here (at least on the second floor) were really unique. They had blue spotted lights that made everyone look like aliens (lol) and other types of lights. Every now and then, fog would mysteriously appear around our feet too! They also projected the music video for whatever song was on on the wall!   Now what I was not expecting from this night was their music choice. It was basically all 90's music! And some from Top 40. My friends and I really enjoyed just belting out the lyrics we forgot we had committed to memory from those days :P They played songs like 1,2 Step.. and even Fresh Prince of Bel Air lol. Oh, and a lot of Beyonce too! Apparently every Thursday night, it'll be 1999 at Raven Bar.  Overall, I had so much fun here! I would come back again if I am guestlisted :)

wCoEu_uMcIjZ0ffFSsWbZA.review_text: I chose Raven sight unseen for my birthday venue. I wasn't sure how many people to expect (from 20-30) and wanted to scout a location that would be flexible with the number of guests without sacrificing space or experience--and Raven Bar delivered! I got in touch a few weeks in advance and made a (free) reservation for a sizable booth space. David Liu was in frequent contact up to the event and responded to my questions promptly and thoroughly.   On the night of, my 30 guests had plenty of space to socialize, drink (with access to three bars), and dance to awesome 90s music on the upstairs dancefloor or downstairs by the booth. Raven provided someone to help clean up empty glasses and be available in the case that I wanted to get bottle service (which I opted out of ultimately because my friends all like different drinks). This was probably one of the cleanest bars I've been to in SOMA!  I do recommend utilizing the free coat check because after about 11, the club got more crowded. The only negative aspect of the experience was that the 90s music provided by the DJ gave way to just beats by 1 AM, so I decided to call it a night once I couldn't belt out the words to Backstreet Boys any longer.   Overall, it was a very enjoyable experience and I highly recommend this venue for birthday parties, alumni reunion events, or just a great night out!

2Yg3D3xUNNzmn-SicXZOnA.review_text: I hosted my birthday here this year, and the manager and the staffs were amazing! It was also very sweet for the manager to personally find me and hand me a birthday tiara as well as some VIP passes. I also came back to dance a few months later, t was still super fun and awesome. I was in line after 11pm, and the line moved pretty fast. There's also a $10 cover. Downstair bar area was narrow so it was pretty packed. There's also a bouncer to let people up and down from the dance floor depends on its capacity. Safety first right?   I LOVE how they play 90s music! The dance floor upstair was small but it was super cool that there's a large screen with music video playing in the background. It's like I'm totally catching up on my music as well as music videos I'd never seen before. The bar staffs were nice, and got drinks pretty quick!

BcHzQ0UPvsrSANhoHLC4eA.review_text: Tuesdays at the raven are where it's at. With dzu and Garrett, you really can't go wrong. Sweethearts who go above and behind you fulfill your every whim. Get into it!

mI7qhszlDChPNbaQy9AHIw.review_text: Right next door to Bloodhound, Raven was pretty much empty when we got there. Mostly because EVERYONE was at Bloodhound getting their drinks on. Don't get me wrong, this doesnt mean Raven is horrible. In fact, I had a ball at Raven, especially since we were drunk and just wanted to let loose. That meant, there was no one on the dance floor and we proceeded to be ridiculous and dance and sing our hearts out. I can't say much for the drinks, but the video dance floor upstairs is pretty legit. It's small, but was nice. Downstairs had more seating and was more of a lounge feel. All in all, 4 stars just because of the amazing time I had.

_gdCJzW3ON56WjcuVlWaBg.review_text: Great bar, great staff. Drinks were very affordable, such a rare treat in SF. 90s night was fun, went for a friends birthday party. No hassle with reservations. So glad to have found this spot.

_0U8eYu96-wwI4uR26aj_g.review_text: New joint in SoMa. Looks loungy and low-key from the outside. A little too loud and clubby on the inside. Except without the space to dance. Though they haven't had their grand opening yet, so perhaps at that point they will have more of a dance floor (there will be two levels, or so I read).  They have reasonably priced signature cocktails (all under $10) and my vodka tonic was made with Skyy without even my asking. (And I think it was only $5!) So plusses for that.  Another plus: my Polish-American roommate and her friend (also Polish-American) were gushing about how this place served one very Polish vodka (not Belvedere, you ignorami! Zubrowka, which is some buffalo grass-infused vodka you don't see very often in American bars). So, if you're into lesser-known, foreign booze, try them out I guess!  Just turn the music down, please.

ma3r4D8KZ0Ksjpv-sU0QJw.review_text: This place is pretty fun, but it gets sooo crowded. I came on a Friday night for my friend's birthday event and it was really hard to move around anywhere without brushing against people. Besides that though, I have no complaints about this place. The bartenders are super efficient and attentive compared to other bars despite the crazy amount of people inside. That is so rare for any bar. I never had to wait more than a couple of minutes to get a drink! It was also nice that there were 3 different bars inside (2 downstairs, 1 upstairs) with self-serve water stations. As for music, they play mostly hip hop and there's a dance floor upstairs, but they closed it off due to maximum capacity a couple of times. I had a good time here and wouldn't mind coming back on another night!

wkAl7GleLMb-UQbNK3GNQQ.review_text: You say you want non-pretentious fun with 90's hip-hop(and later) music to dance to, stiff drinks, and super cool management and staff that's easy to deal with? Go to Raven then.  Their public guest-list gets you in for free before 11 pm or else it's $10. There are two bars downstairs with four booths(that can be reserved ahead of time), and a dance area in between the booths. There is another bar, private table, and main dance floor upstairs which by the wee hours of the night could get congested as the staircase traffic is regulated.   The GM, David, was super friendly and thorough to deal with when I reserved a table, and all of their staff provided superior customer service during the entire night.

HksMj2RBkQmaDTLaYML3BQ.review_text: This review is for their "night club."  A friend was hosting her birthday here and had a table. We got there around 10:40 ish because let's be real, no one is ever at the club before 11.We were waiting in the cold, and inhaling the yummy bacon wrapped hot dogs next to us. We stood in line for an hour and didn't get in till close to 12.  It's not because they want too seem popular like other clubs by holding up the line; it's because it's a super TINY venue and they were at max capacity. The only way the line is going to move is when people leave. By tiny,I mean about 50 people max downstairs. When it came time for us to get in, we had to pay cover! $10. Blasphemy! Girls usually get in for free. I thought their "drive thru" cashier style was incredibly tacky. The place is okay but decorated with cheesy, and cheap "happy birthday" banners over each table. EKKKS! It's not a kids party. 2 star because the bartenders were friendly and quick. And plus one for music because it wasn't all EDM or house. There was a plethora of 90s flashback hip-hop and pop music. I distinctly remember singing along to some Nsync tunes. If she don't know who Nsync is, then she's too young for you bro!

w7IAYU_xz0Wjq7_sip22KA.review_text: This proved to be a fantastic happy hour spot. The bar tender was friendly and accommodating. He had good knowledge of the house wines and their flavor notes. The house pinot grigio was far above average for a happy hour wine and a great deal. I enjoyed the music and overall friendly vibe. I would definitely come here again for happy hour.

Ar2aFhvx5pG1Gmzm7uZ59Q.review_text: I HAD HIGH HOPES FOR YOU, RAVEN.  I came here to celebrate my 24th birthday after hearing amazing things about it.  And very much appreciated the guestlist.  I didn't think I was going to get a table, but ended up e-mailing Raven and asking for one anyways.  They told me they had one last table available, so of course, I took it.    UNFORTUNATELY, when I got there, the table was more of... an arm rest, for lack of a better description.  My "table" was pretty much a tall table you dump your finished drinks on.  The line to get upstairs was also ridiculous.  I got up, but received texts from my friends all night who waited forever in the line.  Being that I was upstairs, I knew that it really wasn't that packed upstairs and they just weren't letting everyone up.  TO BE FAIR.  I am a huge fan of EDM, but also enjoy throwback music.  I had fun because I was there with people I love being surrounded by (and probably because I was celebrating my birthday, so the drinks were flowing), but I definitely was not completely feeling the hiphop/90's music.  I probably wouldn't go back to Raven for awhile.  Plus side, one of my friends wasn't feeling well and was outside and the bouncers gave her tons of water bottles. +1 star for awesome bouncers!

hPFN9Te9Fw6tTtBNLpGJig.review_text: I had my birthday party there Sat night. David was super responsive and reserved the upstairs space for free- though we ended up dancing the entire time! I was able to email my guest list to him rather than use the web interface, which means I didn't have to paste 80 names in! It gets a bit too hot/ stuffy- but I had an amazing time!!!

ASiPcmJHFDu34Yy-xPht-w.review_text: This place is great.   Spacey enough, good drinks, good bartenders, good MUSIC. Love the 90's feel and that big projector up stairs. Bathrooms aren't an issue here too. There are like 3 restrooms (one public and two private). I would def recommend this joint to anyone.

zKjnzaHojLBSXndsW-_W5Q.review_text: When I first heard that we were going to hold our after party to celebrate my birthday at Raven, I honestly wasn't sure what to expect. Boy, was I pleasantly surprised! My fiance was able to pre-arrange with the GM a nice booth to hold our party of 20 and they even had birthday decorations on the wall, and a birthday crown for me to wear. I was so very impressed! At the last minute we decided to not have my birthday cake at dinner and so we brought the cake into Raven hoping they could accommodate us. Again, David the GM, instantly sprang into action and grabbed a server to bring over forks, plates, serving knife, and even a candle for me.  The service at the bar was amazing also! The wait at 11pm wasn't bad and when one of the bartenders heard it was my birthday he bought my girlfriend and I a drink(and it was a double drink, at least). Later in the night, when I needed some water and I was about to pour some from self service bottle at the bar, the bartender instantly handed me two bottled waters without me saying a word. I don't remember receiving such friendly and warm service at a bar.  There are two bars on the first floor and because I was having such a good time dancing with my friends in front our booth near the back bar, I didn't venture upstairs, where my friends said it was packed like sardines.  The music all night was 90's, and mostly hip hop, which is fabulous for dancing and just having a good time. I think we all hear enough EDM these days to take a break from it once in a while.

nyXNNLKjSWtDQka5PrFoew.review_text: I guess the secret is out because Raven sometimes get ridiculously crowded. Yet I still love this place. And I've been a little ashamed to say I've been here numerous times in the last few months. So often that my friends are commenting on my photos "again???". Yes. Again. Don't judge me. And just come drink with me.   There's something about the semi-divey feel of Raven, the casual attire, the random mix of music videos and songs, no cover, and lightning fast bartenders that gets me every time. No overpriced drinks, no pretentious people, no slutty dresses, and no painful stilettos.   Even though it's a bar, capacity reaches its limit so arrive early to avoid a wait.

z1ZFK9d-N4aI0EL0eY7D9Q.review_text: For those of you who are looking for a bar that will provide you with a decent drink and good music, this is NOT the place. We went in to this bar after dinner at around 10:00pm and the bar was empty. We ordered quite a few drinks and every single one of them was weak. I can assure you my gin tonics were around 99.9% tonics with little to none gin. Some reviewers say their drinks were good. Well, a margarita can taste good too if it tastes like a lemonade but that's not what you are paying for. The bartenders are somewhat friendly but nothing to rave about. The music is great if you like the same music with a lot of repetitions. The DJ was unwilling to take our songs' requests which was kind of unusual. How could you be a DJ and refuse to take songs request? It's like a Chef refuses to cook. Understanding the bar was empty so it wasn't like he had his hands full. Given this bar is located in San Francisco and people have great choices to choose from I can't see why people would spend their good earned money there when they don't even have the very few basic things that a bar should have.

L3GWuD2vJbsMGlzrtZtDJw.review_text: Novina was the bartender that catered to my group. She is pretty amazing at what she does. Makes GREAT drinks! Not a single disappointment. Also very friendly and chatted with us.   Raven bar has 3 sections - a front bar area - more like a long aisle, an inside cozy area - more suited for an intimate setting and an upstairs where its mostly a dance floor. This worked out really well for us because we mostly chatted over drinks in the back room and then in between our drinks, went upstairs to burn all those calories off - yeah I am only saying that now because I am sober! haha :P  Parking can be an issue but again where in SF do you not have parking issues!? right?
